Indeed, my Lord is Knowing of their plot." He said, "What was the matter with you when you sought to seduce Joseph?" They said, "God forbid! We know nothing of evil about him." The wife of al-'Aziz said, "Now the truth has become clear. I did seek to seduce him, and indeed, he is of the truthful." That is so that he may know that I did not betray him in secret, and that God does not guide the plot of the treacherous. And I do not acquit myself. Indeed, the soul is a persistent enjoiner of evil, except for that upon which my Lord has mercy. Indeed, my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful." And the king said, "Bring him to me, that I may attach him to myself." And when he spoke to him, he said, "Indeed, you are today with Us established and trustworthy." He said, "Appoint me over the storehouses of the land. Indeed, I am a knowing guardian." And thus We established Joseph in the land, that he might settle therein wherever he wills. We bestow Our mercy upon whom We will, and We do not allow to be lost the reward of the doers of good. And the reward of the Hereafter is better for those who believe and are fearing God.

And Joseph's brothers came and entered upon him, and he recognized them, but they did not recognize him. And when he had furnished them with their provisions, he said, "Bring me a brother of yours from your father. Do you not see that I give full measure, and I am the best of hosts? But if you do not bring him to me, you will have no measure with me, nor shall you come near." They said, "We will surely persuade his father about him, and we will surely do so." And he said to his young men, "Put their merchandise in their saddlebags that they may recognize it when they return to their families. Perhaps they will return."

So when they returned to their father, they said, "O our father, he has denied us measure, so send our brother with us, and we will surely guard him." He said, "Shall I trust you with him except as I trusted you with his brother before? But Allah is the best guardian, and He is the most merciful of the merciful." And when they opened their baggage, they found their merchandise returned to them. They said, "O our father, what do we desire? This is our merchandise that has been returned to us, and we will provide for our family and guard our brother and get an extra camel load. That is a small load." He said, "I will not send him with you until you give me a pledge in the name of Allah that you will bring him back to me, unless you are surrounded." But when they gave him their pledge, he said, "Allah is Witness over what we say."

And he said, "O my sons, do not enter by one gate, but enter by separate gates. And I cannot avail you at all against Allah. Indeed, the judgment belongs only to Allah. Upon Him I have relied, and upon Him let the reliant rely." And when they entered from where their father had commanded them, it could not avail them at all against Allah except a need in Jacob's soul which he fulfilled. And indeed, he was full of knowledge because of what We taught him, but most of the people do not know.

And when they entered upon Joseph, he took his brother to himself. He said, "Indeed, I am your brother, so do not be sad for what they used to do." So when he had furnished them with their provisions, he put the drinking cup in his brother's saddlebag. Then a crier proclaimed, "O caravan, indeed you are thieves." They said as they approached them, "What are you missing?" They said, "We have lost the king's cup, and whoever brings it will have a camel-load, and I will be responsible for it." They said, "By God, you certainly know that we did not come to cause corruption in the land, nor are we thieves." They said, "Then what is his recompense, if you are lying?" They said, "His recompense is he in whose saddlebag it is found, that is his recompense. Thus do We recompense the wrongdoers." So he began with their vessels before his brother's vessel, then he extracted it from his brother's vessel. Thus did We plan for Joseph. It was not for him to take his brother under the king's law except that God should will. We raise by degrees whom We will, and above every possessor of knowledge is One Knowing."

They said, "If he steals, a brother of his stole before." But Joseph kept it to himself and did not reveal it to them. He said, "You are in a worse position, and God is most knowing of what you describe." They said, "O noble one, indeed he has an old father, so take one of us in his place. Indeed, we see you as one of the doers of good." He said, "God forbid that we should take except him with whom we found our property. Indeed, then we would be wrongdoers."

Then when they despaired of him, they conferred privately. Their eldest said, "Did you not know that your father took a solemn pledge from you in the name of God, and that you had neglected Joseph before? 'I will never leave the land until my father gives me permission or God judges for me. And He is the best of judges.'

Go back to your father and say, "O our father, indeed your son has stolen, and we only testified to what we knew, and we were not guardians of the unseen. And ask the town where we were and the caravan where we came, and indeed, we are truthful." He said, "Rather, your souls have enticed you to do something, so patience is most fitting. Perhaps Allah will bring them all to me. Indeed, it is He who is the Knowing, the Wise." And he turned away from them and said, "Oh, my grief over Joseph!" And his eyes became white from grief, and he was suppressing it. They said, "By Allah, you will not cease remembering Joseph until you become fatally ill or are among the dead." He said, "I only complain of my suffering and my grief to Allah, and I know from Allah that which you do not know. O my sons, go and find out about Joseph and his brother and despair not of relief from Allah. Indeed, no one despairs of relief from Allah except the disbelieving people."

So when they entered upon him, they said, "O noble one, distress has touched us and our family, and we have brought poor merchandise, so give us full measure and be charitable to us. Indeed, Allah rewards the charitable." He said, "Do you know what you did with Joseph and his brother when you were ignorant?" They said, "Are you indeed Joseph?" He said, "I am Joseph, and this is my brother. Allah has conferred favor upon us. Indeed, whoever fears Allah and is patient - then indeed, Allah does not allow to be lost the reward of those who do good." They said, "By Allah, Allah has favored you over us, although we were indeed sinners." He said, "No blame will there be upon you this Day. Allah will forgive you, and He is the Most Merciful of the merciful."

Go with this shirt of mine and cast it over my father's face; he will regain his sight. And bring me all your family.' And when the caravan had departed, their father said, 'Indeed, I sense the fragrance of Joseph, unless you think it is false.' They said, 'By God, you are still in your old error.' But when the bearer of good news came, he cast it over his face, and he regained his sight. He said, 'Did I not tell you that I know from God that which you do not know?'

They said, "O our father, ask forgiveness for us our sins; indeed, we were sinners." He said, "I will ask forgiveness for you from my Lord. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful." So when they entered upon Joseph, he took his parents to him and said, "Enter Egypt, if God wills, in safety." And he raised his parents to the throne, and they fell down before him in prostration. And he said, "O my father, this is the interpretation of my vision of before. My Lord has made it come true. And He was kind to me when He brought me out of prison and brought you from the desert after Satan had sown dissension between me and my brothers. Indeed, my Lord is Subtle to whom He wills. Indeed, it is He who is the Knowing, the Wise. My Lord, You have given me of sovereignty and taught me of the interpretation of dreams. Creator of the heavens and the earth, You are my protector in this world and in the Hereafter. Cause me to die a Muslim and join me with the righteous."

This is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muhammad], and you were not with them when they decided upon their plan while they were plotting. And not most of the people, even if you were eager to do so, would believe. And you do not ask them for any payment for it. It is not but a reminder to the worlds. And how many a sign is there in the heavens and the earth which they pass by while they are turning away from it? And most of them do not believe in Allah except while they associate others with Him. So do they then feel secure that there will not come upon them an overwhelming punishment from Allah or that the Hour will not come upon them suddenly while they do not perceive?

Say, "This is my way. I invite to Allah with insight, I and whoever follows me. And exalted is Allah; and I am not of those who associate others with Allah." And We did not send before you, [O Muhammad], except men to whom We revealed, from the people of the towns. Have they not traveled through the land and observed what was the end of those before them? And the home of the Hereafter is best for those who fear Allah. So will you not reason? Until, when the messengers despaired and thought that they had been denied, there came to them Our victory, and We saved whom We willed, but Our punishment cannot be averted from the criminal people. There was certainly in their stories a lesson for those of understanding. It was not a narrative invented, but a confirmation of that which was before it and a detailed explanation of all things and guidance and mercy for a people who believe.

These are the verses of the Book, and what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, but most of the people do not believe. It is Allah who raised the heavens without pillars that you can see. Then He established Himself on the Throne and subjected the sun and the moon, each running for a specified term. He directs the affair. He details the verses that you may, of the meeting with your Lord, be certain. And it is He who spread out the earth and placed therein firm mountains and rivers. And of all the fruits He made therein two mates. He causes the night to cover the day. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought. And on the earth are neighboring tracts and gardens of grapevines and crops and palm trees, some twin and some unpaired, watered with the same water. And We make some of them excel others in taste. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.

And if you wonder, then wonder is their statement: “When we are dust, shall we then be in a new creation?” Those are the ones who disbelieved in their Lord - and those - the shackles will be around their necks, and those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally. And they ask you to hasten the evil before the good, although there have been examples before them. And indeed, your Lord is full of forgiveness for the people, despite their wrongdoing. And indeed, your Lord is severe in penalty. And those who disbelieve say, “Why was a sign not sent down to him from his Lord?” You are only a warner, and for every people is a guide.

Allah knows what every female bears and what the wombs absorb and what they gain, and everything with Him is by measured measure. Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Great, the Most High. Whether among you is he who conceals his speech or declares it aloud, or he who hides it by night or goes forth by day - He has protectors before him and behind him who guard him by the command of Allah. Indeed, Allah will not change the condition of a people until they change what is in themselves. And when Allah intends ill for a people, there is no repelling it. And they will have besides Him no protector.

It is He who shows you the lightning, [causing] fear and hope, and produces the heavy clouds. And the thunder exalts [Allah] with praise of Him, and [so do] the angels for fear of Him. And He sends the thunderbolts and strikes with them whom He wills while they dispute about Allah, and He is severe in penalty.

His is the true call. And those they invoke besides Him do not respond to them with anything except as one who extends his hands toward water to reach his mouth, but it will not reach it. And the invocation of the disbelievers is not but in error. And to Allah prostrates whoever is in the heavens and the earth, willingly or by compulsion, and so do their shadows in the mornings and the evenings. Say, "Who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth?" Say, "Allah." Say, "Have you taken besides Him protectors who do not possess for themselves any benefit or harm?" Say, "Are the blind and the seeing equal? ​​Or are darkness and light equal? ​​Or have they attributed to Allah partners who created like His creation so that the creation became alike to them?" Say, "Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the One, the Prevailing." He sends down water from the sky, and valleys flow according to their capacity, and the torrent carries a swelling foam. And from that which they heat in the fire in search of adornment or goods is a foam like it. Thus does Allah present truth and falsehood. As for the foam, it vanishes as scum, but that which benefits people remains on the earth. Thus does Allah present examples.

For those who have responded to their Lord is the best [reward]. And for those who have not responded to Him - if they had all that is in the earth and as much more besides it, they would ransom themselves thereby - those will have an evil account, and their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the resting place. Is he who knows that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth like one who is blind? Only those of understanding will remember. Who fulfill the covenant of Allah and do not break the contract. And those who join what Allah has ordered to be joined and fear their Lord and dread the evil account. And those who are patient, seeking the countenance of their Lord and establish prayer and spend from what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, and avert evil with good - those will have the best [final] home. Gardens of Eden - they will enter them, as will those who were righteous among their fathers and their spouses and their descendants. And the angels will enter upon them from every gate. Peace be upon you for what you patiently endured. And excellent is the final home.

And those who break the covenant of Allah after ratifying it and sever that which Allah has ordered to be joined and spread corruption on earth - those will have the curse, and they will have the worst home. Allah enlarges provision for whom He wills and restricts it. And they rejoice in the worldly life. But the worldly life is not compared to the Hereafter except an enjoyment. And those who disbelieve say, "Why was a sign not sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, "Indeed, Allah leaves astray whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him]."

Those who have believed and whose hearts are assured by the remembrance of Allah. Unquestionably, by the remembrance of Allah hearts are assured. Those who have believed and done righteous deeds - for them is bliss and a good place of return.

Thus We have sent you to a nation before which other nations have passed on, that you may recite to them what We have revealed to you, while they disbelieve in the Most Merciful. Say, “He is my Lord; there is no god except Him. Upon Him I rely, and to Him is my return.” And if there had been a Qur’an by which mountains could be moved, or the earth could be split asunder, or the dead could be made to speak by it. Rather, to Allah belongs the command entirely. Have not those who have believed despaired that if Allah willed, He could have guided all people? And those who disbelieve will not cease to be struck by a calamity for what they have done, or it will descend near their home until the promise of Allah comes to pass. Indeed, Allah does not fail in His promise. And messengers before you were mocked, but I granted respite to those who disbelieved; then I seized them, so how was My punishment? Is he who stands over every soul for what it has earned? And they have attributed to Allah partners. Say, “Name them, or do you inform Him of that which he does not know on the earth, or only an outward appearance of speech?” Rather, their plot has been made attractive to those who disbelieve, and they have averted [people] from the way. And he whom Allah sends astray - for him there is no guide. For them is a punishment in the life of this world, and the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe, and there is no protector for them from Allah.

The description of Paradise, which the righteous have been promised, is that beneath it rivers flow, its food is everlasting and its shade is eternal. That is the outcome of those who fear God, and the outcome of the disbelievers is the Fire.

And those to whom We gave the Scripture rejoice in what has been revealed to you, [O Muhammad], but among the factions are those who deny part of it. Say, "I have only been commanded to worship Allah and not to associate anything with Him. To Him I invite, and to Him is my return." And thus We have sent it down as an Arabic judgment. And if you were to follow their desires after what has come to you of knowledge, you would have against Allah neither protector nor helper.

And We had certainly sent messengers before you, and appointed for them wives and offspring. And it was not for a messenger to bring a sign except by permission of Allah. For every term is a decree. Allah blots out what He wills and confirms, and with Him is the Mother of the Book. And if We show you some of what We promise them or cause you to die - your duty is only to convey [the message], and upon Us is the account. Have they not seen that We come to the land, reducing it from its borders? And Allah judges; there is no adjuster of His judgment, and He is swift in account. And those before them had already plotted, but to Allah belongs all plotting. He knows what every soul earns, and the disbelievers will know for whom is the final home. And those who disbelieve say, "You are not a messenger." Say, "Sufficient is Allah as a witness between me and you, and whoever has knowledge of the Book."

Alif, Lam, Ra. This is a Book which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], that you may bring mankind out of darknesses into the light, by permission of their Lord, to the path of the Almighty, the Praiseworthy. To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And woe to the disbelievers from a severe punishment. Those who prefer the life of this world over the Hereafter and avert [people] from the way of Allah and seek to make it crooked - those are in extreme error. And We did not send any messenger except in the language of his people to state clearly to them. So Allah leaves astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And He is the Almighty, the Wise.

And We had certainly sent Moses with Our signs, [saying], "Bring your people out from darknesses into the light and remind them of the days of Allah. Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful." And when Moses said to his people, "Remember the favor of Allah upon you when He delivered you from the people of Pharaoh, who were afflicting you with the worst of torment and slaughtering your sons and sparing your women. And in that was a great trial from your Lord. And when your Lord proclaimed, "If you are grateful, I will surely increase you [in favor]; but if you deny, indeed, My punishment is severe." And Moses said, "If you deny, you and whoever is on the earth entirely - then indeed, Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy."

Has there not come to you the news of those before you - the people of Noah, Aad, and Thamud, and those after them, none knows them but Allah? Their messengers came to them with clear proofs, but they put their hands to their mouths and said, "Indeed, we disbelieve in that with which you have been sent, and indeed, about that to which you invite us, is in disquieting doubt." Their messengers said, "Is there any doubt about Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth? He invites you to forgive you some of your sins and respite you for a specified term." They said, "You are only human beings like us. You want to avert us from that which our fathers used to worship. So bring us a clear authority." Their messengers said to them, "We are only human beings like you, but Allah bestows favor upon whom He wills of His servants. And it was not for us to bring you authority except by Allah's permission. And upon Allah let the believers put their trust. And why should we not put our trust in Allah while He has guided us to our ways? And we will surely be patient over what you have harmed us. And upon Allah let the trustful put their trust."

And those who disbelieved said to their messengers, "We will surely expel you from our land, or you must return to our religion." But their Lord inspired to them, "We will surely destroy the wrongdoers and will surely inhabit you in the land after them." That is for whoever fears My position and fears My threat. And they sought victory, but every obstinate tyrant was disappointed. Behind him is Hell, and he will be given to drink of festering water. He swallows it but can scarcely swallow it. Death comes to him from every side, but he is not to die. Behind him is a severe punishment. The example of those who disbelieve in their Lord is that their deeds are like ashes upon which the wind blows violently on a stormy day. They will not be able to do anything about what they have earned. That is what is the extreme error.
Have you not seen that God created the heavens and the earth in truth? If He wills, He can do away with you and bring forth a new creation. And that is not difficult for God.

And they will all appear before Allah, and the weak will say to those who were arrogant, "Indeed, we were your followers. Can you protect us from the punishment of Allah at all?" They will say, "If Allah had guided us, we would have guided you. It is the same for us whether we are impatient or patient. There is no escape for us." And Satan will say, when the matter has been decided, "Indeed, Allah promised you the promise of truth, and I promised you, but I broke my promise to you. And I had no authority over you except that I invited you and you responded to me. So do not blame me but blame yourselves. I cannot be your savior, nor can you be my savior. Indeed, I have disbelieved in what you associated with Him before. Indeed, for the wrongdoers is a painful punishment." And those who believe and do righteous deeds will be admitted to gardens beneath which rivers flow, to abide therein by permission of their Lord. Their greeting therein is, "Peace."

Have you not considered how Allah presents an example: a good word is like a good tree, whose root is firm and its branches reach to heaven. It brings forth its fruit at all times by permission of its Lord. And Allah presents examples for the people that perhaps they will be reminded. And the example of a bad word is like a bad tree, uprooted from the surface of the earth, having no stability. Allah makes firm those who believe, with the firm word, in the life of this world and in the Hereafter. And Allah sends astray the wrongdoers, and Allah does what He wills.

Have you not considered those who exchanged the favor of Allah for disbelief and settled their people in the home of destruction - Hell, which they will burn in, and wretched is the settlement? And they set up rivals for Allah to mislead [people] from His way. Say, "Enjoy yourselves, for indeed, your destination is the Fire."

Tell My servants who have believed to establish prayer and spend from what We have provided for them, secretly and publicly, before there comes a Day in which there will be no exchange or friendship. It is Allah who created the heavens and the earth and sent down water from the sky and brought forth thereby fruits as provision for you. And He has subjected to you the ships that they may sail through the sea by His command and has subjected to you the rivers. And He has subjected to you the sun and the moon, both constantly pursuing their courses, and He has subjected to you the night and the day. And He has given you of all you asked of Him. And if you should count the favors of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, mankind is [generally] most unjust and ungrateful.

And [mention] when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this city secure and save me and my sons from worshipping idols. My Lord, indeed they have led astray many of the people. So whoever follows me - indeed, he is of me; and whoever disobeys me - indeed, You are Forgiving and Merciful." Our Lord, indeed I have settled some of my descendants in an uncultivated valley near Your sacred House, our Lord, that they may establish prayer. So make hearts among the people incline toward them and provide for them from the fruits that they may be grateful. Our Lord, indeed You know what we conceal and what we declare. And nothing on the earth or in the heaven is hidden from Allah. Praise be to Allah, who has given me, in my old age, Ishmael and Isaac. Indeed, my Lord is the Hearer of supplication. My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and [many] from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication. Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers the Day the account is established."

And never think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only defers them for a Day on which eyes will stare [in horror]. They will rush forward with their heads bowed down, their glances not turning back to them, and their hearts [will be] empty. And warn the people of the Day when the punishment will come to them, and those who did wrong will say, "Our Lord, defers us for a short term; we will respond to Your call and follow the messengers." Did you not swear before that you would not perish? And you dwelt in the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, and it has become clear to you how We dealt with them, and We presented to you examples. And they planned their plan, but with Allah is their plan, although their plan was such that mountains would move.

So never think that Allah will fail to fulfill His promise to His messengers. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution. The Day the earth will be replaced by another earth, and the heavens [as well], and they will emerge before Allah, the One, the Prevailing. And you will see the criminals that Day bound together in shackles, their garments of pitch, and their faces covered with fire. So that Allah may recompense every soul for what it has earned. Indeed, Allah is swift in account. This is a message to mankind that they may be warned thereby and that they may know that He is but One Allah, and that those of understanding may be reminded.

These are the verses of the Book and a clear Qur'an. Perhaps those who disbelieve will wish that they were Muslims. Leave them to eat and enjoy themselves and let hope delude them; they are going to know. And We did not destroy a city but that it had a known decree. No nation can precede its term, nor can they delay it. And they said, "O you to whom the message has been sent down, indeed you are mad. Why do you not bring us the angels, if you should be of the truthful?" We do not send down the angels except with the truth, and they are not then reprieved. Indeed, it is We who sent down the message and indeed, We will be its guardian.

And We had certainly sent before you among the sects of former peoples. And there came not to them a messenger but that they ridiculed him. Thus do We cause it to enter the hearts of the criminals; they will not believe in it, although the precedent of the former peoples has passed away. And even if We opened to them a gate from heaven and they continued therein to ascend, they would surely say, "Our eyes have only been dazzled. Rather, we are a people affected by magic."

And We have certainly placed in the heaven great constellations and have beautified it for the observers. And We have protected it from every accursed devil, Except for one who steals a hearing and is pursued by a clear flame. And the earth We have spread out and placed therein firm mountains and caused to grow therein of every kind of beautiful thing. And We have made for you therein means of livelihood and for those for whom you are not providers. And there is not a thing but that with Us are its depositories. And We do not send it down except according to a known measure. And We send the winds as fertilizing agents, and We send down water from the sky and We give it to you to drink, and you are not its keepers. And indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and We are the inheritors. And We have certainly known those among you who went ahead, and We have certainly known those who came after. And indeed, your Lord - it is He - will gather them. Indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.

And We have certainly created man from clay from an altered black mud. And the jinn We created before from scorching fire. And [mention] when your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I am going to create a human being from clay from an altered black mud. And when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] spirit, then fall down to him in prostration." So the angels prostrated, all of them together, except Iblis. He refused to be with those who prostrated. He said, "O Iblis, what is [the matter] with you that you are not with those who prostrate?" He said, "Never would I prostrate to a human being whom I created from clay from an altered black mud." He said, "Then get out of it, for indeed, you are expelled. And indeed, upon you is the curse until the Day of Judgment." He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected." He said, "Indeed, you are of those reprieved." Until the Day of the appointed time. He said, "My Lord, because You have put me in error, I will surely make [disobedience] attractive to them on the earth, and I will mislead them all - Except for Your chosen servants among them." He said, "This is a path, straight for Me. Indeed, over My servants you will have no authority, except for those who follow you of the deviators." And indeed, Hell is the promised place for them all. It has seven gates, for each of them is a portion allotted.

Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and springs. Enter it in peace, secure. And We will remove whatever is in their breasts of resentment [while they are] brothers facing each other on thrones. No fatigue will touch them therein, nor will they be removed from it. Inform My servants that it is I who am the Forgiving, the Merciful. And that it is My punishment that is the painful punishment.

And inform them about the guests of Abraham. When they entered upon him and said, "Peace." He said, "Indeed, we are of you, and fearful." They said, "Do not fear. Indeed, we give you good tidings of a learned boy." He said, "Have you given me good tidings although old age has touched me? Then with what do you give me good tidings?" They said, "We give you good tidings in truth, so do not be among the despairing." He said, "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord except those astray?" He said, "What is the matter with you, O messengers?" They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals - Except the family of Lot. Indeed, We will save them all - Except his wife - We destined that she will be among those who remain behind."

So when the messengers came to the family of Lot, he said, "Indeed, you are a people who deny." They said, "Rather, we have brought you that about which they were in doubt. And we have brought you the truth, and indeed, we are truthful." So set out with your family during a part of the night and pursue their rear and let not any of you look back and proceed where you are commanded. And We decreed for him that matter - that the rear of these people would be cut off in the morning. And the people of the city came, rejoicing. He said, "Indeed, these are my guests, so do not disgrace me. And fear Allah and do not disgrace me." They said, "Did We not forbid you from the worlds?" He said, "These are my daughters, if you should do something." By your life, they were in their intoxication, wandering blindly. Then the blast seized them while they were shining. Then We turned the upper part of it into the lower part and rained upon them stones of baked clay. Indeed in that are signs for those who take signs. And indeed, it is on a straight path. Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.
And indeed, the companions of the thicket were wrongdoers. So We took retribution from them, and indeed, they are in a clear sign.

And the companions of Al-Hijr denied the messengers. And We gave them Our signs, but they turned away from them. And they used to carve out of the mountains, houses, feeling secure. Then the blast seized them in the morning. But what they used to earn availed them not.
We did not create the heavens and the earth and all that is between them except in truth. And the Hour is coming, so pardon with gracious pardon. Indeed, your Lord is the Creator, the Knowing.

And We have given you, [O Muhammad], seven of the oft-repeated verses and the great Qur’an. [Say:] Do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [some] categories of them, nor grieve over them, and lower your wing to the believers and say, “Indeed, I am the clear warner.”

As We sent down upon the dividers. Who divided the Qur'an into parts. By your Lord, We will surely question them all. About what they used to do. So proclaim openly what you are commanded and turn away from the polytheists. Indeed, We will suffice you against the mockers. Who set up with Allah another deity - they are going to know. And We certainly know that your breast is constrained by what they say. So exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord and be among those who prostrate. And worship your Lord until there comes to you the certainty.

The command of Allah has come, so do not hasten it. Glory be to Him and exalted is He above what they associate with Him. He sends down the angels with the Spirit by His command upon whom He wills of His servants, [saying], “Warn that there is no deity except Me, so fear Me.” He created the heavens and the earth in truth. Exalted is He above what they associate with Him. He created man from a sperm-drop, and at once he is a clear adversary. And the grazing livestock He has created for you; in them is warmth and [numerous] benefits, and from them you eat. And for you there is adornment in them when you drive them home and when you send them out to pasture. And they carry your loads to a land you could not have reached except with difficulty. Indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful. And [He has] the horses, mules, and donkeys for you to ride and as adornment. And He creates that which you do not know. And upon Allah is the direction of the way, and among them are deviants. And if He willed, He could have guided you all.

It is He who sends down water from the sky for you; from it you drink and from it come the vegetation on which you pasture your livestock. He causes thereby to grow for you the crops, the olives, the palm trees, the grapevines, and every kind of fruit. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought. And He has subjected to you the night and the day and the sun and the moon, and the stars are subjected by His command. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason. And He has created for you whatever is on the earth of varying colors. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who remember.

It is He who has subjected the sea so that you may eat tender meat from it and extract from it ornaments which you wear - and you see the ships plowing through it - and that you may seek of His bounty and that you may be grateful.

And He has cast into the earth firm mountains, lest it should shift with you, and rivers and roads that you may be guided. And signs, and by the stars they are guided. Is He who creates like he who does not create? Then will you not be reminded? And if you should count the favors of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

And Allah knows what you conceal and what you declare. And those they invoke besides Allah do not create anything, and they are themselves created. They are dead, not alive, and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected. Your God is one God. As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, their hearts are denying, and they are arrogant. There is no doubt that Allah knows what they conceal and what they declare. Indeed, He does not like the arrogant.

And when it is said to them, "What has your Lord sent down," they say, "Legends of the former peoples" [in Arabic] - that they may bear their own burdens in full on the Day of Resurrection, and also some of the burdens of those whom they misled without knowledge. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear. Those before them plotted, but Allah struck their building from the foundations, so the roof fell upon them from above them, and the punishment came upon them from where they did not perceive. Then on the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and say, "Where are My partners concerning whom you used to dispute?" Those who were given knowledge will say, "Indeed, disgrace and evil are upon the disbelievers today." [They are] those whom the angels take in death while they are wronging themselves. So throw down [their] peace, [saying], "We were not doing any evil." Yes, indeed, Allah is Knowing of what you used to do. So enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein. And evil is the residence of the arrogant.

And it will be said to those who feared God, "What has your Lord revealed?" They will say, "Good." For those who do good in this world is good, and the home of the Hereafter is better. And excellent is the home of the righteous. Gardens of perpetual residence, which they will enter, beneath which rivers flow. They will have therein whatever they wish. Thus does God reward the righteous. Those whom the angels take in death while they are good. They will say, "Peace be upon you. Enter Paradise for what you used to do."

Do they await aught but that the angels should come to them or that the command of your Lord should come? Thus did those before them. And Allah did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves. So the evil of what they did afflicted them, and that which they used to ridicule encompassed them.

Those who associate others with God say, "If God had willed, we would not have worshipped anything besides Him, nor would our fathers, nor would we have forbidden anything besides Him." Thus did those before them. Is there any duty upon the messengers except to convey clearly? And We had already sent among every nation a messenger, [saying], "Worship God and avoid false deities." But among them were those whom God guided, and among them were those upon whom error was justly decreed. So travel through the land and observe what was the end of those who denied. If you are eager for their guidance - then indeed, God does not guide him who goes astray, and they will have no helpers. And they swear by God with their most solemn oaths that God will not resurrect anyone who dies. Yes, [it is] a promise binding upon Him, but most of the people do not know - [this] [this] [verse] - that He may make clear to them that over which they differ and that those who disbelieve may know that they were liars. Our word to a thing when We intend it is only that We say to it, "Be," and it is.

And those who emigrated for the cause of Allah after they had been wronged - We will surely grant them good in this world, and the reward of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew. Those who are patient and upon their Lord rely.

And We did not send before you, [O Muhammad], except men to whom We revealed. So ask the people of the message if you do not know. With clear proofs and scriptures. And We have revealed to you the message that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them and that they might give thought. Then do those who plot evil deeds feel secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them up or that the punishment will not come to them from where they do not perceive? Or that He will seize them in their turning [about] - then they will not escape? Or that He will seize them in fear - then indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful. Have they not seen what Allah has created of things? Its shadows turn to the right and the left, prostrating to Allah, while they are humbled. And to Allah prostrates whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth of creatures and the angels, and they are not arrogant. They fear their Lord above them and do what they are commanded.

And God said, “Do not take two gods. He is only one God, so fear Me.” To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him is the religion, which is pure. Then will you fear other than God? And whatever blessing you have is from God. Then when adversity touches you, to Him you cry for help. Then, when He removes the adversity from you, at once a party of you associate others with their Lord, that they may disbelieve in what We have given them. So enjoy yourselves, and you are going to know.

And they assign to that which they do not know a share of what We have provided them. By Allah, you will surely be asked about what you used to invent. And they attribute to Allah daughters - glory be to Him - while for themselves there is whatever they desire. And when one of them is given the news of a female, his face darkens, and he is filled with inward grief. He hides himself from his people because of the evil of the news he has received. Should he keep her in disgrace or bury her in the dust? Unquestionably, evil is that which they judge. For those who do not believe in the Hereafter is an evil example. But to Allah belongs the highest example. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise. And if Allah were to punish people for their wrongdoing, He would not leave upon it a single creature, but He defers them for a specified term. So when their term comes, they cannot remain behind an hour, nor can they precede it. And they attribute to Allah that which they dislike, and their tongues describe falsely that they will have the best. There is no doubt that they will have the Fire, and that they are transgressors.

By God, We sent to nations before you, but Satan made their deeds pleasing to them. So he is their ally this Day, and for them is a painful punishment. And We did not send down to you the Book except that you may make clear to them that wherein they differed and as guidance and mercy for a people who believe.

And Allah sends down water from the sky, and gives life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who listen. And indeed, for you in the grazing livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from what is in their bellies - between excrement and blood - pure milk, palatable to drinkers. And from the fruits of the palm trees and the grapevines you take intoxicant and good provision. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who reason. And your Lord inspired the bee, saying, "Take hives in the mountains and in the trees and in what they construct. Then eat from all the fruits and follow the ways of your Lord made easy for you." There emerges from their bellies a drink of varying colors in which is healing for people. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.

And Allah created you, then He causes you to die. And among you is he who is returned to the most decrepit age so that he knows nothing after [having] known. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Competent. And Allah has favored some of you over others in provision. But those who are favored would not give their provision to those their right hands possess, so they are equal therein. So is it the favor of Allah that they deny? And Allah has made for you mates from among yourselves and has made for you from your mates sons and grandchildren and has provided for you from the good things. So is it in falsehood that they believe and in the favor of Allah that they deny?

And they worship besides Allah that which possesses for them no provision from the heavens or the earth, nor are they able. So do not make comparisons for Allah. Indeed, Allah knows, while you do not know. Allah presents an example: a slave owned by someone who has no power over a thing, and one to whom We have provided a good provision from Us, so he spends from it secretly and publicly. Are they equal? ​​Praise be to Allah. But most of them do not know. And Allah presents an example: two men, one of them mute and unable to do anything, and he is a burden on his master. Wherever he directs him, he brings no good. Is he equal to one who enjoins justice while he is on a straight path?

To God belongs the unseen of the heavens and the earth. And the matter of the Hour is not but as the blink of an eye or even nearer. Indeed, God is over all things competent. And God brought you forth from the wombs of your mothers not knowing a thing, and He gave you hearing and vision and hearts that you might give thanks. Have they not seen the birds controlled in the atmosphere of the sky? None holds them up except God. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

And Allah has made for you, from your houses, a place of rest. And He has made for you, from the hides of the grazing animals, dwellings which you find light on the day of your travel and the day of your settlement. And from their wool and their fur and their hair, furnishings and provisions for a time. And Allah has made for you, from what He has created, shades, and has made for you shelters from the mountains. And He has made for you garments to protect you from the heat and garments to protect you from your violence. Thus He completes His favor upon you that you may submit. But if they turn away, then upon you is only the clear notification. They recognize the favor of Allah, then they deny it, and most of them are disbelievers.

And the Day We will raise up from every nation a witness, then permission will not be given to those who disbelieved, nor will they be asked to repent. And when those who did wrong see the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved. And when those who associated others with Allah see their associates, they will say, "Our Lord, these are our associates whom we used to invoke besides You." So they will cast down to them the word, "Indeed, you are liars." And they will cast down to Allah that Day peace, and that which they used to invent will depart from them. As for those who disbelieved and averted [people] from the way of Allah - We will increase for them punishment over the punishment because they used to corrupt. And the Day We will raise up from every nation a witness over them from themselves. And We will bring you, [O Muhammad], as a witness over these. And We have sent down to you the Book as clarification for all things and as guidance and mercy and good tidings for the Muslims.

Indeed, Allah commands justice, the doing of good, and liberality to kith and kin, and He forbids immorality, bad conduct, and oppression. He instructs you that you may receive admonition. And fulfill the covenant of Allah when you have made it, and do not break oaths after their confirmation, although you have made Allah, over you, a witness. Indeed, Allah knows that which you do. And do not be like she who untwisted the spun thread after it was strong, taking your oaths as a means of deceit among you - lest one community be more numerous than another. Allah only tests you thereby, and He will make clear to you on the Day of Resurrection that over which you used to differ. And if Allah had willed, He could have made you one community, but He leaves astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And you will surely be questioned about what you used to do.

And do not take your oaths as a means of deception between you, lest your foot slip after it had been firmly planted, and you taste evil for having averted [people] from the way of Allah. And for you is a great punishment. And do not exchange the covenant of Allah for a small price. Indeed, with Allah is better for you, if you only knew. What you have will perish, and what is with Allah is lasting. And We will surely reward those who are patient [in patience] according to the best of what they used to do. Whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer - We will surely cause him to live a good life, and We will surely reward them according to the best of what they used to do.

So when you recite the Qur’an, seek refuge in Allah from Satan, the accursed. Indeed, he has no authority over those who have believed and rely upon their Lord. His authority is only over those who take him as an ally and those who associate others with Him. And when We substitute a verse for another - and Allah is most knowing of what He sends down - they say, "You are only an inventor." But most of them do not know. Say, "The Holy Spirit has brought it down from your Lord in truth to strengthen those who believe and as guidance and good tidings to the Muslims."

And We certainly know that they say, "It is only a human being who teaches him." The language of the one they refer to is foreign, while this is a clear Arabic tongue. Indeed, those who do not believe in the verses of Allah - Allah will not guide them, and they will have a painful punishment. Only those who do not believe in the verses of Allah invent falsehood, and it is those who are the liars. Who disbelieves in Allah after his belief, except for one who is forced thereto [while] his heart is at rest with faith? But as for those who open their breasts to disbelief - upon them is wrath from Allah, and they will have a great punishment. That is because they preferred the life of this world over the Hereafter, and because Allah does not guide the disbelieving people. Those are the ones whose hearts, hearing and vision Allah has sealed, and it is those who are the heedless. There is no doubt that in the Hereafter they will be the losers.

Then indeed, your Lord is for those who emigrated after they were persecuted and then strove and were patient - indeed, your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful. The Day every soul will come disputing for itself, and every soul will be fully compensated for what it did, and they will not be wronged.

And God presents an example: a town that was safe and secure, its provision coming to it in abundance from every location, but it denied the favors of God. So God made it taste the envelopment of hunger and fear for what they used to do. And there had already come to them a messenger from among themselves, but they denied him, so the punishment seized them while they were wrongdoers.

So eat of what Allah has provided for you [which is] lawful and good, and be grateful for the favor of Allah, if it is Him that you worship. He has only forbidden you dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limits] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful. And do not say about what your tongues put forth falsely, "This is lawful" and "this is unlawful," inventing a lie about Allah. Indeed, those who invent a lie about Allah will not succeed. [This is] a brief enjoyment, and theirs is a painful punishment. And as for the Jews, We did forbid what We related to you before. And We did not wrong them, but they were wronging themselves. Then indeed, your Lord is to those who did evil in ignorance and then repented after that and reformed - indeed, your Lord, after that, is Forgiving and Merciful.

Indeed, Abraham was a nation obedient to Allah, inclining toward truth, and he was not of those who associate others with Allah. He was grateful for His blessings. He chose him and guided him to a straight path. And We gave him good in this world, and indeed, in the Hereafter, he will be among the righteous. Then We revealed to you, [O Muhammad], [saying], “Follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth, and he was not of those who associate others with Allah.” The Sabbath was only made obligatory for those who differed therein. And indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.

Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good instruction, and argue with them in a way that is best. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has strayed from His way, and He is most knowing of who is [rightly] guided. And if you punish, punish with the equivalent of that with which you were afflicted. But if you are patient, it is better for the patient. And be patient, and your patience is not but through Allah. And do not grieve over them and do not be in distress over what they plot. Indeed, Allah is with those who fear Him and those who are doers of good.

Glory be to Him who took His servant by night from al-Masjid al-Haram to al-Masjid al-Aqsa, whose surroundings We have blessed, to show him of Our signs. Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Seeing.

And We gave Moses the Scripture and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel, “Do not take besides Me a guardian.” [The descendants of those We carried with Noah. Indeed, he was a grateful servant.] And We decreed to the Children of Israel in the Scripture, “You will surely cause corruption on the earth twice, and you will surely reach [a state of] great haughtiness.” But when the promise of the first of the two came, We sent against you servants of Ours of great might, and they penetrated into the dwellings, and it was a promise fulfilled. Then We gave you back the upper hand over them and reinforced you with wealth and children and made you more numerous in manpower. If you do good, you do good for yourselves, and if you do evil, you do it to yourselves. But when the promise of the last comes, they will disfigure your faces and enter the temple as they entered it the first time and destroy with utter destruction what they had exalted. Perhaps your Lord will have mercy upon you. But if you return [to evil], We will return [to evil] and make Hell, for the disbelievers, a prison.

Indeed, this Qur’an guides to that which is most upright and gives good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a great reward. And that those who do not believe in the Hereafter - We have prepared for them a painful punishment. And man invokes evil as he invokes good, and ever is man hasty.

And We have made the night and the day two signs, and We erased the sign of the night and made the sign of the day visible - that you may seek bounty from your Lord and that you may know the number of years and account. And We have detailed all things in detail. And We have fastened every person's fate to his neck, and We will produce for him on the Day of Resurrection a book which he will find wide open. [Saying], "Read your record. Sufficient is yourself this Day as accountant against you. Whoever is guided is only guided for his own soul, and whoever goes astray only goes astray to its detriment. And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And We never punish until We have sent a messenger. And when We desire to destroy a city, We command its affluent ones, but they defiantly disobey therein; so the word comes into effect upon it, and We destroy it with [complete] destruction. And how many generations have We destroyed after Noah? And sufficient is your Lord, concerning the sins of His servants, as Acquainted and Seeing.

Whoever desires the immediate, We hasten for him from it what We will for whom We intend. Then We have assigned for him Hell, which he will burn, blamed and expelled. But whoever desires the Hereafter and strives for it with the necessary effort while he is a believer - for those, their effort is ever appreciated. Both - We provide for these and those from the gift of your Lord, and the gift of your Lord is not restricted. See how We have preferred some over others. And the Hereafter is greater in degrees and greater in preference.

Do not make with Allah another god, lest you sit down blamed and forsaken. And your Lord has decreed that you not worship except Him, and to parents, good treatment. Whether one or both of them attain old age [while] with you, say not to them a word of disrespect, nor repel them but address them with a generous word. And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy and say, "My Lord, have mercy upon them as they brought me up [when I was] small." Your Lord is most knowing of what is within your souls. If you should be righteous - then indeed, He is ever, to the frequently turning [to Him], Forgiving. And give to the relative his right and [also] the needy and the traveler. And spend not wastefully. Indeed, the wasteful are brothers of the devils, and ever has Satan been to his Lord ungrateful. But if you turn away from them, seeking mercy from your Lord which you hope for, then speak to them a gentle word. And do not make your hand [as] chained to your neck nor stretch it forth completely [into submission], lest you sit down blamed and destitute. Indeed, your Lord extends provision to whom He wills and restricts it. Indeed, He is ever, of His servants, Acquainted and Seeing.

And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We will provide for them and for you. Indeed, their killing is ever a great sin. And do not come near unlawful sexual intercourse. Indeed, it is ever an immorality and an evil way. And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden, except by right. And whoever is killed unjustly - We have given his heir authority, but let him not exceed limits in [the matter of] taking life. Indeed, he has been supported. And do not approach the property of an orphan, except in a way that is best, until he reaches maturity. And fulfill [all] covenants. Indeed, covenants will be questioned about. And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with a straight balance. That is better and more suitable in [the final] outcome.

And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those one will be questioned. And do not walk upon the earth exultantly. Indeed, you will never tear the earth apart, and you will never reach the mountains in height. All that is ever evil in the sight of your Lord, hateful. That is from what your Lord has revealed to you of wisdom. And do not set up with Allah another deity [i.e., Allah], lest you be thrown into Hell, blameworthy and banished.

Has your Lord chosen you for sons and taken for Himself daughters from among the angels? Indeed, you are saying a terrible word. And We have certainly diversified in this Qur’an that they may be reminded, but it only increases them in aversion. Say, “If there had been with Him gods as they say, then they would have sought a way to the Lord of the Throne.” Glory be to Him and He is far above what they say, far exalted. The seven heavens and the earth and whoever is in them exalt Him. And there is not a thing but exalts Him with praise, but you do not understand their exaltation. Indeed, He is Forbearing and Forgiving.

And when you recite the Qur'an, We place between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter an invisible veil. And We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Qur'an, they turn their backs in aversion. We are most knowing of what they listen to when they listen to you, and when they are in private conversation, when the wrongdoers say, "You follow none but a man bewitched." See how they strike for you examples, but they have gone astray and are unable to find a way.

And they say, “When we are bones and dust, shall we indeed be resurrected as a new creation?” Say, “Be you stones or iron, or a creation of whatever is greater within your breasts.” And they will say, “Who will restore us?” Say, “He who created you the first time.” And they will shake their heads at you and say, “When is that?” Say, “Perhaps it will be near.” The Day He will call you, and you will respond with His praise and think that you remained only a little.

And tell My servants to say that which is best. Indeed, Satan induces dissension among them. Indeed Satan has ever been to man a clear enemy. Your Lord is most knowing of you. If He wills, He will have mercy upon you; or if He wills, He will punish you. And We have not sent you over them as a guardian. And your Lord is most knowing of who is in the heavens and the earth. And We have certainly preferred some prophets over others, and We gave David the Psalms. Say, "Call upon those you claim besides Him; they do not possess the power to remove distress from you, nor to transfer [anything]."

Those who call upon Allah, seeking a means of approach to their Lord - which of them is nearest - and they hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is ever to be feared. And there is no city but that We will destroy it before the Day of Resurrection or punish it with a severe punishment. That is ever inscribed in the Book.

And nothing prevented Us from sending signs except that the former peoples denied them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign, but they wronged her. And We send the signs only as a warning. And when We said to you, "Indeed, your Lord encompasses the people." And We made the vision which We showed you only a trial for the people and [also] the accursed tree in the Qur'an. And We frighten them, but it only increases them in great transgression.

And remember when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblis. He said, "Should I prostrate to one You created from clay?" He said, "Have you seen this one You have honored above me? If You should delay me until the Day of Resurrection, I will surely destroy his descendants, all but a few." He said, "Go! And whoever of them follows you, indeed, Hell will be your recompense - an ample recompense. And incite whomever you can among them with your voice and assault them with your cavalry and infantry and share with them in wealth and children and make promises to them. But Satan does not promise them except delusion. Indeed, over My servants you have no authority. And sufficient is your Lord as Disposer of affairs."

Your Lord is He who drives the ship for you through the sea that you may seek of His bounty. Indeed, He is to you Merciful. And when harm touches you at sea, lost are those you invoke except Him. But when He brings you safe to land, you turn away. And ever is man ungrateful. Do you then feel secure that He will not cause a part of the land to swallow you up or send upon you a violent storm, then you would not find for yourself a protector? Or do you feel secure that He will not return you into it another time and send upon you a violent storm of wind and drown you because you disbelieved, then you would not find for yourself against Us any protector for it? And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with [definite] preference.

The Day We will call every people with their leader. Then whoever is given his record in his right hand - those will read their record, and they will not be wronged a thread. And whoever is blind in this [world] will be blind in the Hereafter and even more astray from the way. And indeed they almost tempted you away from that which We revealed to you in order that you might invent something else about Us. And in that case they would have taken you as a friend. And had We not strengthened you, you would have almost inclined to them a little. Then We would have made you taste double [the punishment of] life and double [the punishment of] death. Then you would not have found for yourself against Us any helper. And indeed they almost tempted you to leave the land in order to expel you from it. And in that case they would not remain [following] you except a little. [This is] the way of those of Our messengers We sent before you, and you will not find in Our way any change.

Establish prayer at the decline of the sun until the darkness of the night and [also] recite the Qur’an at dawn. Indeed, the recitation of the Qur’an at dawn is ever witnessed. And during part of the night, pray with it as an additional prayer for you. Perhaps your Lord will raise you to a position of praise. And say, “My Lord, let me enter an entrance of truth and let me exit an exit of truth and grant me from Yourself a supporting authority.” And say, “The truth has come, and falsehood has perished. Indeed, falsehood is [bound to] perish.” And We send down of the Qur’an that which is healing and mercy for the believers, but it does not increase the wrongdoers except in loss.

And when We bestow favor upon man, he turns away and distances himself; but when evil touches him, he is despairing. Say, "Each one acts according to his nature. But your Lord is most knowing of who is best guided in the way." And they ask you about the spirit. Say, "The spirit is of the affair of my Lord. And of knowledge you have not been given except a little. And if We willed, We could surely take away that which We have revealed to you, then you would not find for yourself concerning it a protector against Us - except for the mercy of your Lord. Indeed, His favor upon you has ever been great."

Say, "If mankind and the jinn gathered in order to produce the like of this Qur'an, they could not produce the like of it, even if they were to each other assistants." And We have certainly presented for the people in this Qur'an from every [kind of] example, but most of the people refuse except disbelief.

And they said, "We will not believe in you until you cause a spring to gush forth for us from the earth, or you have a garden of palm trees and grapes and cause rivers to gush forth within it abundantly, or you cause the sky to fall upon us in fragments, as you claim, or you bring Allah and the angels before you, or you have a house of gold or you ascend into the heaven. And we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book that we can read." Say, "Glory be to my Lord! Are you anything but a human messenger?" And nothing prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them except that they said, "Has Allah sent a human messenger?" Say, "If there were upon the earth angels walking securely, We would have sent down to them from the heaven an angel as a messenger." Say, "Sufficient is Allah as a Witness between me and you. Indeed, He is ever, of His servants, Acquainted and Seeing."

And he whom Allah guides - he is the one who is guided. And he whom He leaves astray - you will not find for them any protectors besides Him. And We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf. Their refuge is Hell. Every time it subsides, We increase them in Blaze. That is their recompense because they disbelieved in Our verses and said, "When we are bones and crumbs, will we indeed be resurrected as a new creation?" Do they not see that Allah, who created the heavens and the earth, is able to create the likes of them and has appointed for them a term about which there is no doubt? But the wrongdoers refuse except disbelief. Say, "If you possessed the treasures of the mercy of my Lord, then you would withhold for fear of spending." And man is ever niggardly.

And We had given Moses nine clear signs, so ask the Children of Israel when he came to them and Pharaoh said to him, "Indeed, I think, O Moses, you are affected by magic." He said, "Indeed, you know that none has sent down these [signs] except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as insight. And indeed, I think, O Pharaoh, that you are doomed." So he intended to expel them from the land, but We drowned him and all who were with him. And We said after him to the Children of Israel, "Dwell in the land, but when the promise of the Hereafter comes to pass, We will bring you forth in a mixed crowd."

And with the truth We have sent it down, and with the truth it has descended. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And [this is] a Qur’an which We have divided into parts in order that you may recite it to the people over a period of time. And We have revealed it by progressive revelation. Say, “Believe in it or do not believe.” Indeed, those who were given knowledge before it, when it is recited to them, fall upon their faces in prostration and say, “Glory be to our Lord. Indeed, the promise of our Lord has been fulfilled.” And they fall upon their faces weeping, and it increases them in humility. Say, “Call upon Allah or call upon the Most Merciful. Whichever [name] you call upon, to Him belong the best names. And do not recite your prayer aloud, nor be in a low voice therein, but seek between that a way. And say, “Praise be to Allah, who has not taken a son and has not had a partner in dominion and has not had a protector out of weakness.” And glorify Him with all glorification.

Praise be to Allah, who has sent down to His Servant the Book and has not made therein any crookedness - straight - to warn of a severe punishment from Him and to give good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a good reward, abiding therein forever. And to warn those who say, "Allah has taken a son." They have no knowledge of that, nor did their fathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths. They speak nothing but a lie. So perhaps you would kill yourself through grief over them, if they do not believe in this message.
Indeed, We have made what is on the earth adornment for it that We may test them as to which of them is best in deed. And indeed, We will make what is on it [another] barren plain.

Or do you think that the People of the Cave and the Inscription were, among Our signs, a wonder? When the youths took refuge in the cave and said, "Our Lord, grant us from Yourself mercy and prepare for us from our affair right guidance." So We sealed their ears within the cave for a number of years. Then We raised them up that We might test which of the two parties would best calculate the term that they had tarried. We relate to you, [O Muhammad], their story in truth. Indeed, they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance. And We strengthened their hearts when they stood up and said, "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. Never will we invoke besides Him any deity. We would have certainly spoken insolently then." These are our people; they have taken gods besides Him. Why do they not produce for them a clear authority? Who is more unjust than he who invents a lie about Allah? And when you withdraw from them and that which they worship except Allah, then take refuge in the Cave. Your Lord will spread out for you from His mercy and will prepare for you from your affair ease.

And you would see the sun, when it rose, inclining away from their cave on the right, and when it set, passing by them on the left, while they were in an open space thereof. That is from the signs of Allah. He whom Allah guides - he is the one who is guided, and he whom He sends astray - you will not find for him a protector to guide him. And you would think them awake, while they are asleep. And We turned them on the right and on the left, and their dog was stretching out his forelegs at the entrance. If you had looked at them, you would have turned away from them in flight, and you would have been filled with terror of them. And thus We raised them up that they might question one another. One of them said, "How long have you remained?" They said, "We have remained a day or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord is most knowing of how long you have remained. So send one of you with this silver of yours to the city and let him see which of it has the best food, and let him bring you provision from it and let him be gentle and not let anyone inform you of you. Indeed, if they gain victory over you, they will stone you or return you to their religion. And never will you succeed then, ever."

And thus We caused them to find themselves, that they might know that the promise of Allah is true and that there is no doubt about the Hour, when they disputed among themselves about their affair and said, "Construct over them a structure." Their Lord is most knowing of them. Those who prevailed in their affair said, "We will surely take over them a mosque." They will say, "Three, with their dog as their fourth." And they will say, "Five, with their dog as their sixth," guessing at the unseen. And they will say, "Seven, with their dog as their eighth." Say, "My Lord is most knowing of their number. None knows them except a few." So do not dispute about them except with an outward dispute, and do not consult anyone of them about them.

And never say of anything, "I will do that tomorrow," except [in the event], "If Allah wills." And remember your Lord when you forget and say, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to something nearer than this in right conduct."

And they remained in their cave three hundred years, and added nine. Say, "God knows best how long they remained. To Him belongs the unseen of the heavens and the earth. He sees and hears it. They have not besides Him any protector, and He does not share in His rule anyone."

And recite what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. There is no changing His words, and you will never find besides Him a refuge. And keep yourself patient with those who call upon their Lord morning and evening, seeking His countenance. And let not your eyes pass beyond them, desiring adornments of the worldly life. And do not obey one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance and who follows his desire and whose affair is ever in neglect.

And say, "The truth is from your Lord. So whoever wills - let him believe; and whoever wills - let him disbelieve." Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a Fire whose walls will encompass them. And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like murky oil, which will scald their faces. Evil is the drink, and evil is the resting place. Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - never will We allow to be lost the reward of any who did well in deeds. For those are Gardens of Eden, beneath which rivers flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and will wear green garments of fine silk and heavy brocade, reclining therein on couches. Excellent is the reward and excellent is the resting place.

And present to them an example: two men: We made for one of them two gardens of grapevines, and surrounded them with palm trees, and placed between them crops. Both gardens produced their fruit, and you did not fail to do so, and We caused a river to gush forth within them. And he had fruit, so he said to his companion while he was conversing with him, "I am greater than you in wealth and stronger in men." And he entered his garden while he was wronging himself. He said, "I do not think that this will ever perish, nor do I think that the Hour will occur. And if I am returned to my Lord, I will surely find better than it as a return." His companion said to him while he was conversing with him, "Have you disbelieved in He who created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then proportioned you as a man? But He is Allah, my Lord, and I associate none with my Lord." And why, when you entered your garden, did you not say, "What Allah wills; there is no power except with Allah." If you see that I am less than you in wealth and children? But perhaps my Lord will give me better than your garden and send upon it a reckoning from the sky and it will become a slippery ground, or its water will become sunken, so that you will not be able to seek it. And his fruits were surrounded, so he began to turn his hands over what he had spent on it, while it lay empty on its trellises, and he said, “Oh, I wish I had not associated anyone with my Lord.” And he had no group to aid him other than God, nor could he be victorious. There is guardianship for God, the Truth. He is the best in reward and the best in outcome.

And present to them the example of the life of this world: it is like water which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth mingles with it and then becomes dry straw which the winds scatter. And ever is God over all things competent. Wealth and children are the adornment of the life of this world. But the lasting righteous deeds are better in the sight of your Lord for reward and better for hope.

And the Day We set the mountains in motion and you see the earth barren and We gather them and do not leave out one of them. And they are presented before your Lord in rows, [saying], "You have certainly come to Us as We created you the first time. Rather, you claimed, 'Will We not make for you an appointment?'" And the record is placed, and you see the criminals fearful of that within it, and they say, "Oh, woe to us! What is this record that leaves nothing small or great but that it has enumerated it?" And they will find what they did present. And your Lord does not wrong anyone.

And when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblis. He was one of the jinn and disobeyed the command of his Lord. Then will you take him and his descendants as allies instead of Me while they are to you an enemy? An evil exchange for the wrongdoers. I did not make them witness to the creation of the heavens and the earth or to the creation of themselves, nor would I have taken the misguiders as assistants. And the Day He will say, "Call upon My associates whom you claim," and they will call upon them, but they will not respond to them. And We placed between them a barrier of destruction. And the criminals will see the Fire and think that they are going to fall into it, but they will find no escape from it.

And We have certainly presented for the people in this Qur'an from every [kind of] example, but man has ever been, most of anything, argumentative. And nothing prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them and from asking forgiveness of their Lord except that there should come to them the precedent of the former peoples or that the punishment should come to them beforehand. And We do not send the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. And those who disbelieve argue with falsehood to invalidate thereby the truth, and they take My verses and that with which they are warned in ridicule.

And who is more unjust than he who is reminded of the verses of his Lord but turns away from them and forgets what his hands have put forth? Indeed, We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if you should invite them to guidance, they will never be guided.
