And your Lord is the Forgiving, the Possessor of Mercy. If He were to impose blame upon them for what they have earned, He would have hastened for them the punishment. Rather, for them is an appointed time from which they will not find any refuge. And those cities - We destroyed them when they wronged, and We appointed for their destruction an appointed time.

And remember when Moses said to his boy, "I will not cease until I reach the junction of the two seas, or I will continue for a long time." But when they reached the junction of the two, they forgot their fish, and it took its way into the sea, slipping away. But when they had passed, he said to his boy, "Bring us our breakfast. We have certainly suffered from this our journey, [and] none made me forget to mention it except Satan, and it took its way into the sea, astonishing." He said, "That is what we were seeking." So they returned, following in their footsteps, telling stories. Then they found a servant from among Our servants to whom We had given mercy from Us and had taught him knowledge from Us. Moses said to him, "Shall I follow you so that you may teach me of what you have been taught of sound judgment?" He said, "Indeed, you will never be able to have patience with me. And how can you be patient about that of which you have not encompassed knowledge?" He said, "You will find me, if Allah wills, patient, and I will not disobey you in anything." He said, "Then if you follow me, do not ask me about anything until I make mention of it to you." So they set out, until, when they embarked in the ship, he pierced it. He said, "Have you pierced it to drown its people? You have certainly done a terrible thing." He said, "Did I not tell you that you would never be able to have patience with me?" He said, "Do not hold me accountable for what I forgot and do not overburden me with my affair." So they set out, until when they met a boy, he killed him. He said, "Have you killed a pure soul without a soul? You have certainly done a horrible thing." He said, "Did I not tell you that you would never be able to have patience with me?" He said, "If I ask you about anything after this, do not keep me company; you have received from me an excuse." So they set out, until when they came to the people of a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to entertain them. They found therein a wall about to collapse, so he restored it. He said, "If you had wished, you could have taken payment for it."

He said, "This is parting between me and you. I will inform you of the interpretation of that over which you could not have patience. As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working at sea, and I intended to fault it, but behind them was a king who seized every ship by force. As for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared that he would overburden them through transgression and disbelief. So we intended that their Lord should substitute for them one better than him in purity and nearer to kinship. As for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and beneath it was their treasure. Their father had been a righteous man. So your Lord intended that they should reach maturity and extract their treasure - a mercy from your Lord. And I did not do it of my own accord. That is the interpretation of that over which you could not have patience."

They ask you, [O Muhammad], about Dhul-Qarnayn. Say, "I will recite to you a report about him. Indeed, We established him upon the earth, and We gave him from all things a way." So he followed a way. Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it setting in a spring of murky water. And he found near it a people. We said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, either you punish them or deal with them kindly." He said, "As for he who wronged, We will punish him; then he will be returned to his Lord, and He will punish him with a terrible punishment. But as for he who believed and did righteousness, he will have the best reward, and We will speak to him from Our command [something] easy." Then he followed a way.

Until, when he reached the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had not made against it a covering. Thus We encompassed what he had with knowledge. Then he followed a way. Until, when he reached between the two barriers, he found against them a people who could scarcely understand a word. They said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, indeed Gog and Magog are corrupters in the land. Shall we assign to you an expenditure on condition that you make between us and them a barrier?" He said, "That in which my Lord has established me is better, so aid me with strength; I will make between you and them a barrier." Bring me sheets of iron. Until, when he had leveled between the two mountain-sides, he said, "Blow." Until, when he had made it fire, he said, "Bring me molten copper that I may pour over it." But they were not able to surpass it, nor were they able to pierce it. He said, "This is a mercy from my Lord. But when the promise of my Lord comes to pass, He will make it level. And ever is the promise of my Lord true."

And We will let some of them surge against others, and the Trumpet will be blown, and We will gather them together. And We will present Hell that Day to the disbelievers, plainly. Those whose eyes were covered from My remembrance, and they were unable to hear. Then do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants as protectors other than Me? Indeed, We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers as a lodging. Say, "Shall We inform you of the greatest losers as to [their] deeds?" Those whose effort is lost in worldly life, while they think that they are doing well in work. Those are the ones who disbelieved in the verses of their Lord and in the meeting with Him, so their deeds have become worthless, so We will not assign to them on the Day of Resurrection any weight. That is their recompense - Hell, for what they disbelieved and took My verses and My messengers in ridicule.
Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds will have the Gardens of Paradise as an accommodation. They will abide therein eternally, never desiring to depart from it.

Say, "If the sea were ink for the words of my Lord, the sea would be exhausted before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even if We brought the like of it as a supplement." Say, "I am only a human being like you, to whom it has been revealed that your God is one God. So whoever hopes for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone."

Kaf Ha Ya Ain Sad. A mention of the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah, when he called upon his Lord in a secret call. He said, "My Lord, indeed my bones have weakened, and my head has gleamed with gray hair, and I have never been in my supplication to You, my Lord, unhappy. And indeed, I fear my relatives after me, and my wife has been barren. So grant me from Yourself an heir who will inherit me and inherit from the family of Jacob, and make him, my Lord, one pleasing to You." O Zechariah, indeed We give you good tidings of a boy whose name will be John. We have not given anyone before any namesake. He said, "My Lord, how can I have a boy while my wife is barren, and I have reached extreme old age?" He said, "Thus said your Lord: It is easy for Me, and I created you before, while you were nothing." He said, "My Lord, appoint for me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three nights, sound." So he came out to his people from the sanctuary and inspired them to glorify God morning and evening.

O Yahya, take the Scripture with determination. And We gave him judgement while yet a boy, and compassion from Us and purity. And he was righteous. And dutiful to his parents, and he was not a disobedient tyrant. And peace be upon him the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he is raised alive.

And mention in the Book, Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place in the East. And she took a veil apart from them. Then We sent to her Our Spirit, and he appeared to her as a well-proportioned man. She said, "Indeed, I seek refuge in the Most Gracious from you, if you should fear Allah." He said, "I am only the messenger of your Lord to give you a pure boy." She said, "How can I have a boy when no man has touched me, nor have I been unchaste?" He said, "Thus says your Lord: 'It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign to the people and a mercy from Us, and it is a matter [already] decreed.'" So she conceived him and withdrew with him to a remote place. Then the pangs of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She said, "Oh, I wish I had died before this and was in oblivion, forgotten." Then he called to her from beneath her, "Do not grieve; your Lord has provided beneath you a stream. And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates. So eat and drink and be refreshed. But if you see any human being, say, "Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Gracious a fast, so I will not speak to any human being today." So she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, "O Mary, you have certainly done a thing unprecedented. O sister of Aaron, your father was not a man of evil, nor was your mother unchaste." So she pointed to him. They said, "How can we speak to one who is in the cradle, a child?" He said, "Indeed, I am a servant of Allah. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet. And He has made me blessed wherever I am. And He has enjoined upon me prayer and zakah as long as I live. And He has been dutiful to my mother and has not made me a wretched tyrant. And peace be upon me the day I was born and the day I die and the day I am raised alive."

That is Jesus, the son of Mary - the statement of truth about which they are in dispute. It is not for Allah to take a son - glory be to Him! When He decrees a matter, He only says to it, "Be," and it is. And indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is a straight path. But the factions differed among themselves. So woe to those who disbelieve from the sight of a tremendous Day. I will hear of them and see the Day when they come to Us. But the wrongdoers, Today, are in manifest error. And warn them of the Day of Regret when the matter is decreed, while they are in heedlessness, and they will not believe. Indeed, it is We who will inherit the earth and whoever is on it, and to Us they will be returned.

And mention in the Book, Abraham. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet. When he said to his father, "O my father, why do you worship that which does not hear and does not see and does not avail you at all? O my father, indeed there has come to me of knowledge that which has not come to you, so follow me; I will guide you to a straight path." O my father, do not worship Satan. Indeed, Satan has ever been disobedient to the Most Merciful. O my father, indeed I fear that a punishment from the Most Merciful will afflict you, and you would be an ally of Satan." He said, "Are you averse to my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will surely stone you, and leave me for a long time." He said, "Peace be upon you. I will ask forgiveness for you from my Lord. Indeed, He is ever Gracious to me. And I will leave you and what you invoke besides Allah and call upon my Lord. Perhaps I will not be, in my invocation of my Lord, unhappy." So when he had left them and what they worshipped besides Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each of them We made a prophet. And We bestowed upon them of Our mercy and made for them a reputation of truth, high.

And mention in the Book, Moses. Indeed, he was chosen, and he was a messenger and a prophet. And We called to him from the right side of the Mount and brought him near for confidential talk. And We bestowed on him, out of Our mercy, his brother Aaron, a prophet. And mention in the Book, Ishmael. Indeed, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger and a prophet. And he used to enjoin prayer and zakah upon his people, and he was to his Lord acceptable. And mention in the Book, Idris. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet. And We raised him to a high station. Those are the ones upon whom Allah bestowed favor from the prophets, from the descendants of Adam and from those We carried with Noah and from the descendants of Abraham and Israel and from those We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell down prostrating and weeping.

Then there came after them an evil generation who neglected prayer and pursued desires. So they are going to meet destruction - Except for those who repent, believe and do righteousness. For those will enter Paradise and not be wronged at all. Gardens of Eden which the Most Merciful has promised to His servants in the unseen. Indeed, His promise is ever fulfilled. They will hear therein no ill speech but only [saying], “Peace.” And they will have their provision therein, morning and evening. That is Paradise which We will inherit from those of Our servants who were righteous. And We do not descend except by the command of your Lord. To Him belongs what is before us and what is behind us and what is between that. And your Lord is not forgetful. He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them. So worship Him and be patient in His worship. Do you know of any other similar to Him?

And man says, "When I die, will I then be brought forth alive?" Does man not remember that We created him before, while he was nothing? Then by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We will surely present them around Hell, on their knees. Then We will extract from every sect those of them who were most rebellious against the Most Merciful. Then We are most knowing of those who are most deserving of burning therein. And there is not one of you but will pass over it; this is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed. Then We will save those who feared God and leave the wrongdoers therein, on their knees.

And when Our clear verses are recited to them, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Which of the two parties is better in position and better in company?" And how many generations before them have We destroyed who were better in possessions and appearance. Say, "Whoever is in error - let the Most Merciful extend to him a term until, when they see that which they are promised - either the punishment or the Hour - they will know who is worse in position and weaker in soldiers. And Allah increases those who are guided in guidance. And the lasting good deeds are better in the sight of your Lord for reward and better for outcome."

Have you seen he who disbelieved in Our verses and said, “I will surely be given wealth and children.” Has he known the unseen, or has he taken a covenant from the Most Merciful? No! We will record what he says, and We will extend for him a period of punishment. And We will inherit from him what he says, and he will come to Us alone. And they have taken besides Allah deities that they may be a means of honor to them. No! They will deny their worship of them and will be opponents to them. Have you not seen that We have sent the devils upon the disbelievers, inciting them to a terrible intimidation? So be not impatient against them. We are only counting for them a number. The Day We will gather the righteous to the Most Merciful as a delegation, and We will drive the criminals to Hell in droves. They will not possess intercession, except for he who has taken a covenant from the Most Merciful.

And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken a son." You have certainly committed a thing monstrous. The heavens almost burst therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation - that they attribute to the Most Merciful a son. And it is not befitting for the Most Merciful that He should take a son. There is none in the heavens and earth but comes to the Most Merciful as a servant. He has enumerated them and counted them [completely]. And all of them will come to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone.

Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - the Most Merciful will appoint for them affection. And indeed, We have only made it easy for you in your language that you may give good tidings thereby to the righteous and warn thereby a hostile people. And how many generations before them have We destroyed! Do you perceive anyone of them or hear a whisper from them?

Ta-Ha. We have not sent down the Qur’an to you to cause you distress, but only as a reminder for those who fear [Allah]. A revelation from He who created the earth and the high heavens. The Most Gracious established Himself firmly on the Throne. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth and whatever is between them and whatever is under the soil. And if you speak aloud, then indeed, He knows the secret and what is even more hidden. Allah - there is no deity except Him. To Him belong the best names.

Has there reached you the story of Moses? When he saw a fire, he said to his family, "Stay here; I have perceived a fire; perhaps I can bring you a torch from it or find at the fire some guidance." But when he came to it, he was called, "O Moses, indeed I am your Lord, so remove your sandals. Indeed, you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa. And I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed to me. Indeed, I am Allah; there is no deity except Me, so worship Me and establish prayer for My remembrance. Indeed, the Hour is coming - I almost conceal it - so that every soul may be rewarded for what it strives for." So do not let those who do not believe in it avert you from it and follow their desires, lest you perish.

And what is that in your right hand, O Moses? He said, “It is my staff; I lean upon it, and with it I beat down branches for my sheep, and I have other uses for it.” He said, “Throw it down, O Moses.” So he threw it down, and behold, it was a serpent, darting about. He said, “Take it and fear not. We will restore it to its former state. And put your hand into your side; it will emerge white without disease - another sign - that We may show you some of Our greater signs. Go to Pharaoh, for he has transgressed.”

He said, "My Lord, expand for me my chest and ease for me my task and untie the knot from my tongue that they may understand my speech. And appoint for me a helper from my family - Aaron, my brother. Strengthen my strength through him and let him share my task - that we may glorify You much and remember You much. Indeed, You are ever, over us, Seeing." He said, "Your request has been granted, O Moses. And We have certainly conferred favor upon you another time."

When We inspired your mother with what was inspired, [saying], "Cast him into the chest, and cast him into the river, and let the river cast him upon the shore. An enemy of Mine and an enemy of his will take him. And I bestowed upon you love from Me, that you may be brought up under My eye." When your sister walked, she said, "Shall I direct you to one who will take care of him?" So We returned you to your mother that her eye might be cooled and she would not grieve. And you killed a person, but We saved you from distress and tried you with a trial, and you remained among the people of Midian for years; then you came [to the world] according to a [determined] measure. O Moses! And I have chosen you for Myself. Go, you and your brother, with My signs and do not slacken in remembering Me. Go to Pharaoh, for he has transgressed. And speak to him with gentle speech that perhaps he may be reminded or fear." They said, "Our Lord, indeed we fear that he will assault us or that he will transgress." He said, "Do not fear; indeed, I am with you, hearing and seeing." So go to him and say, "Indeed, we are messengers of your Lord, so send the Children of Israel with us and do not punish them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord, and peace be upon him who follows guidance." Indeed, it has been revealed to us that the punishment is upon those who deny and turn away.

He said, "Who is your Lord, O Moses?" He said, "Our Lord is He who gave each thing its form and nature and then guided it." He said, "Then what about the former generations?" He said, "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord, in a Record. My Lord does not err, nor does He forget. He who made the earth a bed for you and threaded paths for you therein and sent down water from the sky, and We produced thereby diverse pairs of plants. Eat and pasture your livestock. Indeed in that are signs for those of understanding. From it We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will extract you another time."

And We showed him all Our signs, but he denied and refused. He said, "Have you come to us to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses? But we will bring you magic like it, so make between us and you an appointment which neither we nor you will fail to fulfill - a place apart." He said, "Your appointment is the Day of Festivities, and that the people be gathered at forenoon." So Pharaoh turned away and assembled his plot, then came. Moses said to them, "Woe to you! Do not invent a lie about Allah, or He will destroy you with a punishment. And he who invents a lie has failed." So they disputed their affair among themselves and spoke secretly. They said, "Indeed, these two are magicians who want to drive you out of your land with their magic and do away with your best way. So assemble your plot and come in ranks, and today he has succeeded who has gained supremacy." They said, "O Moses, either you throw or we will be the first to throw." He said, "Rather, throw." And at once their ropes and their staffs appeared to him from their magic as if they were crawling. So Moses felt fear within himself. We said, "Do not fear; indeed, you are the superior." And throw down what is in your right hand; it will swallow up what they have made. What they have made is only the trick of a magician, and the magician will not succeed wherever he goes.

So the magicians fell down in prostration. They said, "We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses." He said, "You have believed in him before I give you permission. Indeed, he is your chief who taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and you will surely know which of us has the most severe and lasting punishment." They said, "We will never prefer you over the clear proofs that have come to us and He who created us, so decree what you will decree. You can only decree this worldly life. Indeed, we have believed in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and what you forced us to do of magic. And Allah is better and more lasting. Indeed, whoever comes to his Lord as a criminal - for him is Hell, he will neither die therein nor live. But whoever comes to Him as a believer having done righteous deeds - for those will be the highest degrees [in Paradise] - Gardens of Eden beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide eternally. That is the reward of he who purifies himself."

And We had already inspired Moses, "Travel by night with My servants and strike for them a dry path through the sea. You will not fear being overtaken, nor will you be afraid." But Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers, but the sea covered them. And Pharaoh led his people astray, and did not guide them.

O Children of Israel, We delivered you from your enemy and made an appointment with you at the right side of the Mount and sent down to you manna and quails. Eat from the good things We have provided for you and do not transgress therein, lest My wrath should descend upon you. And whoever incurs My wrath has certainly perished. And indeed, I am Forgiving to whoever repents, believes and does righteousness and then continues in guidance.

And what made you hasten to leave your people, O Moses? He said, "They are on my heels, and I hastened to You, my Lord, that You might please me." He said, "Indeed, we have tested your people after you, and the Samiri has led them astray."

Then Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved. He said, "O my people, did not your Lord promise you a good promise? Has the covenant been prolonged for you? Or did you desire that wrath from your Lord should descend upon you, so you broke your promise to me?" They said, "We did not break your promise to you of our own accord, but we were carried with burdens of the adornments of the people and threw them down." Thus did the Samaritan throw them down. Then he brought out for them a calf, a body that mooed. They said, "This is your god and the god of Moses, but he has forgotten." Do they not see that it does not return to them a word and does not possess for them any power to harm or benefit? And Aaron had already said to them before, "O my people, you are only being tested by it, and your Lord is the Most Merciful, so follow me and obey my command." They said, "We will not cease to be devoted to it until Moses returns to us." He said, "O Aaron, what prevented you when you saw that they had gone astray? Why did you not follow? Have you disobeyed my command?" He said, "O son of my mother, do not seize me by the beard or by the head. Indeed, I feared that you would say, 'You have divided the Children of Israel and did not respect my word.'"

He said, "What is the matter with you, O Samaritan?" He said, "I saw what they did not see, so I took a handful from the traces of the Messenger and threw it away. And thus my soul suggested to me." He said, "Then go, for in this life you will have the right to say, 'Do not touch me.' And you have an appointment which you will not fail to keep. And look to your god, to whom you have been devoted. We will surely burn him and scatter him into the sea like dust. Your god is only God, other than whom there is no god. He encompasses all things in His knowledge."

Thus We relate to you some of the news of what had preceded. And We have given you from Us a message. Whoever turns away from it - he will certainly bear a burden on the Day of Resurrection, abiding eternally therein - and evil for them on the Day of Resurrection is the burden.

The Day the Trumpet will be blown, and We will gather the criminals, that Day, blue-eyed. They will whisper to one another, “You remained [in the world] only ten.” We are most knowing of what they say when the best of them in way will say, “You remained [in the world] only a day.” And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about the mountains, say, “My Lord will blow them away with a blast.” And He will leave them as a level plain. You will see therein no crookedness or unevenness. That Day they will follow the Caller, with no crookedness in him, and voices will be hushed before the Most Merciful, and you will hear nothing but a whisper. That Day no intercession will benefit except for one to whom the Most Merciful has given permission and whose word He is pleased with. He knows what is before them and what is behind them, but they do not encompass Him in knowledge. And faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, the Self-Sustaining, and he will fail who bears injustice. And whoever does righteous deeds while he is a believer - he will fear neither injustice nor deprivation. Thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur’an and have diversified therein the warnings that perhaps they will fear God or it will cause them to be reminded.
So exalted is God, the King, the Truth. And do not hasten with the Qur’an before its revelation is completed to you, and say, “My Lord, increase me in knowledge.”

And We had already made a covenant with Adam before, but he forgot, and We found on his part no firm will. And when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblis. He refused. Then We said, "O Adam, indeed this is an enemy to you and to your wife, so let him not expel you from Paradise and you become miserable. Indeed, you will neither hunger therein nor be naked, nor thirst therein nor be exposed to the sun." But Satan whispered to him, saying, "O Adam, shall I direct you to the tree of immortality and possession that will not decay?" So they ate from it, and their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten together over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And Adam disobeyed his Lord and went astray. Then his Lord chose him and turned to him in forgiveness and guided him.

He said, "Descend from it, all of you, as enemies to one another. And if there comes to you guidance from Me - whoever follows My guidance will neither go astray nor suffer. But whoever turns away from My remembrance - indeed, he will have a depressed life, and We will gather him on the Day of Resurrection blind." He will say, "My Lord, why have You gathered me blind while I was seeing?" He will say, "Thus did Our signs come to you, and you forgot them; and thus will you be forgotten this Day." And thus do We recompense he who transgressed and did not believe in the signs of his Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and more lasting.

Have they not been guided by how many generations We destroyed before them who used to walk about in their dwellings? Indeed in that are signs for those of understanding. And had it not been for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been an obligation and a specified term. So be patient over what they say and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting, and during periods of the night exalt [Allah] and at the ends of the day that you may be satisfied. And do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [some] categories of them - the splendor of the worldly life - by which We test them. And the provision of your Lord is better and more lasting. And enjoin prayer upon your family and be constant therein. We do not ask you for provision; We provide for you, and the [best] outcome is for righteousness.

And they said, “Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?” Has there not come to them clear evidence of what was in the former scriptures? And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before this, they would have said, “Our Lord, why did you not send us a messenger so we could have followed Your signs before we were humiliated and disgraced?” Say, “Each is waiting, so wait; you will know who are the companions of the straight path and who are guided.”

The reckoning of mankind has drawn near, while they are in heedlessness turning away. There comes not to them a reminder from their Lord renewed but they listen to it while they are playing. Their hearts are distracted, and those who do wrong whisper secretly, [saying], “Is this not but a human being like you? Then do you approach magic while you see?” He said, “My Lord knows what is said in the heaven and the earth, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.” Rather, they said, “Confused dreams.” Rather, he has invented it. Rather, he is a poet. So let him bring Us a sign as were sent to the former peoples. No city which We destroyed believed before them - will they believe? And We sent not before you, except men to whom We revealed. So ask the people of the message if you do not know. And We did not make them bodies that did not eat food, nor were they immortal. Then We fulfilled for them the promise and saved them and whom We willed and destroyed the transgressors. Indeed, We have sent down to you a Book in which is your message, so will you not reason?

And how many a city have We destroyed which was unjust, and raised up after it another people. But when they perceived Our punishment, at once they fled from it. [Saying], “Do not run, but return to that in which you were affluent and to your dwellings that you may be questioned.” They will say, “Woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers.” And that continued their cry until We made them a harvest, extinct.

We did not create the heaven and the earth and all that is between them in play. If We had intended to take a diversion, We could have taken it from Ourself, if We were to do. Rather, We cast the truth upon falsehood, and it destroys it, and thereupon it departs. And for you is woe for that which you describe. And to Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth, and those with Him are not too proud to worship Him, nor do they grow weary. They glorify [Allah] night and day, never slackening.

Or have they taken gods from the earth who spread [the message]? Had there been within the heavens and earth gods besides Allah, they both would have been ruined. So exalted is Allah, Lord of the Throne, above what they describe. He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned. Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say, "Produce your proof." This is the message of those with me and the message of those before me. But most of them do not know the truth, so they are turning away.

And We did not send before you any messenger except that We revealed to him, "There is no deity except Me, so worship Me." And they said, "The Most Merciful has taken a son." Glory be to Him! Rather, they are [but] honored servants. They do not precede Him in speech, and they act by His command. He knows what is before them and what is behind them, and they do not intercede except for him with whom He is pleased, and they are fearful of Him. And whoever among them says, "I am a god other than Him" ​​- We will recompense him with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.

Have not those who disbelieve seen that the heavens and the earth were a joined entity, and We separated them and made from water every living thing? Then will they not believe? And We placed on the earth firm mountains, lest it should shift with them, and We placed therein broad paths for roads that they might be guided. And We made the sky a protected ceiling, yet they, from Its signs, turn away. And it is He who created the night and the day and the sun and the moon; each, in an orbit, floats. And We did not grant to any human being before you immortality. So if you die, are they the immortal ones? Every soul will taste death. And We test you with evil and with good as trial, and to Us you will be returned.

And when those who disbelieve see you, they take you only in ridicule. “Is this he who mentions your gods?” And they, at the mention of the Most Merciful, are disbelievers. He created man of haste. I will show you My signs, so do not be impatient. And they say, “When will this promise be fulfilled, if you should be truthful?” If only those who disbelieve knew when they will not be able to avert the Fire from their faces or from their backs, nor will they be aided. Rather, it will come upon them suddenly and confound them, so they will not be able to repel it, nor will they be reprieved. And messengers before you were mocked, but that which they used to mock encompassed those who mocked them.

Say, "Who protects you by night and by day from the Most Merciful?" Rather, they, from the remembrance of their Lord, turn away. Or have they gods to protect them other than Us? They cannot help themselves, nor do they keep company with Us. Rather, We provided for these and their fathers until life was prolonged for them. Do they not see that We come to the land, reducing it from its borders? Are they then the predominant?"

Say, "I only warn you by revelation, and the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned. And if a blast of the punishment of your Lord should touch them, they will surely say, "Woe to us. Indeed, we were wrongdoers." And We will set up the just scales on the Day of Resurrection, so not a soul will be wronged at all. And if there be [therein] the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth, and sufficient are We as accountants.

And We had certainly given Moses and Aaron the Criterion and a light and a reminder for the righteous - those who fear their Lord unseen and are fearful of the Hour. And this is a blessed message which We have sent down. Then will you deny it?

And We had already given Abraham his sound judgment before, and We were of him Knowing. When he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues to which you are devoted?" They said, "We found our fathers worshipping them." He said, "Indeed, you and your fathers were in manifest error." They said, "Have you brought us the truth, or are you of the playful?" He said, "Rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them, and I, to that, am among the witnesses. And by Allah, I will surely destroy your idols after you have turned and departed." So He made them into fragments, except for their eldest, that perhaps they might return to Him. They said, "Who has done this to our gods? Indeed, he is among the wrongdoers." They said, "We heard a youth mentioning them, whose name is Abraham." They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that perhaps they will bear witness." They said, "Have you done this to our gods, O Abraham?" He said, "Rather, their eldest has done it, so ask them, if they can speak." So they turned to themselves and said, "Indeed, you are the wrongdoers." Then they hung their heads, "Indeed, you know that these do not speak." He said, "Then do you worship besides Allah that which can neither benefit you nor harm you at all?" Fie upon you and upon what you worship besides God. Will you not reason? They said, "Burn him and support your gods, if you are to do something."

We said, "O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham." And they intended against him a plot, but We made them the greatest losers. And We saved him and Lot to the land which We had blessed for the worlds. And We gave him Isaac and Jacob as an additional gift, and all of them We made righteous. And We made them leaders guiding by Our command. And We inspired in them the doing of good deeds, establishing prayer, and giving zakah, and they were to Us worshippers.

And to Lot We gave him wisdom and knowledge, and We saved him from the city that was committing abominations. Indeed, they were a wicked, wicked people. And We admitted him into Our mercy. Indeed, he was of the righteous.

And Noah, when he called before, and We responded to him and saved him and his family from the great distress. And We gave him victory over the people who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were an evil people, so We drowned them all.

And [mention] David and Solomon, when they gave judgment concerning the field, when the sheep of the people had pastured therein. And We were witness to their judgment. And We gave Solomon understanding thereof, and to each of them We gave judgment and knowledge. And We subjected with David the mountains, to glorify Allah [by singing], and the birds, and We were the Doer. And We taught him the making of coats of mail for you, to protect you from your violence. So will you be grateful? And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind, blowing violently, by his command toward the land which We had blessed. And We are Knowing of all things. And among the devils were some who dived for him and did other work besides that, and We were their guardians.

And [mention] Job, when he cried to his Lord, "Indeed, distress has seized me, and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful." So We responded to him and removed the distress that was upon him and gave him his family and a like number with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for the worshippers. And [mention] Ishmael and Idris and Dhul-Kifl - all were among the patient. And We admitted them to Our mercy. Indeed, they were among the righteous.

And [mention] Dhul-Nun, when he went off in anger and thought that We would not decree anything upon him, but he called out within the darknesses, "There is no deity except You; exalted are You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers." So We responded to him and saved him from the distress. And thus do We save the believers.

And Zachariah, when he called upon his Lord, "My Lord, leave me not childless, though You are the Best of inheritors." So We responded to him and gave him John and made his wife sound for him. Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds and supplicate Us in hope and fear and were to Us humbly submissive.
And she who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into her of Our spirit and made her and her son a sign for the worlds.

Indeed, this, your nation, is one nation, and I am your Lord, so worship Me. And they divided their affair among themselves. To Us they will all return. So whoever does righteous deeds while he is a believer - no denial will there be for his effort, and indeed, We are recording it. And it is forbidden for a town which We have destroyed that they should not return.

Until, when Gog and Magog are let loose, and they swarm from every height. And the true promise draws near, at once the eyes of those who disbelieve will be staring [in horror], "Woe to us! We were indeed heedless of this. Rather, we were wrongdoers." Indeed, you and those you worship besides God are fuel for Hell; you will surely enter it. Had these been gods, they would not have entered it, and all will abide therein eternally. Therein they will have sighing, and therein they will not hear.

Indeed, those for whom good has preceded from Us - those will be removed from it. They will not hear its hissing sound, and they will abide eternally in that which their souls desire. The greatest terror will not grieve them, and the angels will meet them, [saying], “This is your Day which you were promised.”

The Day We will roll up the heaven like the rolling up of a scroll for books. As We began the first creation, We will repeat it. [It is] a promise binding upon Us. Indeed, We will do it. And We had already written in the Psalms, after the remembrance, that the earth will be inherited by My righteous servants. Indeed in this is a message for a people who worship.

We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a mercy to the worlds. Say, "It is only revealed to me that your God is one God. So will you submit [to Allah's will]? But if they turn away, say, 'I have warned you of a just cause, and I do not know whether what you are promised is near or far.' Indeed, He knows what is declared of speech and He knows what you conceal. And I do not know that it may be a trial for you and an enjoyment for a time." He said, "My Lord, judge with truth, and our Lord is the Most Merciful. Help is sought against that which you describe."

O mankind, fear your Lord. Indeed, the convulsion of the Hour is a terrible thing. The Day you see it, every nursing mother will forget her suckling mother, and every pregnant woman will abort her pregnancy, and you will see the people as if they were drunk, but they are not drunk. Rather, the punishment of Allah is severe.

And among the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge and follows every rebellious devil. It is decreed for him that whoever takes him as an ally - he will mislead him and guide him to the punishment of the Blaze.

O mankind, if you are in doubt about the Resurrection - then indeed We created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot, then from a lump of flesh, some formed and some unformed, that We may make clear to you. And We settle in the wombs whom We will for a specified term; then We bring you out as a child, then [O Muhammad], that you may reach your full strength. And among you is he who is taken in death, and among you is he who is returned to the most decrepit age so that he does not know, after [having] knowledge, a thing. And you see the earth lifeless, but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and swells and grows [abundantly] of every beautiful kind. That is because Allah is the Truth, and that He gives life to the dead, and that He is over all things competent. And because the Hour is coming - there is no doubt about it - and because Allah will resurrect those in the graves.

And among the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening Book. He turns away [from Allah's path] to mislead [others] from the way of Allah. For him in this world is disgrace, and We will make him taste the punishment of the Burning Fire on the Day of Resurrection. That is for what your hands have put forth, and because Allah is not unjust to His servants. And among the people is he who worships Allah on the edge. If good befalls him, he is satisfied therewith, but if a trial befalls him, he turns back on his face. He loses this world and the Hereafter. That is what is the manifest loss. He invokes besides Allah that which can neither harm him nor benefit him. That is what is far astray. He invokes one whose harm is nearer than his benefit. What an evil protector and an evil companion!

Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. Indeed, Allah does what He intends. Whoever thinks that Allah will not support him in this world and the Hereafter - let him stretch out a rope to the heaven; then let it be cut off. Then let him see whether his plan will remove that which enrages him.

And thus We have sent it down as clear verses, and indeed, Allah guides whom He wills. Indeed, those who have believed and those who were Jews or Christians or Sabeans or Magians or polytheists - indeed, Allah will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, Allah is, over all things, Witness. Have you not seen that to Allah prostrates whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth and the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, the moving creatures and many of the people? And many upon whom the punishment has been justified. And he upon whom Allah humiliates - for him there is none to give him honor. Indeed, Allah does what He wills.

These are two adversaries who have disputed about their Lord. As for those who disbelieve, garments of fire will be cut out for them. Boiling water will be poured down over their heads. It will melt what is within their bellies and their skins. And they will have maces of iron. Whenever they wish to get out of it out of distress, they will be returned to it [and] [returned] [to it] and [they will be] made to taste the punishment of the Burning Fire.

Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be silk. And they are guided to good speech and guided to the path of the Praiseworthy.

Indeed, those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah and from al-Masjid al-Haram, which We have made for mankind - whether they stay therein or travel - and whoever intends therein to commit injustice - We will make him taste of a painful punishment. And [mention] when We designated for Abraham the site of the House, [saying], "Do not associate anything with Me and purify My House for those who perform Tawaf and those who stand [in prayer] and those who bow and prostrate. And proclaim to mankind the Hajj [pilgrimage]; they will come to you on foot and on every lean camel, coming from every distant pass - that they may witness benefits for themselves and mention the name of Allah on known days over what He has provided for them of sacrificial animals. So eat from them and feed the poor and needy. Then let them complete their rites and fulfill their vows and perform Tawaf around the Ancient House."

That is, and whoever honors the sacred ordinances of Allah - it is better for him with his Lord. And grazing livestock have been made lawful to you, except what is recited to you. So avoid the uncleanness of idols and avoid false statement - being upright for Allah, not associating others with Him. And whoever associates others with Allah - it is as if he had fallen from the sky and been snatched by birds or the wind had blown him to a remote place. That is, and whoever honors the symbols of Allah - indeed, it is from the piety of hearts. For you therein are benefits for a specified term, then their place of residence is at the Ancient House. And for every nation We have appointed rites that they may mention the name of Allah over what He has provided for them of livestock. But your God is one God, so to Him they submit. And give good tidings to the humbly submissive - those who, when Allah is mentioned, feel a fear in their hearts and are patient over what befalls them and establish prayer and spend out of what We have provided for them. And the sacrificial animals - We have made them for you among the symbols of Allah - for you therein is good, so mention the name of Allah over them while standing in line. And when their sides are down, eat from them and feed the contented and the needy. Thus have We subjected them to you that you may be grateful. Allah does not need their meat or their blood, but He needs your piety. Thus has He subjected them to you that you may glorify Allah for having guided you. And give good tidings to the doers of good.

Indeed, Allah defends those who have believed. Indeed, Allah does not like any treacherous ingrate. Permission is given to those against whom war is made, because they have been wronged. And indeed, Allah is competent to give them victory. [They are] those who have been expelled from their homes without right - only because they say, "Our Lord is Allah." And were it not that Allah checks some people by means of others, monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques in which the name of Allah is much mentioned would surely have been pulled down. And Allah will surely support those who support Him. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might. [They are] those who, if We establish them in the land, establish prayer and give zakah and enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong. And to Allah belongs the outcome of events.

And if they deny you, [O Muhammad], - so were denied before them the people of Noah, 'Aad, and Thamud, and the people of Abraham, and the people of Lot, and the companions of Midian. And Moses denied, so I granted respite to the disbelievers; then I seized them - and how terrible was My punishment! How many a city have We destroyed while it was doing wrong? So it lies desolate upon its roofs, and a well unused, and a lofty palace. Have they not traveled through the land and had hearts by which to reason, and ears by which to hear? For indeed, it is not eyes that are blinded, but blinded are the hearts which are within the breasts.

And they urge you to hasten the punishment, but Allah will not fail in His promise. Indeed, a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of those which you count. And how many a town was granted respite while it was wrongdoing? Then I seized it, and to Me is the final destination.

Say, "O mankind, I am only to you a clear warner. So those who believe and do righteous deeds - for them is forgiveness and noble provision. But those who strive against Our verses to frustrate them - those are the companions of Hellfire."

And We did not send before you any messenger or prophet except that when he spoke, Satan cast into his speech. But Allah nullifies what Satan casts, and then Allah establishes His verses. And Allah is Knowing and Wise. That He may make what Satan casts a trial for those in whose hearts is disease and whose hearts are hardened. And indeed, the wrongdoers are in extreme dissension. And that those who have been given knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord, and believe in it, so their hearts may submit to it. And indeed, Allah is the guide of those who believe to a straight path. And those who disbelieve will not cease to be in doubt thereof until the Hour comes upon them suddenly, or there comes to them the punishment of a barren Day. The dominion that Day will belong to Allah, to judge between them. So those who have believed and done righteous deeds will be in Gardens of Delight. But those who disbelieve and deny Our verses - those will have a humiliating punishment.

And those who have emigrated for the cause of Allah and then were killed or died - Allah will surely provide for them a good provision. And indeed, Allah is the best of providers. He will surely admit them to an entrance with which they will be pleased. And indeed, Allah is Knowing and Forbearing. And whoever punishes with the equivalent of that with which he was afflicted and then is wronged - Allah will surely aid him. Indeed, Allah is Pardoning and Forgiving. That is because Allah merges the night into the day and merges the day into the night. And indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing. That is because Allah is the Truth and that which they invoke besides Him is falsehood. And indeed, Allah is the Most High, the Grand. Have you not seen that Allah sends down water from the sky, and the earth becomes green? Indeed, Allah is Kind and Acquainted. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy. Have you not seen that Allah has subjected to you whatever is on the earth and the ships sail through the sea by His command and He holds back the sky from falling upon the earth except by His permission? Indeed, Allah is to the people Kind and Merciful. And it is He who gives you life; then He will cause you to die, then He will bring you back to life. Indeed, mankind is ungrateful.

For every nation We have appointed rites which they must follow. So let them not dispute with you over the matter, and invite [people] to your Lord. Indeed, you are upon a straight guidance. And if they argue with you, say, "Allah is most knowing of what you do." Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which you used to differ. Do you not know that Allah knows whatever is in the heaven and the earth? Indeed, that is in a Record. Indeed, that, for Allah, is easy. And they worship besides Allah that for which He has not sent down authority and that of which they have no knowledge. And there is not for the wrongdoers any helper. And when Our verses are recited to them as clear proofs, you recognize in the faces of those who disbelieve disapproval. They almost assault those who recite to them Our verses. Say, "Shall I inform you of one worse than that? The Fire has promised it to those who disbelieve, and wretched is the destination."

O mankind, an example is made, so listen to it. Indeed, those you invoke besides Allah cannot create a fly, even if they banded together for that purpose. And if the fly steals away something from them, they could not recover it from it. Weak are the pursuer and the pursued. They do not esteem Allah with His true esteem. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might. Allah chooses from among the angels messengers and from among the people. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing. He knows what is before them and what is behind them. And to Allah are all matters returned.

O you who have believed, bow and prostrate and worship your Lord and do good that you may be successful. And strive for Allah with the striving due to Him. He has chosen you and has not placed upon you in the religion any difficulty - the religion of your father Abraham. He named you Muslims before and in this [religion] that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people. So establish prayer and give zakah and hold fast to Allah. He is your Protector, and excellent is the Protector, and excellent is the Helper.

Indeed, the believers have succeeded. They are those who are humble in their prayers. And they who turn away from ill speech. And they who are obligatory upon the poor-due. And they who guard their private parts. Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they will not be blamed. But whoever seeks beyond that, then those are the transgressors. And they are to their trusts and their covenants attentive. And they are constant in their prayers. Those are the inheritors. They will inherit Paradise, wherein they will abide eternally.

And We have certainly created man from an extract of clay. Then We placed him as a sperm-drop in a firm lodging. Then We made the sperm-drop into a clinging clot, then We made the clot into a lump of flesh, then We made the lump of flesh bones, then We covered the bones with flesh, then We developed him into another creation. So blessed be Allah, the Best of Creators. Then indeed, after that, you will die. Then indeed, on the Day of Resurrection, you will be resurrected.

And We have certainly created above you seven paths, and We are not unaware of creation. And We sent down from the sky water in due measure, and We settled it in the earth, and indeed, We are Able to take it away. And We produced for you thereby gardens of palm trees and grapevines, in which you have much fruit, and from which you eat. And a tree emerges from Mount Sinai, which produces oil and a condiment for those who eat. And indeed, in the grazing livestock is a lesson for you. We give you drink from what is in their bellies, and for you in them are many benefits, and from them you eat. And upon them and upon the ships you are carried.

And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. Will you not then fear Allah?" But the eminent ones who disbelieved among his people said, "This is not but a man like you who desires to excel you. And if Allah had willed, He could have sent down angels. We have not heard of this among our forefathers of old." He is only a man possessed by madness, so wait for him for a time. He said, "My Lord, support me because they deny." So We inspired him, "Construct the ark under Our observation and according to Our inspiration. Then when Our command comes and the oven overflows, take into it two mates of every kind and your family, except those against whom the word has already preceded among them. And address Me not concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are to be drowned." And when you and those with you have settled in the ark, say, "Praise be to Allah, who has saved us from the wrongdoing people." And say, "My Lord, alight me at a blessed landing place, for You are the best to alight." Indeed in that are signs, and we were to be tested.

Then We produced after them another generation. And We sent among them a messenger from themselves, [saying], "Worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. So will you not fear Allah?" And the eminent among his people who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter - and whom We had given luxuries in the life of this world - said, "This is not but a human being like you; he eats of what you eat and drinks of what you drink. And if you obey a human being like yourselves, indeed, you would be losers." Does he promise you that when you die and become dust and bones, you will be brought forth? Far, far is that which you are promised. There is not but our worldly life. We die and live, and we will not be resurrected. He is not but a man who has invents a lie against Allah, and we are not believers in him. He said, "My Lord, support me because they deny." He said, "In a little while they will surely become regretful." So the blast seized them in truth, and We made them scum. So away with the wrongdoing people.

Then We produced after them other generations. No nation can precede its term, nor can they delay it. Then We sent Our messengers in succession. Every time a messenger came to a nation, they denied him. So We made some of them follow others and made them [others] stories. So away with a people who do not believe.

Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a clear authority to Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they were arrogant and were a haughty people. They said, "Shall we believe in two human beings like ourselves while their people worship us?" But they denied them and were among those destroyed. And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture that they might be guided. And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign and sheltered them on a high ground having stability and springs.

O messengers, eat from the good foods and work righteousness. Indeed, I, of what you do, am Knowing. And indeed, this, your community, is one community, and I am your Lord, so fear Me. But they divided their affair among themselves into sects, every faction rejoicing in what it has. So leave them in their confusion for a time. Do they think that what We provide them of wealth and children will hasten to them with good things? Rather, they do not perceive. Indeed, those who are fearful of their Lord. And those who believe in the signs of their Lord. And those who do not associate anything with their Lord. And those who give what they give while their hearts are fearful because they will be returning to their Lord. Those are the ones who hasten to good deeds and are the forerunners in them.

And We charge no soul except [with that within] its capacity, and with Us is a record that speaks the truth, and they will not be wronged. Rather, their hearts are in overflowing with this, and they have other deeds besides that, for which they are doing. Until, when We seize their affluent ones with punishment, at once they cry out, "Do not cry out today; indeed, you will not be aided by Us." My verses were recited to you, but you were turning back on your heels, arrogant about it, spending idle time there. Have they not pondered the Word? Or has there come to them that which did not come to their forefathers of old? Or do they not recognize their Messenger, so they deny it? Or do they say, "It is madness?" Rather, he has brought them the truth, while most of them, to the truth, are averse. And if the truth had followed their desires, the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them would have been ruined. Rather, We have brought them their message, but from their message they turn away. Or do you ask them for an exit? But the exit of your Lord is better, and He is the Best of providers. And indeed, you are inviting them to a straight path. And indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are deviating from the path. And if We had mercy on them and removed the harm that is upon them, they would persist in their transgression, wandering blindly. And We seized them with punishment, but they did not humble themselves before their Lord, nor did they supplicate. Until, when We opened to them a door of severe punishment, at once they were therein in despair.

It is He who created for you hearing and sight and hearts - little do you give thanks. And it is He who dispersed you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered. And it is He who gives life and causes death, and to Him belongs the alternation of the night and the day. Then will you not reason? They say like what the former peoples said. They say, "When we have died and become dust and bones, will we then be resurrected?" We and our fathers were promised this before. This is nothing but legends of the former peoples. Say, "To whom belongs the earth and whoever is in it, if you should know?" They will say, "To God." Say, "Then will you not remember?" Say, "Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Mighty Throne?" They will say, "To God." Say, "Then will you not fear God?" Say, "In whose hand is the dominion over all things? He protects, while none can protect Him, if you should know?" They will say, "To God." Say, "Then how are you bewitched?" Rather, We have brought them the truth, and indeed, they are liars. God has not taken a son, nor was there any god with Him. If so, each god would have taken away what he created, and some of them would have attempted to overcome others. Glory be to God, above what they describe. Knower of the unseen and the witnessed; so exalted is He above what they associate with Him.

Say, "My Lord, if only You would show me what they are promised. My Lord, do not place me among the wrongdoing people. And indeed, We are able to show you what We promise them. Repel evil with that which is best. Indeed, We are most knowing of what they describe." And say, "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the insinuations of the devils. And I seek refuge in You, my Lord, lest they be present."

Until, when death comes to one of them, he says, "My Lord, send me back [to the world] that I may do righteousness in that which I left behind." No! It is only a word he will say. And behind them is a barrier until the Day they are resurrected. And when the Trumpet is blown, there will be no kinship between them that Day, nor will they ask about one another. So those whose scales are heavy - those will be the successful. And those whose scales are light - those are the ones who have lost themselves in Hell, abiding eternally. The Fire will burn their faces, and they will be therein disgraced. Were not My verses recited to you, and you used to deny them? They will say, "Our Lord, our wretchedness overcame us, and we were a people astray. Our Lord, bring us out of it, and if we return, then we will be wrongdoers." He will say, "Remain despised therein and do not speak to me." Indeed, there was a party of My servants who said, "Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the Best of the merciful." But you took them in ridicule until they made you forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them. Indeed, I have rewarded them this Day for what they patiently endured - they are the successful. He will say, "How many years did you remain on the earth?" They will say, "We remained a day or part of a day, so ask the counters." He said, "You have only remained a little while, if you only knew."

Did you think that We created you in vain and that to Us you will not be returned? So exalted is Allah, the True King. There is no deity except Him, Lord of the Noble Throne. And whoever invokes along with Allah another deity for which he has no proof - then his account is only with his Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will not succeed. And say, "My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You are the best of the merciful."

A surah which We have revealed and imposed, and We have revealed therein clear verses that you may remember. The adulterer and the adulteress - flog each of them with a hundred stripes. And let not pity for them detain you in the matter of the religion of Allah, if you should believe in Allah and the Last Day. And let a party of the believers witness their punishment. The adulterer does not marry except an adulteress or a polytheist, and the adulteress - none marries her except an adulterer or a polytheist. And that is forbidden to the believers.

And those who accuse chaste women but do not produce four witnesses - lash them with eighty lashes and do not accept their testimony ever after, and those are the wicked. Except for those who repent after that and reform, then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

And those who accuse their wives but have no witnesses except themselves - the testimony of one of them shall be four testimonies by Allah that he is among the truthful. And the fifth [should be] that the curse of Allah be upon him, if he should be among the liars. And the fifth [should be] that the wrath of Allah be upon her, if he should be among the truthful. And had it not been for the grace of Allah upon you and His mercy, and that Allah is Forgiving and Wise.

Indeed, those who brought forth the slander are a group among you. Do not think it is evil for you; rather, it is good for you. For every person among them is what he has earned of sin. And he who took upon himself the greater part of it among them will have a great punishment. Why did not, when you heard it, the believing men and believing women think good of themselves and say, “This is an obvious slander?” Why did they not produce four witnesses for it? But since they do not produce witnesses, then it is those in the sight of Allah who are the liars. And had it not been for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy in this world and the Hereafter, a great punishment would have touched you for what you have uttered. When you received it with your tongues and said with your mouths that of which you had no knowledge and thought it was insignificant while it was in the sight of Allah grave. And why did not, when you heard it, you say, “It is not for us to speak of this. Glory be to You! This is a tremendous slander.” Allah admonishes you not to return to the like of it ever, if you are believers. And Allah makes clear to you the verses, and Allah is Knowing and Wise.

Indeed, those who like that immorality should be spread among those who have believed will have a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. And God knows, while you do not know. And had it not been for the grace of God upon you and His mercy and that God is Kind and Merciful.

O you who have believed, do not follow the footsteps of Satan. And whoever follows the footsteps of Satan - he indeed commands immorality and wrongdoing. And were it not for the grace of Allah upon you and His mercy, not one of you would ever have been pure. But Allah purifies whom He wills. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing. And let not those among you who are endowed with grace and wealth swear not to give to their relatives and the needy and the emigrants in the cause of Allah. And let them pardon and overlook. Would you not like that Allah should forgive you? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Indeed, those who accuse chaste, unaware, believing women are cursed in this world and the Hereafter, and they will have a great punishment. The Day their tongues, their hands, and their feet will bear witness against them as to what they used to do. That Day Allah will pay them in full their due compensation, and they will know that Allah is the Truth, the Evident. Evil women are for evil men, and evil men are for evil women; and good men are for good men, and good men are for good women. Those are clear of what they say. For them is forgiveness and noble provision.

O you who have believed, do not enter houses other than your own houses until you have asked permission and greeted their inhabitants. That is better for you that you may be reminded. But if you find no one therein, do not enter it until permission is given to you. And if it is said to you, "Go back," then go back; it is purer for you. And Allah is Knowing of what you do. There is no blame upon you for entering houses not inhabited in which there is provision for you. And Allah knows what you reveal and what you conceal.

Tell the believing men to lower their gaze and guard their private parts. That is purer for them. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what they do. And tell the believing women to lower their gaze and guard their private parts and not to display their adornment except that which appears thereof and to draw their headcovers over their bosoms and not to display their adornment except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their women, or those their right hands possess, or male attendants who have no desire, or children who have not yet attained knowledge of the private parts of women. And let them not stamp their feet so that what they hide of their adornment may be known. And repent to Allah all together, O believers, that you may succeed.

And marry those among you who are single and those among your male slaves and female slaves who are righteous. If they are poor, Allah will enrich them from His bounty. And Allah is All-Encompassing and Knowing. And let those who find not the wherewithal for marriage keep themselves chaste until Allah enriches them from His bounty. And those who seek a contract from those whom your right hands possess, then contract them a contract if you know good in them and give them from the wealth of Allah which He has given you. And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution if they desire chastity, seeking the goods of worldly life. And whoever compels them - then indeed, after their compulsion, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful. And We have certainly sent down to you clear verses and an example from those who passed on before you and an instruction for the righteous.

Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The example of His light is as a niche within which is a lamp, the lamp is within glass, the glass as if it were a pearly star lit from a blessed olive tree, neither of the east nor of the west, whose oil would almost glow even if untouched by fire. Light upon light. Allah guides to His light whom He wills. And Allah presents examples for the people, and Allah is Knowing of all things. [They are] in houses which Allah has permitted to be raised and that His name be mentioned therein. He is glorified therein in the mornings and the evenings. [They are] men whom neither commerce nor sale distracts from the remembrance of Allah and performance of prayer and giving of zakah. They fear a Day in which the hearts and eyes will turn about - that Allah may reward them for the best of what they did and increase them from His bounty. And Allah provides for whom He wills without account.

And those who disbelieve - their deeds are like a mirage in a lowland which a thirsty one thinks is water until, when he comes to it, he finds it is nothing but finds Allah with him and He will pay him his due. And Allah is swift in account. Or [they are] [like] darknesses within a deep sea which is covered by waves, upon which are waves, upon which are clouds - darknesses, one upon another. If he puts out his hand, he can scarcely see it. And he for whom Allah does not appoint light - for him there is no light.

Have you not seen that to Allah all who are in the heavens and the earth and the birds with outspread wings exalt Him? Each has known its prayer and its glorification. And Allah is Knowing of what they do. And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to Allah is the final destination. Have you not seen that Allah drives the clouds? Then He brings them together, then He makes them into a mass, and you see the rain emerge from within it. And He sends down from the sky, [many] mountains within which is hail. He strikes with it whom He wills and averts it from whom He wills. The flash of its lightning almost takes away the sight. Allah alternates the night and the day. Indeed in that is a lesson for those of vision. And Allah has created every living creature from water. And of them are some that crawl on their bellies, and some that walk on two legs, and some that walk on four. Allah creates what He wills. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.

We have sent down clear verses, and Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path. And they say, "We have believed in Allah and the Messenger, and we obey." But then a party of them turns away after that. And those are not believers. And when they are called to Allah and His Messenger to judge between them, at once a party of them turn away. But if the truth is with them, they come to him in submission. Is there a disease in their hearts, or do they doubt, or do they fear that Allah and His Messenger will deal unjustly with them? Rather, it is those who are the wrongdoers. The only statement of the believers, when they are called to Allah and His Messenger to judge between them, is to say, "We hear and we obey." And it is those who will be the successful. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger and fears Allah and keeps his duty to Him - it is those who are the successful. And they swear by Allah their most solemn oaths, "If you command them, they will surely go forth." Say, "Do not swear [your oaths] in a known manner of obedience." Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what you do. Say, "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger." But if they turn away, then upon him is only that which he is charged with, and upon you is that which you are charged with. And if you obey him, you will be guided. And upon the Messenger is only the clear notification.

Allah has promised those who believe among you and do righteous deeds that He will surely make them successors [to Him] upon the earth, just as He made those before them successors, and that He will surely establish for them their religion which He has approved for them, and that He will surely substitute for them, after their fear, security, [for] they worship Me, not associating anything with Me. But whoever disbelieves after that - then those are the wicked. And establish prayer and give zakah and obey the Messenger that you may receive mercy. Do not think that those who disbelieve can escape [Allah's] punishment upon the earth. Their refuge is the Fire, and wretched indeed is the destination.

O you who have believed, let those whom your right hands possess and those among you who have not yet reached puberty ask permission of you three times: before the dawn prayer and when you put off your clothing at noon and after the 'Isha prayer. These are three private places for you. There is no blame upon you or upon them after them, going about among you, one by one. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses, and Allah is Knowing and Wise. And when the children among you have attained puberty, let them ask permission as those before them have asked permission. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses, and Allah is Knowing and Wise. And as for women past childbearing age who no longer expect marriage, there is no blame upon them for putting aside their outer garments [otherwise] not displaying their adornment. But to abstain is better for them. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing. There is no blame upon the blind or upon the lame or upon the ill or upon yourselves - that you eat from your houses or the houses of your fathers or the houses of your mothers or the houses of your brothers or the houses of your sisters or the houses of your paternal uncles or the houses of your aunts or the houses of your maternal uncles or the houses of your maternal aunts or the houses of your friend. There is no blame upon you if you eat together or separately. So when you enter houses, greet one another with a greeting from God, blessed and good. Thus does God make clear to you the verses that you may understand.

The believers are only those who have believed in Allah and His Messenger, and when they are with him on a common matter, they do not depart until they have asked his permission. Those who ask your permission are those who believe in Allah and His Messenger. So when they ask your permission for some of their affairs, give permission to whom you will of them and ask forgiveness for them from Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful. Do not make the calling of the Messenger among you like the calling of one of you to another. Allah may know those of you who slip away secretly. So let those beware who oppose his command, lest some trial befall them or a painful punishment be inflicted upon them. Unquestionably, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. He certainly knows that which you are doing. And on the Day they will be returned to Him, He will inform them of what they did. And Allah is Knowing of all things.

Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion upon His Servant that he may be to the worlds a warner. To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and has not taken a son and has not had a partner in dominion. He created all things and determined them with [precise] determination.
