And they have taken besides Him gods who create nothing and are themselves created and possess no power to harm or benefit themselves, nor possess death or life or resurrection. And those who disbelieve say, "This is not but a falsehood he has invented, and another people have aided him in it." But they have brought about injustice and falsehood. And they say, "Legends of the former peoples which he has written down, and they are dictated to him morning and evening." Say, "He has sent it down who knows the secret in the heavens and the earth. Indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful."

And they said, “What is this Messenger who eats food and walks in the markets? Why has not an angel been sent down to him to be with him as a warner? Or a treasure thrown down to him, or he have a garden from which he eats?” And the wrongdoers said, “You follow none but a man bewitched.” See how they set forth for you examples, but they have gone astray and cannot find a way. Blessed is He who, if He wills, can grant you better than that - gardens beneath which rivers flow - and He can grant you palaces.

Rather, they denied the Hour, and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour a Blaze. When they see them from a distant place, they will hear its wrath and its roaring. And when they are thrown therein into a narrow place, chained together, they will cry out therein for destruction. Do not cry out today for a single destruction, but cry out for much destruction. Say, “Is that better or the Garden of Eternity which the righteous have been promised?” It will be for them a reward and a destination. They will have therein whatever they wish, abiding eternally. It is upon your Lord a promise which will be asked of.”

And the Day He will gather them and those they worshipped besides Allah and He will say, "Was it you who led these My servants astray, or were they themselves who went astray from the way?" They will say, "Glory be to You! It was not for us to take protectors besides You. But You provided for them and their fathers until they forgot the message and were a people who were ruined. They have denied you in what you say, but you are not able to avert [your enemies] or to help. And whoever among you does wrong - We will make him taste a great punishment. And We did not send before you any messengers except that they ate food and walked in the markets. And We have made some of you a trial for others - will you have patience?" And ever is your Lord Seeing.

And those who do not expect the meeting with Us will say, "Why were angels not sent down to us or why do we not see our Lord?" They have certainly been arrogant within themselves and have transgressed with great transgression. The Day they see the angels - no good news will be given that Day for the criminals, and they will say, "A forbidden, forbidden thing." And We will present to them whatever deeds they did and make it as scattered dust. The companions of Paradise, that Day, will be the best settlement and the best place to rest. And the Day the heaven will be split open with clouds and the angels will be sent down in successive revelation. The sovereignty that Day will belong to the Most Merciful, and it will be a difficult Day for the disbelievers. And the Day the wrongdoer will bite his hands and say, "Oh, would that I had taken with the Messenger a way! Oh, woe to me! Would that I had not taken so-and-so as a friend!" He led me astray from the message after it had come to me. And ever is Satan, to man, a deserter.

And the Messenger said, "O my Lord, indeed my people have taken this Qur'an to be something abandoned." And thus We have made for every prophet an enemy from among the criminals. And sufficient is your Lord as a Guide and a Helper. And those who disbelieve say, "Why was the Qur'an not revealed to him all at once?" Thus [it is] that We may strengthen thereby your heart. And We have spaced it distinctly. And they do not bring you an example except that We bring you the truth and the best explanation. Those who will be gathered on their faces into Hell - those are worse in position and further astray in way.

And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture and appointed with him his brother Aaron as a minister. Then We said, "Go both of you to the people who denied Our revelations," and We destroyed them with [complete] destruction. And the people of Noah, when they denied the messengers, We drowned them and made them a sign for the people. And We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment. And [so did] 'Aad and Thamud and the companions of Ar-Rass and many generations between them. And for each We presented examples, and each We destroyed with [complete] destruction. And they had certainly come upon the city on which was rained an evil rain. Did they not see it? Rather, they were not expecting resurrection.

And when they see you, they take you only in ridicule. “Is this he whom Allah has sent as a messenger?” He almost led us astray from our gods had we not been patient toward them. And they will know when they see the punishment who is most astray in way. Have you seen he who has taken as his god his [own] desire? Then would you be responsible for him? Or do you think that most of them hear or reason? They are not except like livestock. Rather, they are even more astray in way.

Have you not seen how your Lord extended the shadow? If He had willed, He could have made it stationary. Then We made the sun its guide. Then We seized it with a gentle seizure. And it is He who made for you the night as a covering and sleep as rest and made the day for resurrection. And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy and sends down from the sky pure water that We may revive thereby a dead land and give drink thereof to many of what We have created - livestock and people. And We have certainly distributed it among them that they may be reminded, but most of the people refuse except disbelief. And if We willed, We could have sent to every city a warner. So do not obey the disbelievers and strive against them with it with a great striving. And it is He who has released the two seas - one fresh and sweet and the other salty and bitter - and placed between them a barrier and an insurmountable partition. And it is He who created from water human beings and made them [relatives] by blood and marriage. And ever is your Lord competent. And they worship besides Allah that which neither benefits them nor harms them. And ever is the disbeliever, against his Lord, a supporter.

We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. Say, "I do not ask of you for this any payment, except that whoever wills should take to his Lord a way. And put your trust in the Ever-Living who does not die, and exalt [Allah] with praise. And sufficient is He, concerning the sins of His servants, as Acquainted. He who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six days, then established Himself on the Throne - the Most Gracious. So ask about Him one who is acquainted. And when it is said to them, "Prostrate to the Most Gracious," they say, "And what is the Most Gracious? Should we prostrate to that which you command us?" And it increases them in aversion. Blessed is He who has placed within the heaven constellations and placed therein a lamp and a moon giving light. And it is He who has made the night and the day in succession for whoever desires to remember or desires to be grateful.

The servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk upon the earth easily, and when the ignorant address them, they say, "Peace." And those who spend the night prostrating and standing before their Lord. And those who say, "Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell. Indeed, its punishment is ever perpetual." Indeed, it is an evil settlement and a residence. And those who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor niggardly, but are ever, between that, a medium [way]. And those who do not invoke with Allah another deity or kill the soul which Allah has forbidden, except by right, and do not commit unlawful sexual intercourse. And whoever should do that will meet a penalty. The punishment will be doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein in humiliation. Except for those who repent, believe and do righteous work. For them Allah will replace their evil deeds with good. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful. And whoever repents and does righteousness - indeed, he turns to Allah with [former] repentance. And those who do not bear false witness, and when they pass by ill speech, they pass by with dignity. And those who, when they are reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not fall upon them deaf and blind. And those who say, "Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous." Those will be rewarded with the highest chamber for what they patiently endured, and they will be met therein with greetings and peace. They will abide therein eternally. Excellent is the settlement and the residence. Say, "My Lord would not care for you were it not for your supplication. But you have denied, so it is bound to be."

Ta, Mim. These are the verses of the clear Book. Perhaps you would kill yourself with grief that they do not believe. If We will, We could send down to them a sign from the heaven, to which their necks would remain humbled. And there does not come to them a reminder from the Most Merciful except that they turn away from it. So they have denied. So there will come to them news of that which they used to ridicule. Have they not seen the earth - how much We have produced therein of every noble kind? Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers. And indeed, your Lord - it is He who is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

And remember when your Lord called to Moses, "Go to the wrongdoing people - the people of Pharaoh - will they not fear God?" He said, "My Lord, indeed I fear that they will deny me, and my chest will become constricted, and my tongue will not be fluent, so send to Aaron. And they have a sin against me, so I fear that they will kill me." He said, "No! Go with Our signs. Indeed, we are with you, listening." So go to Pharaoh and say, "Indeed, we are messengers from the Lord of the worlds. Send with us the Children of Israel." He said, "Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you remained among us for years of your life? And did you not do the deed that you did, while you were of the disbelievers?" He said, "I did it then, while I was of those astray. So I fled from you when I feared you. So my Lord bestowed upon me wisdom and made me one of the messengers." And that is a favor You bestowed upon me, that I enslaved the Children of Israel.

Pharaoh said, "And what is the Lord of the worlds?" He said, "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, if you should be certain." He said to those around him, "Do you not listen?" He said, "Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers of old." He said, "Indeed, your messenger who has been sent to you is mad." He said, "The Lord of the east and the west and whatever is between them, if you will but use reason." He said, "If you should take a god other than me, I will surely make you among the imprisoned." He said, "Even if I bring you something clear?" He said, "Then bring it, if you should be of the truthful." So he threw down his staff, and behold, it was a serpent evident. And he withdrew his hand, and behold, it was white to the onlookers. He said to the chiefs around him, "Indeed, this is a proficient magician. He wants to expel you from your land by his magic. So what do you command?" They said, "Put him and his brother off, and send among the cities gatherers who will bring to you every proficient magician." So the magicians were gathered together for an appointed time on a known day. And it was said to the people, "Are you going to gather? Perhaps we will follow the magicians, if they are the ones who will prevail."

So when the magicians came, they said to Pharaoh, "Should we have a reward if we are the victors?" He said, "Yes, and in that case you will be among those brought near." Moses said to them, "Cast down what you are casting down." So they threw down their ropes and their staffs and said, "By the might of Pharaoh, indeed we are the victors." Then Moses threw down his staff, and behold, it devoured what they were fabricating. So the magicians fell down in prostration. They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds, the Lord of Moses and Aaron." He said, "You believed in him before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your chief who has taught you magic. So you will surely know. I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you all." They said, "No harm! Indeed, to our Lord we will return." Indeed, we hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, if we were the first of the believers.

And We inspired Moses, "Travel by night with My servants. Indeed, you will be pursued." But Pharaoh sent gatherers into the cities. "Indeed, these are a small band. And indeed, they are enraging to Us. And indeed, We are all on guard." So We brought them out of gardens and springs, And treasures and a noble station. Thus We caused them to inherit it from the Children of Israel. So they pursued them at sunrise. And when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Moses said, "Indeed, we will be overtaken." He said, "By no means! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me." Then We inspired Moses, "Strike the sea with your staff." And it parted, and each portion was like a great towering mountain. And We brought near the others. And We saved Moses and those with him, all together. Then We drowned the others. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to believe. And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

And recite to them the news of Abraham, when he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?" They said, "We worship idols and remain devoted to them." He said, "Do they hear you when you call upon them? Or do they benefit you or harm you?" They said, "Rather, we found our fathers doing thus." He said, "Have you considered what you used to worship - you and your fathers of old - for indeed, they are an enemy to me, except for the Lord of the worlds. He who created me and it is He who guides me. And it is He who feeds me and gives me drink. And when I am ill, it is He who cures me. And He who will cause me to die and then bring me to life. And He who, I hope, will forgive me my sin on the Day of Judgment. My Lord, grant me wisdom and join me with the righteous. And grant me a reputation of truth among later generations. And make me one of the inheritors of the Garden of Pleasure. And forgive my father, for he was of the astray. And do not disgrace me on the Day they are resurrected - the Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children, except for one who comes to Allah with a sound heart."

Paradise will be brought near to the righteous, and Hellfire will be brought into view for the deviators. And it will be said to them, "Where are those you used to worship? Other than Allah, can they help you or are they victorious?" So they were thrown down therein, they and the deviators, and the soldiers of Satan, all together. They will say, while they are disputing therein, "By Allah, we were indeed in manifest error when we made you equal to the Lord of the worlds. And none led us astray except the criminals. So for us there are no intercessors, nor a close friend. If only we had another chance, we could be among the believers. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers. And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful."

The people of Noah denied the messengers. When their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not fear God? Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger. So fear God and obey me. And I do not ask of you for this any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds. So fear God and obey me." They said, "Shall we believe you while the lowest have followed you?" He said, "And I have no knowledge of what they used to do. Their account is only with my Lord, if you but perceived. And I will not drive away the believers. I am only a clear warner." They said, "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will surely be among the stoned." He said, "My Lord, indeed my people have denied. So judge between me and them with a judgment and save me and those with me of the believers." So We saved him and those with him in the laden ship. Then We drowned the rest after him. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers. And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

The Aad people denied the messengers. When their brother Hud said to them, “Will you not fear God? Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger. So fear God and obey me. And I do not ask of you for this any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.” Do you build on every high place a sign, amusing yourselves? And build for yourselves castles that you may live forever? And when you strike, you strike like tyrants. So fear God and obey me. And fear Him who provided you with what you know. He provided you with livestock and children and gardens and springs. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous Day. They said, “It is all the same to us whether you preach or are not among the preachers. This is not but the manner of the former peoples, and we will not be punished.” But they denied him, so We destroyed them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers. And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

Thamud denied the messengers, when their brother Salih said to them, "Will you not fear God? Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger. So fear God and obey me. And I do not ask of you any reward for it. My reward is only from the Lord of the worlds. Will you be left here secure? Among gardens and springs and crops and palm trees with soft fruit, and you carve out of the mountains, houses in splendor? So fear God and obey me. And do not obey the command of the transgressors - Those who cause corruption in the land and do not reform. They said, "You are only of those bewitched. You are not but a human being like us. So bring me a sign, if you should be of the truthful." He said, "This is a she-camel; she has her drink, and you have her drink on a known day. And do not touch her with harm, lest the punishment of a terrible Day seize you." So they hamstrung her, and in the morning they became regretful. So the punishment seized them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers. And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

The people of Lot denied the messengers. When their brother Lot said to them, "Will you not fear God? Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger. So fear God and obey me. And I do not ask of you any payment for it. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds. Do you approach males among the worlds and abandon what your Lord has created for you as mates? Rather, you are a transgressing people." They said, "If you do not desist, O Lot, you will surely be among those expelled." He said, "Indeed, I am of your work among those who detest it. My Lord, save me and my family from what they do." So We saved him and his family, all together, except an old woman among those who remained behind. Then We destroyed the others. And We rained upon them a rain - so evil was the rain of those who were warned. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers. And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

The companions of the thicket denied the messengers. When Shu'aib said to them, "Will you not fear God? Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger. So fear God and obey me. And I do not ask of you any payment for it. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds. Give full measure and do not be among the losers. And weigh with a straight balance. And do not deprive people of their due rights and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption. And fear Him who created you and the former generations." They said, "You are only of those charmed. You are not but a human being like us, and we think you are among the liars. So let fall upon us a fragment from the sky, if you should be of the truthful." He said, "My Lord is most knowing of what you do." But they denied him, so the punishment of the Day of Shadow seized them. Indeed, it was the punishment of a tremendous Day. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers. And indeed, your Lord - it is He who is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

And indeed, it is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds. The Trustworthy Spirit has brought it down upon your heart, that you may be among the warners. In a clear Arabic tongue. And indeed, it is in the scriptures of former times. Was it not a sign to them that the scholars of the Children of Israel knew it? And if We had sent it down to some non-Arab and he had recited it to them, they would not have believed in it. Thus We have caused it to enter the hearts of the criminals. They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment. So it will come upon them suddenly while they perceive not. And they will say, “Are we then reprieved?” Is it then that they seek to hasten Our punishment? Have you seen if We should give them enjoyment for years? Then there comes to them that which they were promised. What they were enjoying would not avail them. And We did not destroy a city except that it had warners. A reminder, and We were not wrongdoers. And the devils did not bring it down. Nor is it befitting for them, nor are they able to. Indeed, they are removed from hearing.

So do not invoke with Allah another deity, lest you be among the punished. And warn your nearest relatives. And lower your wing to those who follow you of the believers. But if they disobey you, then say, "Indeed, I am innocent of what you do." And rely upon the Exalted in Might, the Merciful. Who sees you when you stand up and your movement among those who prostrate. Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Knowing. Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend? They descend upon every slanderer and sinner. They listen only to a deviant, but most of them are liars. And as for the poets, the deviators follow them. Have you not seen that they wander in every valley? And that they say what they do not do? Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds and remember Allah much and defend themselves after they have been wronged. And those who do wrong will soon come to know to what [final] return they will be returned.

These are the verses of the Qur’an and a clear Book, a guidance and good tidings for the believers - those who establish prayer and give zakah, and of the Hereafter they are certain [in faith]. Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter - We have made their deeds pleasing to them, so they wander blindly. Those are the ones for whom is the worst punishment, and they, in the Hereafter, will be the greatest losers. And indeed, you receive the Qur’an from One Who is Wise and Knowing.

When Moses said to his family, "Indeed, I have perceived a fire. I will bring you from it information or bring you a burning torch that you may warm yourselves." And when he came to it, he was called, "Blessed are those in the Fire and those around it. And exalted is Allah, Lord of the worlds." "O Moses! Indeed, I am Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise." And throw down your staff. But when he saw it writhing as if it were a serpent, he turned in flight and did not look back. "O Moses! Fear not. Indeed, no messengers fear in My presence. Except for he who has done wrong and then substituted evil for good. Indeed, I am Forgiving and Merciful. And put your hand into the bosom of your garment; it will come out white without disease. [This is] nine signs to Pharaoh and his people. Indeed, they were a people of wickedness." But when Our clear signs came to them, they said, "This is obvious magic." And they denied them, while their souls were convinced thereof, out of injustice and arrogance. So see how was the end of the corrupters.

And We had certainly given knowledge to David and Solomon, and they said, "Praise be to Allah, who has favored us over many of His believing servants." And Solomon inherited David and said, "O mankind, we have been taught the language of birds, and we have been given of all things. Indeed, this is clearly bounty." And there were gathered for Solomon his soldiers of jinn and men and birds, and they were being driven in ranks. Until, when they came to the Valley of the Ants, an ant said, "O ants, enter your dwellings lest Solomon and his soldiers crush you while they perceive not." So he smiled, laughing at her statement and said, "My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to do righteousness of which You approve. And admit me by Your mercy into [the ranks of] Your righteous servants."

And he inspected the birds and said, "What is the matter with me that I do not see the hoopoe, or is he among the absent? I will surely punish him with a severe punishment or slaughter him, or he must bring me clear authority." But he remained not long. Then he said, "I have encompassed that which you have not encompassed, and I have come to you from Sheba with sure news. Indeed, I found a woman ruling them, and she has been given of all things, and she has a mighty throne. I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allah. And Satan has made their deeds pleasing to them and averted them from the way, so they are not guided. Will they not prostrate to Allah, who brings forth what is hidden in the heavens and the earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare? Allah - there is no god except Him - Lord of the Mighty Throne." He said, "We will see whether you have told the truth or are among the liars. Go with this letter of mine and deliver it to them; then turn away from them and see what they return."

She said, "O eminent ones, indeed a noble letter has been delivered to me. It is from Solomon, and indeed, it reads, 'In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Do not exalt yourselves over me, but come to me in submission.'" She said, "O eminent ones, advise me in my affair. I will not decide a matter until you witness it." They said, "We are men of strength and great might, and the command is yours, so consider what you will command." She said, "Indeed, when kings enter a city, they corrupt it and abase the most honorable of its people. And thus they do. And indeed, I am going to be sent to them with a gift to see with what the messengers return." But when he came to Solomon, he said, "Do you provide me with wealth? For what Allah has given me is better than what He has given you. Rather, you rejoice in your gift. Go back to them, and we will surely come to them with soldiers they cannot withstand, and we will drive them out from it humiliated and debased."

He said, "O eminent ones, which of you will bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?" An 'Ifrit from among the jinn said, "I will bring it to you before you rise from your place, and indeed, I am for this [true] strong and trustworthy." He who had knowledge of the Scripture said, "I will bring it to you before your glance returns to you." But when he saw it settled near him, he said, "This is from the bounty of my Lord to test me whether I will be grateful or ungrateful. And whoever is grateful is grateful only for himself. And whoever denies - then indeed, my Lord is Free of need and Generous." He said, "Disguise her throne for her; we will see whether she will be guided or will be among those who are not guided." So when she came, it was said, "Is this your throne?" She said, "It is as if it were it. And we were given knowledge before her, and we were Muslims." And that which she used to worship besides Allah prevented her. Indeed, she was from a disbelieving people. It was said to her, "Enter the palace." But when she saw it, she thought it was a deep pool, and she uncovered her legs. He said, "Indeed, it is a palace smooth of glass." She said, "My Lord! I have wronged myself, and I submit with Solomon to Allah, Lord of the worlds."

And We had certainly sent to Thamud their brother Salih, [saying], "Worship Allah," but at once they were two parties disputing. He said, "O my people, why do you hasten the evil before the good? Why do you not ask forgiveness of Allah that you may receive mercy?" They said, "We consider you and those with you to be an omen of evil." He said, "Your omen is with Allah. Rather, you are a people being tested." And there were in the city nine men who were spreading corruption in the land and not reforming. They said, "Swear by Allah that we will surely kill him and his family by night, then we will surely say to his guardian, 'We did not witness the destruction of his family, and indeed, we are truthful.'" But they planned a plan, and We planned a plan, while they perceived not. So see how was the end of their plan - We destroyed them and their people, all together. Those are their houses, desolate because of what they had done. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who know. And We saved those who believed and were fearing Allah.

And [mention] Lot, when he said to his people, “Do you commit immorality while you are seeing? Do you indeed approach men with desire instead of women? Rather, you are a people behaving ignorantly.” And there was no answer to his people except that they said, “Expel the family of Lot from your city. Indeed, they are people who keep themselves pure.” So We saved him and his family, except for his wife; We destined her to be among those who remained behind. And We rained down upon them a rain - and evil was the rain of those who were warned.

Say, "Praise be to Allah, and peace be upon His chosen servants. Is Allah better than what they associate with Him? Is He who created the heavens and the earth and sent down for you from the sky water, and We caused to grow thereby gardens of delight - it was not for you to cause the trees thereof to grow? Is there a deity with Allah? Rather, they are a people who ascribe equals? Is He who made the earth a stable place and placed within it rivers and placed for it firm mountains and placed between the two seas a barrier? Is there a deity with Allah? Rather, most of them do not know? Is He who answers the distressed when he calls upon Him and removes evil and makes you successors on the earth? Is there a deity with Allah? Little do you remember? Is He who guides you through the darknesses of the land and sea and who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy? Is there a deity with Allah? Exalted is Allah above what they associate with Him? Is He who begins creation and then repeats it, and who provides for you from the heaven and the earth? Is there a deity with Allah? Say, "Produce your proof, if you should be truthful." Say, "None in the heavens and the earth knows the unseen except Allah, and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected." Rather, their knowledge will comprehend only the Hereafter. Rather, they are in doubt thereof. Rather, they are blind thereto.

And those who disbelieve say, "When we are dust, and our fathers, will we indeed be brought forth?" We were already promised this, we and our fathers before. This is not but legends of the ancients. Say, "Travel through the land and observe what was the end of the criminals. And do not grieve over them and do not be in distress over what they plot." And they say, "When will this promise come to pass, if you should be truthful?" Say, "Perhaps there will be some of that which you are hastening upon after you." And indeed, your Lord is full of bounty to mankind, but most of them do not give thanks. And indeed, your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they declare. And there is nothing hidden within the heaven or earth except that it is in a clear register.

This Qur’an relates to the Children of Israel most of that over which they differ. And indeed, it is guidance and mercy for the believers. Indeed, your Lord will judge between them with His judgment. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.

So rely upon Allah, indeed, you are upon the clear truth. Indeed, you cannot make the dead hear, nor can you make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs and depart. And you cannot guide the blind from their error. You can only make hear those who believe in Our verses, and they are Muslims.
And when the word comes to pass against them, We will bring forth for them a creature from the earth that will speak to them, [saying], “O mankind, [O Muhammad] ...

Whoever brings a good deed will have better than it, and they, from the terror of that Day, will be secure. But whoever brings an evil deed, their faces will be thrown into the Fire. Are you recompensed except for what you used to do? I have only been commanded to worship the Lord of this city, who has made it sacred, and to Him belongs all things. And I have been commanded to be of the Muslims [in submission], and to recite the Qur’an. So whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] himself. And whoever goes astray - say, "I am only of the warners." And say, "Praise be to God. He will show you His signs, and you will recognize them. And your Lord is not unaware of what you do."

Ta, Mim. These are the verses of the clear Book. We recite to you, [O Muhammad], from the news of Moses and Pharaoh, in truth, for a people who believe. Indeed, Pharaoh exalted himself in the land and made its people into factions, oppressing a party of them, slaughtering their sons and keeping their women alive. Indeed, he was of the corrupters. And We desired to bestow a favor upon those who were oppressed in the land and make them leaders and make them inheritors. And establish them in the land and show Pharaoh and Haman and their soldiers from them that which they feared.

And We inspired the mother of Moses, "Suckle him, but when you fear for him, cast him into the river and do not fear and do not grieve. Indeed, We will return him to you and will make him one of the messengers." But the family of Pharaoh picked him up, so that he might be to them an enemy and a grief. Indeed, Pharaoh and Haman and their soldiers were sinners. And the wife of Pharaoh said, "A comfort of the eye for me and for you. Do not kill him; perhaps he may benefit us, or we may adopt him as a son," while they perceive not. And the heart of Moses' mother became empty. She almost disclosed him had We not strengthened her heart so that she might be of the believers. And she said to his sister, "Follow him," and she watched him from afar while they perceived not. And We had forbidden him wet nurses before. She said, "Shall I direct you to a family who will take care of him for you and be sincere to him?" So We restored him to his mother that her eye may be comforted and she not grieve and that she may know that the promise of Allah is truth, but most of them do not know.

And when he reached his full strength and was of sound mind, We gave him judgment and knowledge. Thus do We reward the doers of good. And he entered the city at a time when its people were unaware, and he found therein two men fighting, one of his party and the other of his enemy. The one of his party called for help against the one of his enemy, so Moses struck him and killed him. He said, "This is from the work of Satan. Indeed, he is a clear, misleading enemy." He said, "My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, so forgive me." So He forgave him. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful. He said, "My Lord, because You have bestowed favor upon me, I will never be a supporter of the criminals." So he entered the city fearfully, watching, and behold, he who had sought his help the day before called for his help. Moses said to him, "Indeed, you are clearly in error." But when he intended to strike the one who was an enemy to them both, he said, "O Moses, do you wish to kill me as you killed a person yesterday? You only desire to be a tyrant upon the earth. And you do not desire to be among the reformers."

And a man came running from the farthest part of the city. He said, "O Moses, indeed the eminent ones are conspiring against you to kill you, so go out. Indeed, I am to you among the sincere advisers." So he went out from it, fearful and waiting. He said, "My Lord, save me from the wrongdoing people."

And when he set out toward Madyan, he said, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to the right way." And when he came to the watering place of Madyan, he found there a group of people watering their flocks, and he found besides them two women holding back their flocks. He said, "What is the matter with you?" They said, "We do not water [our flocks] until the shepherds depart, and our father is an old man." So he watered their flocks for them, then turned to the shade and said, "My Lord, indeed I am, for whatever good You may send down to me, in need." Then one of the two women came to him, walking shyly. She said, "Indeed, my father invites you that he may reward you for having watered our flocks for us." So when he came to him and related to him the story, he said, "Fear not; you have been saved from the wrongdoing people." One of the two women said, "O my father, hire him. Indeed, the best one you can hire is the strong and trustworthy." He said, "Indeed, I want to marry you to one of these two daughters of mine on condition that you serve me for eight years. But if you complete ten, it will be of your own accord. And I do not want to make it difficult for you. You will find me, if Allah wills, among the righteous." He said, "That is between me and you. Whichever of the two terms you complete, there will be no aggression against me. And Allah, over what we say, is Witness."

When Moses had fulfilled the term and was travelling with his family, he perceived a fire on the side of the mount. He said to his family, "Wait here; I have perceived a fire. Perhaps I can bring you some information from it or a burning ember from the fire that you may warm yourselves." But when he came to it, he was called from the right side of the valley, in the blessed spot, from the tree, "O Moses, indeed I am Allah, Lord of the worlds. And throw down your staff." But when he saw it writhing as if it were a snake, he turned and fled and did not look back. "O Moses, come forward and fear not; indeed, you are of those who are secure. Put your hand into the bosom of your garment; it will come out white without disease. And draw close to yourself your wing from fear. These are two proofs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his chiefs. Indeed, they were a wicked people."

He said, "My Lord, indeed I have killed one of them, and I fear that they will kill me. And my brother Aaron is more eloquent than I in speech, so send him with me as a support to confirm me. Indeed, I fear that they will deny me." He said, "We will strengthen you through your brother, and give you both authority so that they will not reach you with Our signs. You and those who follow you will be the predominant."

So when Moses came to them with Our clear signs, they said, "This is not but invented magic, and we have not heard of this among our forefathers of old." And Moses said, "My Lord is most knowing of who has brought guidance from Him and of who will have the final home. Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed." And Pharaoh said, "O eminent ones, I do not know of any god for you other than me. So kindle for me, O Haman, upon the clay, and make for me a tower that I may look up to the God of Moses. And indeed, I think he is of the liars." And he and his soldiers were arrogant upon the land without right, and they thought that to Us they would not be returned. So We seized him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea. Then see how was the end of the wrongdoers. And We made them leaders inviting to the Fire, and on the Day of Resurrection they will not be aided. And We pursued them with a curse in this world, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be among the despised. And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture after We destroyed the former generations as insight for the people and guidance and mercy that perhaps they would be reminded.

You were not on the western side when We gave Moses the command, nor were you among the witnesses. But We raised up generations, and life was prolonged for them. And you were not dwelling among the people of Madyan, reciting to them Our verses, but We were messengers. And you were not on the side of the mount when We called. But [it was] a mercy from your Lord that you may warn a people to whom no warner had come before you, that perhaps they will be reminded.

And had it not been that a disaster should strike them for what their hands have put forth, they would say, “Our Lord, why did you not send to us a messenger so we could follow Your signs and be among the believers?” But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, “Why was he not given the like of what was given to Moses?” Did they not disbelieve in what was given to Moses before? They said, “Two magics supporting each other.” And they said, “Indeed, we are disbelievers in both.” Say, “Then bring a scripture from Allah that is better guidance than both of them, that I may follow it, if you should be truthful.” But if they do not respond to you, then know that they only follow their own desires. And who is more astray than he who follows his desire without guidance from Allah? Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

And We have certainly conveyed to them the Word that perhaps they will remember. Those to whom We gave the Scripture before it - they believe in it. And when it is recited to them, they say, "We believe in it; indeed, it is the truth from our Lord. Indeed, we were, before it, Muslims." Those will be given their reward twice for what they patiently endured and avert evil with good, and they spend from what We have provided them. And when they hear ill speech, they turn away from it and say, "To us are our deeds, and to you are your deeds. Peace be upon you. We seek not the ignorant." Indeed, you do not guide whom you like, but Allah guides whom He wills. And He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.

They say, "If we follow the guidance with you, we will be snatched away from our land." Have We not established for them a secure sanctuary to which are brought the fruits of all things as provision from Us? But most of them do not know. And how many a city have We destroyed that was insolent in its life? Those were their dwellings; they were not inhabited after them except a little, and it was We who were the inheritors. And your Lord would not destroy cities until He had sent to their mother a messenger reciting to them Our verses. And We would not destroy cities except while their people were wrongdoers.

Whatever you have been given is but the enjoyment of worldly life and its adornment. But what is with Allah is better and more lasting. Then will you not reason? Is he to whom We have promised a good promise and he will attain it like he to whom We have given enjoyment of worldly life and then, on the Day of Resurrection, will he be among those brought forth? And the Day He will call to them and say, "Where are My associates about whom you claimed?" Those upon whom the Word has come into effect will say, "Our Lord, these are the ones we misled - we misled them as we were misled. We disavow ourselves before You - they did not worship us." And it was said, "Call upon your associates." So they called upon them, but they did not respond to them, and they saw the punishment, had they only been guided. And the Day He will call to them and say, "What was your response to the messengers?" And the news will be hidden from them that Day, so they will not ask about one another. But as for he who repents, believes, and does righteousness, perhaps he will be among the successful.

And your Lord creates what He wills and chooses. It is not for them to choose. Glory be to Allah, and He is far above what they associate with Him. And your Lord knows what their hearts conceal and what they declare. And He is Allah - there is no deity except Him. To Him be praise in the first and the last, and His is the judgement, and to Him you will be returned. Say, "Have you considered, if Allah made the night continuous for you until the Day of Resurrection, what god other than Allah could bring you light? Then will you not hear?" Say, "Have you considered, if Allah made the day continuous for you until the Day of Resurrection, what god other than Allah could bring you night in which to rest? Then will you not see?" And out of His mercy He made for you the night and the day that you may rest therein and that you may seek of His bounty and that you may be grateful. And the Day He will call to them and say, "Where are My associates whom you used to claim?" And We will extract from every nation a witness and say, "Produce your proof." So they will know that the truth belongs to Allah, and lost from them is that which they used to invent.

Indeed, Korah was of the people of Moses, but he oppressed them, and We had given him of treasures, the keys of which would have been a burden to a band of strong men. When his people said to him, "Do not exult. Indeed, Allah does not like the exultant. But seek, through that which Allah has given you, the home of the Hereafter; and do not neglect your portion of this world. And do good as Allah has been good to you, and seek not corruption on the earth. Indeed, Allah does not like corrupters." He said, "It has only been given to me because of knowledge I have." Did he not know that Allah had destroyed before him generations greater in strength and greater in accumulation? And the criminals are not asked about their sins. Then he came out before his people in his adornment. Those who desired the life of this world said, "Oh, would that we had like that which Korah has been given. Indeed, he is one of great fortune." And those who were given knowledge said, "Woe to you! The reward of Allah is better for whoever believes and does righteousness. And none is granted it except the steadfast."

So We caused the earth to swallow him and his home. And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allah, nor was he among those who could defend themselves. And those who had wished to be in his place the day before began to say, “It is as if Allah enlarges the provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts it. Had it not been for Allah’s favor upon us, He would have caused the earth to swallow us up.” And it is as if the disbelievers would not succeed. That is the home of the Hereafter We assign to those who do not desire exaltedness upon the earth or corruption. And the [best] outcome is for the righteous. Whoever brings a good deed will have better than it, but whoever brings an evil deed - then not will those who do evil be recompensed except for what they used to do.

Indeed, He who imposed the Qur’an upon you will surely bring you back to a place of return. Say, “My Lord is most knowing of who has brought guidance and who is in clear error.” And you did not expect that the Book would be revealed to you except as a mercy from your Lord. So never be a supporter of the disbelievers. And do not let them avert you from the verses of Allah after they have been revealed to you. And invite to your Lord and do not be of those who associate others with Him. And do not invoke with Allah another deity. There is no deity except Him. Everything will perish except His Face. To Him belongs the judgement, and to Him you will be returned.

Alif, Lam, Meem. Do people think that they will be left to say, "We believe" and they will not be tested? And We have certainly tested those before them - so Allah will surely make evident those who are truthful and He will surely make evident the liars. Or do those who do evil deeds think that they can outpace Us? Evil is that which they judge. Whoever hopes for the meeting with Allah - then indeed, the term appointed by Allah is coming, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing. And whoever strives only strives for himself. Indeed, Allah is free from need of the worlds. But those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will surely remove from them their misdeeds and will surely reward them according to the best of what they used to do.

And We have enjoined upon man, to his parents, good treatment. But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them. To Me is your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do. And those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will surely admit them among the righteous.

And among the people is he who says, "We believe in Allah," but when he is harmed for the cause of Allah, he considers the trial of the people to be like the punishment of Allah. But if victory comes from your Lord, they will surely say, "Indeed, we were with you." Is not Allah best aware of what is within the breasts of the worlds? And Allah will surely make evident those who believe, and He will surely make evident the hypocrites. And those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Follow our way, and we will bear your sins." But they will not bear any of their sins. Indeed, they are liars. And they will surely bear their own burdens and other burdens besides their burdens, and they will be asked on the Day of Resurrection about what they used to invent.

And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he remained among them a thousand years minus fifty years, and the flood seized them while they were wrongdoers. But We saved him and the companions of the ark and made it a sign for the worlds.

And [mention] Abraham, when he said to his people, "Worship God and fear Him. That is better for you, if you only knew." You only worship idols besides God and invent falsehood. Indeed, those you worship besides God do not possess for you any provision. So seek provision from God and worship Him and be grateful to Him. To Him you will be returned. And if you deny, then nations before you denied. And the Messenger has no duty except to convey clearly.

Have they not seen how Allah originates creation and then repeats it? Indeed, that, for Allah, is easy. Say, "Travel through the earth and observe how He originated creation. Then Allah will produce the final creation. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent. He punishes whom He wills and has mercy on whom He wills, and to Him you will be returned. And you will not cause failure upon the earth or in the heaven, and you have not besides Allah any protector or helper. And those who disbelieve in the verses of Allah and in the meeting with Him - those have despaired of My mercy, and those will have a painful punishment.

But the only answer of his people was that they said, "Kill him or burn him." But Allah saved him from the Fire. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe. And he said, "You have only taken idols besides Allah out of affection among yourselves in worldly life. But on the Day of Resurrection some of you will disbelieve in others and curse one another, and your refuge will be the Fire, and you will have no helpers." So Lot believed him and said, "Indeed, I will emigrate to my Lord. Indeed, it is He who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise." And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob, and We placed among his descendants prophethood and scripture. And We gave him his reward in this world, and indeed, in the Hereafter, he will be among the righteous.

And [mention] Lot, when he said to his people, "Indeed, you commit an immorality such as no one before you has committed before among the worlds. Is it that you approach men and block the way and commit in your assemblies evil?" And there was no answer to his people except that they said, "Bring us the punishment of Allah, if you should be of the truthful." He said, "My Lord, help me against the corrupting people." And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings, they said, "Indeed, we are going to destroy the people of this city. Indeed, its people have been wrongdoers." He said, "Indeed, within it is Lot." They said, "We know best who is within it. We will surely save him and his family, except his wife; she will be among those who remain behind." And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was distressed because of them and felt straitened for them, and they said, "Do not fear and do not grieve. Indeed, We will save you and your family. Except for your wife; she will be among those who remain behind." Indeed, We are going to send down upon the people of this city a punishment from the sky because they used to defiantly disobey. And We have certainly left therein a clear sign for a people who use reason.

And to Madyan [We sent] their brother Shuaib. He said, “O my people, worship Allah and hope for the Last Day and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption.” But they denied him, so the earthquake seized them, and they became within their homes fallen down.

And 'Aad and Thamud - and their dwellings have become clear to you. And Satan has made their deeds pleasing to them and averted them from the way, while they were insightful. And Korah and Pharaoh and Haman - and indeed Moses had come to them with clear proofs, but they were arrogant upon the land and were not forerunners. So We seized each for his sin. And among them was he upon whom We sent a storm of stones, and among them was he whom the shriek seized, and among them was he whom We caused the earth to swallow, and among them was he whom We drowned. And Allah would not wrong them, but they were wronging themselves.

The parable of those who take protectors other than Allah is that of the spider who takes a home. And indeed, the flimsiest of homes is the spider’s home, if they only knew. Indeed, Allah knows whatever they invoke besides Him, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise. And these examples We present to the people, but none grasps them except those of knowledge.

Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth. Indeed in that is a sign for the believers. Recite what has been revealed to you of the Book and establish prayer. Indeed, prayer prohibits immorality and wrongdoing, and the remembrance of Allah is greater. And Allah knows that which you do.

And do not argue with the People of the Scripture except in a way that is best, except for those who commit injustice among them, and say, "We believe in that which was revealed to us and revealed to you. And our God and your God is one, and we are Muslims [in submission] to Him." And thus We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], the Book. So those to whom We gave the Scripture believe in it. And among these are some who believe in it. And none reject Our verses except the disbelievers.

You did not recite before it any scripture, nor did you inscribe it with your right hand; then the falsifiers would have had doubts. Rather, it is clear verses within the breasts of those who have been given knowledge. And none reject Our verses except the wrongdoers. And they say, "Why were verses not sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, "The verses are only with God, and I am only a clear warner." Was it not sufficient for them that We sent down to you the Book which is recited to them? Indeed in that is a mercy and a reminder for a people who believe. Say, "Sufficient is God between me and you as a Witness. He knows what is in the heavens and the earth." But those who believe in falsehood and disbelieve in God - it is they who are the losers.

And they ask you to hasten the punishment. And were it not for a specified term, the punishment would have come upon them. And it will come upon them suddenly while they do not perceive. They ask you to hasten the punishment. And indeed, Hell will encompass the disbelievers. The Day the punishment will cover them from above them and from beneath their feet and He will say, "Taste what you used to do."

O My servants who have believed, indeed My earth is spacious, so worship Me. Every soul will taste death, then to Us you will be returned. And those who have believed and done righteous deeds - We will surely assign them lofty rooms in Paradise beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. Excellent is the reward of the workers - those who are patient and upon their Lord rely. And how many a creature carries not its own provision? Allah provides for it and for you. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

And if you ask them, "Who created the heavens and the earth and subjected the sun and the moon?" they will surely say, "Allah." So how are they deluded? Allah enlarges provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts it. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of all things. And if you ask them, "Who sends down water from the sky and revives the earth thereby after its lifelessness?" they will surely say, "Allah." Say, "Praise be to Allah." But most of them do not reason. And what is this worldly life except diversion and amusement. And the home of the Hereafter - that is the life, if only they knew. But when they embark on a ship, they supplicate Allah, sincere to Him in religion. But when He brings them safe to land, at once they associate others with Him [in worship], [that they may] disbelieve in what We have given them and enjoy themselves. They are going to know. Have they not seen that We have made a secure sanctuary, while people are being snatched away all around them? Then is it in falsehood that they believe, and in the favor of Allah that they deny? And who is more unjust than he who invents a lie about Allah or denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell an abode for the disbelievers? And those who strive for Us - We will surely guide them to Our ways. And indeed, Allah is with the doers of good.

Alif, Lam, Meem. The Romans have been defeated. In the lowest land, but after their defeat they will overcome. Within three to nine years. To Allah belongs the command before and after. And that Day the believers will rejoice. In the victory of Allah He gives victory to whom He wills. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful. [It is] the promise of Allah - Allah does not fail in His promise, but most of the people do not know. They know only the outward appearance of the worldly life, but of the Hereafter they are heedless.

Have they not reflected within themselves? Allah did not create the heavens and the earth and all that is between them except in truth and for a specified term. And indeed, many of the people, concerning the meeting with their Lord, are disbelievers. Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? They were mightier than them in strength and tilled the earth and developed it more than they developed it. And there came to them their messengers with clear proofs. So it was not Allah that would wrong them, but they were wronging themselves. Then the end of those who did evil was the worst, because they denied the signs of Allah and used to ridicule them. Allah originates creation; then He will repeat it, then to Him you will be returned. And on the Day the Hour appears, the criminals will be in despair. And they will have no intercessors from among their associates, and they will be, in their associates, disbelievers. And on the Day the Hour appears, that Day they will be dispersed. Then as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, they will be in a garden, rejoicing. But as for those who disbelieved and denied Our signs and the meeting of the Hereafter - those will be brought to the punishment.

So glory be to Allah when you reach the evening and when you reach the morning. And to Him be praise in the heavens and the earth, and in the evening and when you reach the noonday. He brings the living out of the dead and brings the dead out of the living. And He gives life to the earth after its lifelessness, and thus you will be brought forth. And among His signs is that He created you from dust; then, behold, you are human beings dispersing. And among His signs is that He created for you mates from among yourselves, that you may find tranquility in them, and He put between you affection and mercy. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought. And among His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the diversity of your languages ​​and colors. Indeed in that are signs for those of knowledge. And among His signs is your sleep by night and by day, and your seeking of His bounty. Indeed in that are signs for a people who listen. And among His signs is that He shows you lightning, [causing] fear and hope, and He sends down water from the sky and gives life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason. And among His signs is that the heaven and the earth stand by His command; then, when He calls you with one call from the earth, at once, you come forth. And to Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth, all devoutly obedient to Him. It is He who begins creation and then repeats it, and that is easier for Him. And to Him belongs the highest description in the heavens and the earth. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

He has set forth for you an example from yourselves: Do you have among those whom your right hands possess any partners in what We have provided for you so that you would be equal therein? You fear them as you fear yourselves. Thus do We detail the verses for a people who use reason. Rather, those who do wrong follow their own desires without knowledge. So who will guide whom Allah has sent astray? And they will have no helpers. So direct your face toward the religion, inclining to truth. [Adhere to] the nature of Allah upon which He has created mankind. No change should there be in the creation of Allah. That is the right religion, but most people do not know. Turn [to Him], and fear Him and establish prayer and do not be of those who associate others with Allah. [Adhere to] those who have divided their religion and become sects, every faction rejoicing in what it has.

And when harm touches people, they invoke their Lord, turning to Him in repentance. Then when He lets them taste mercy from Him, at once a party of them associate others with their Lord, that they may disbelieve in what We have given them, so enjoy yourselves and you will soon know. Or have We sent down to them authority so that he would speak of what they used to associate with Him? And when We let people taste mercy, they rejoice therein; but if evil befalls them for what their hands have put forth, at once they despair. Do they not see that Allah extends provision to whom He wills and restricts it? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

So give to the relative his right and [also] to the needy and the traveler. That is best for those who desire the countenance of Allah . And it is those who will be successful. And whatever you give in interest that it may increase within the people's wealth - it does not increase with Allah. And whatever you give in zakat, desiring the countenance of Allah - it is those who will be multiplied. Allah is He who created you, then provided for you, then will cause you to die, then will bring you to life. Is there among your associates any who does any of that? Glory be to Him, and exalted is He above what they associate with Him. Corruption has appeared throughout the land and sea because of what the hands of people have earned so He may let them taste some of what they have done that perhaps they will return.

Say, "Travel through the land and observe what was the end of those before. Most of them were polytheists. So direct your face toward the right religion before there comes from Allah a Day from which there is no repelling. That Day they will be divided. Whoever disbelieves - upon him is his disbelief, and whoever does righteousness - it is for themselves that they prepare [for themselves] - that He may reward those who believe and do righteous deeds out of His bounty. Indeed, He does not like the disbelievers."

And among His signs is that He sends the winds as good tidings and that He may give you a taste of His mercy and that the ships may sail by His command and that you may seek of His bounty; perhaps you will be grateful. And We had already sent before you messengers to their people, and they came to them with clear proofs, so We took retribution from those who committed crimes; and it was incumbent upon Us to support the believers. It is Allah who sends the winds, and they stir up the clouds, then He spreads them in the sky however He wills, and makes them into fragments, and you see the rain emerge from within them. Then when He afflicts with it whom He wills of His servants, at once they rejoice. Although they were, before that which descended upon them from before that, in despair. So look at the traces of Allah's mercy - how He revives the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed, that is the Giver of Life to the dead, and He is over all things competent. And if We send a wind and they see it yellow, they will continue to disbelieve after that. For indeed, you cannot make the dead hear, nor can you make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs and depart. And you cannot guide the blind from their error. You can only make hear those who believe in Our verses, and they are Muslims.
God is He who created you from weakness, then made after weakness strength, then made after strength weakness and gray hair. He creates what He wills, and He is the Knowing, the Competent.

And on the Day the Hour will appear, the criminals will swear that they had not remained [in the world] except for an hour. Thus were they deluded. And those who were given knowledge and faith will say, "Indeed, you have remained in the Book of Allah until the Day of Resurrection." This is the Day of Resurrection, but you did not know. So on that Day, the excuse of those who did wrong will not benefit them, nor will they be asked to repent. And We have certainly presented for the people in this Qur'an every [kind of] example. And if you bring them a sign, those who disbelieve will surely say, "You are not but falsifiers." Thus does Allah set a seal upon the hearts of those who do not know. So be patient. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And do not let those who have no certainty impress you.

Alif, Lam, Meem. These are the verses of the Wise Book, a guidance and a mercy for the doers of good - those who establish prayer and give zakah, and of the Hereafter they are certain [in faith]. Those are upon [right] guidance from their Lord, and it is those who are the successful.

And among the people is he who buys the amusement of speech to mislead [people] from the way of Allah without knowledge and takes it in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating punishment. And when Our verses are recited to him, he turns away arrogantly as if he had not heard them, as if there was deafness in his ears. So give him tidings of a painful punishment. Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds will have gardens of pleasure, abiding therein eternally. [It is] the promise of Allah in truth, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

He created the heavens without pillars that you can see, and He cast into the earth firm mountains, lest it should shift with you, and He dispersed therein every [kind of] creature. And We sent down water from the sky, and caused to grow therein every [kind of] noble pair. This is the creation of Allah, so show me what those other than Him have created. Rather, the wrongdoers are in manifest error.

And We had certainly given Luqman wisdom, [saying], “Be grateful to Allah. And whoever is grateful is grateful for [the benefit of] himself. And whoever denies - then indeed, Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.” And when Luqman said to his son while he was advising him, “O my son, do not associate anything with Allah. Indeed, association is a great injustice.”

And We have enjoined upon man, concerning his parents - his mother carried him, with weakness upon weakness, and his weaning is thirty months - [saying], "Be grateful to Me and to your parents; to Me is the final destination." But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them but accompany them in this world with appropriate kindness and follow the way of those who turn back to Me. Then to Me is your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.

O my son, indeed if it be the weight of a grain of mustard seed and be within a rock or in the heavens or in the earth, Allah will bring it forth. Indeed, Allah is Subtle and Acquainted. O my son, establish prayer, enjoin what is right, forbid what is wrong, and be patient over what befalls you. Indeed, [all] that is of the matters [requiring] determination. And do not turn your cheek [in contempt] toward people and do not walk through the earth exultantly. Indeed, Allah does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful. And be moderate in your pace and lower your voice. Indeed, the most disagreeable of sounds is the braying of donkeys.

Have you not seen that Allah has subjected to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth and has completed His favors upon you, both apparent and hidden? And among the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening Book. And when it is said to them, "Follow what Allah has revealed," they say, "Rather, we will follow that upon which we found our fathers." Even if Satan were inviting them to the punishment of the Blaze? And whoever submits his face to Allah while he is a doer of good has grasped the most trustworthy handhold. And to Allah is the outcome of all matters. And whoever disbelieves - let not his disbelief grieve you. To Us is their return, and We will inform them of what they did. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts. We provide for them for a little; then We will force them to a severe punishment. And if you ask them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" they will surely say, "Allah." Say, "Praise be to Allah." But most of them do not know. To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

And if all the trees on the earth were pens and the sea, with seven more seas to replenish it, were ink, the Words of God could not be exhausted. Indeed, God is Exalted in Might and Wise. He did not create you and resurrect you except as a single soul. Indeed, God is Hearing and Seeing.

Have you not seen that Allah merges the night into the day and merges the day into the night and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term? And that Allah, with what you do, is Acquainted. That is because Allah is the Truth, and that which they invoke besides Him is falsehood, and because Allah is the Most High, the Grand. Have you not seen that the ships sail upon the sea by the grace of Allah that He may show you some of His signs? Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful. And when waves cover them like canopies, they supplicate Allah, sincere to Him in religion. But when He brings them safe to land, then among them is he who is moderate. And none rejects Our signs except every treacherous, ungrateful person.

O mankind, fear your Lord and dread a Day when no father will avail his son, nor will a son avail his father at all. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. So let not the worldly life delude you, and let not the Deceiver delude you about Allah. Indeed, Allah has knowledge of the Hour. He sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs. And no soul perceives what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul perceives in what land it will die. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Acquainted.

Alif, Lam, Meem. The revelation of the Book is from the Lord of the worlds. Or do they say, “He has invented it?” Rather, it is the truth from your Lord that you may warn a people to whom no warner came before you that they may be guided.

It is Allah who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six days, then He established Himself on the Throne. You have not besides Him any protector or intercessor. Then will you not remember? He directs the affair from the heaven to the earth, then it will ascend to Him in a Day, the extent of which is a thousand years of those which you count. That is the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Exalted in Might, the Merciful. He who perfected everything which He created and began the creation of man from clay. Then He made his descendants from an extract of despised water. Then He proportioned him and breathed into him of His [created] spirit and made for you hearing and vision and hearts. Little do you give thanks.

And they say, "If we are lost in the earth, will we then be in a new creation?" Rather, they, in the meeting with their Lord, are disbelievers. Say, "The Angel of Death who is set over you will take you; then to your Lord you will be returned." And if you could but see when the criminals hang their heads before their Lord, [saying], "Our Lord, we have seen and heard, so return us [to Him]; we will do righteousness. Indeed, we are [now] certain." And if We had willed, We could have given every soul its guidance, but the word from Me will come into effect, "I will surely fill Hell with jinn and people all together." So taste [something] for having forgotten the meeting with this Day of yours. Indeed, We have forgotten you. And taste the punishment of eternity for what you used to do.

Only those believe in Our verses who, when they are reminded of them, fall down in prostration and exalt [Allah] with praise of their Lord, and they are not arrogant. Their sides forsake their beds, to invoke their Lord in fear and hope, and they spend out of what We have provided them. No soul knows what has been hidden for them of comfort for their eyes as reward for what they used to do.

Is he who is a believer like he who is a sinner? They are not equal. As for those who have believed and done righteous deeds, for them are the Gardens of Refuge as a reward for what they used to do. But as for those who were sinners, their refuge is the Fire. Whenever they wish to emerge from it, they will be returned to it and it will be said to them, "Taste the punishment of the Fire which you used to deny." And We will surely make them taste of the lesser punishment short of the greater punishment that perhaps they will return. And who is more unjust than he who is reminded of the verses of his Lord and then turns away from them? Indeed, We will take retribution from the criminals.

And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture, so be not in doubt about meeting it, and We made it a guidance for the Children of Israel. And We made from among them leaders guiding by Our command when they were patient and were certain by Our signs. Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ. Have they not been guided? How many generations We destroyed before them who used to walk about in their dwellings? Indeed in that are signs. Then will they not hear? Have they not seen that We drive the water to the barren land and produce thereby crops from which their livestock and themselves eat? Then will they not see?

And they say, "When will this conquest be, if you should be truthful?" Say, "On the Day of Conquest, the faith of those who disbelieve will not benefit them, nor will they be reprieved." So turn away from them and wait; indeed, they are waiting.

O Prophet, fear Allah and do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise. And follow what is revealed to you from your Lord. Indeed, Allah is ever, with what you do, Acquainted. And rely upon Allah, and sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.

Allah has not made for any man two hearts within him, nor has He made your wives whom you declare to be your mothers, nor has He made your adopted sons your sons. That is what you say with your mouths, and Allah speaks the truth, and He guides to the way. Call them by the names of their fathers; that is more just in the sight of Allah. But if you do not know their fathers, then they are your brothers in religion and your allies. And there is no blame upon you for that in which you have erred - [only] for [the purpose of] your hearts. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful. The Prophet is closer to the believers than their own selves, and his wives are their mothers. And those of kinship are closer to one another in the Book of Allah than the believers and the emigrants, unless you do to your allies a kindness. That is already inscribed in the Book.

And when We took a covenant from the prophets, and from you, and from Noah, Abraham, Moses, and Jesus, the son of Mary, and We took from them a solemn covenant, that He might question the truthful concerning their truthfulness, and He has prepared for the disbelievers a painful punishment.

O you who have believed, remember the favor of Allah upon you when there came upon you hosts, and We sent upon them a wind and hosts you did not see. And ever is Allah, of what you do, Seeing. When they came upon you from above you and from below you, and when eyes turned away and hearts reached to the throats and you assumed about Allah [various] assumptions. At that point the believers were tested and shaken with a severe earthquake. And when the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is disease said, "Allah and His Messenger promised us nothing but delusion." And when a party of them said, "O people of Yathrib, there is no place for you to stay, so go back." And a party of them asked permission of the Prophet, saying, "Indeed, our houses are exposed." But they are not exposed. They only desire to flee. And if they had entered upon them from its regions and then they were asked for trial, they would have come to it, and they would not have remained in it except a little. And they had already made a covenant with Allah before that they would not turn their backs, and the covenant with Allah will be questioned. Say, "Fleeing will not benefit you if you flee from death or killing. And then you will not enjoy it except a little." Say, "Who is it that can protect you from God if He intends to harm you or intends to have mercy on you?" And they will not find for themselves besides God any protector or helper.

Allah knows those among you who hold back and say to their brothers, "Come to us," but they do not come to battle except a little. They are niggardly toward you. But when fear comes, you see them looking at you, their eyes rolling like one who is fainting from death. But when the fear departs, they smite you with sharp tongues. They are niggardly toward good. Those have not believed, so Allah has rendered worthless their deeds, and that, for Allah, is easy. They think that the factions have not yet gone away.
