But when the factions come, they wish that they were wandering among the desert dwellers, asking about your news. And if they had been among you, they would not have fought except a little.

Indeed in the Messenger of Allah you have an excellent pattern for anyone whose hope is in Allah and the Last Day and [who] remembers Allah often. And when the believers saw the confederates, they said, “This is what Allah and His Messenger promised us,” and Allah and His Messenger spoke the truth. And it only increased them in faith and submission. Among the believers are men true to what they pledged to Allah. Among them is he who has fulfilled his vow [to the death], and among them is he who awaits [his chance]. And they have not changed [their commitment] in the least. That Allah may reward the truthful for their truthfulness and punish the hypocrites if He wills or accept their repentance. Indeed, Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.

And Allah repelled those who disbelieved in their fury; they did not attain any good. And Allah spared the believers the fighting. And Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might. And He brought down those who supported them from among the People of the Scripture from their strongholds and cast terror into their hearts. Some of them you killed and some you took captive. And He made you inherit their land and their homes and their properties and a land you had not trodden. And Allah is over all things competent.

O Prophet, say to your wives: If you desire the life of this world and its adornments, then come, I will provide for you and release you with a gracious release. But if you desire Allah and His Messenger and the home of the Hereafter, then indeed, Allah has prepared for the doers of good among you a great reward. O wives of the Prophet! Whoever among you commits a clear immorality - the punishment will be doubled for her twofold, and that, for Allah, is easy. But whoever among you is obedient to Allah and His Messenger and does righteousness - We will give her her reward twice over, and We have prepared for her a noble provision.

O wives of the Prophet, you are not like any other women. If you fear God, be not soft in speech, lest he in whose heart is a disease should covet, but speak in an appropriate manner. And abide in your houses and do not display yourselves like that of the times of ignorance. And establish prayer and give zakah and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah only desires to remove from you the uncleanness, O people of the Household, and to purify you with a thorough purification. And remember what is recited in your houses of the verses of Allah and wisdom. Indeed, Allah is ever Kind and Acquainted.

Verily, the Muslim men and Muslim women, the believing men and believing women, the obedient men and obedient women, the truthful men and truthful women, the patient men and patient women, the humble men and humble women, the charitable men and charitable women, the fasting men and fasting women, the men who guard their private parts and the women who do so, and the men who remember Allah often and the women who remember - for them Allah has prepared forgiveness and a great reward.

It is not for a believing man or a believing woman, when Allah and His Messenger have decided a matter, that they should have any option in their decision. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger has certainly strayed into clear error. And when you said to him upon whom Allah had bestowed favor and you had bestowed favor, "Keep your wife to yourself and fear Allah," while you concealed within yourself that which Allah was to disclose. And you feared the people, while Allah has more right that you should fear Him. But when Zaid had no longer any need for her, We married her to you in order that there should be no blame upon the believers concerning the wives of their adopted sons when they have no longer any need for them. And the command of Allah is to be done. There is no blame upon the Prophet for what Allah has ordained for him. This is the practice of Allah with those who passed on before. And the command of Allah is a decree decreed. Those who convey the messages of Allah and fear Him and do not fear anyone except Allah. And sufficient is Allah as Accountant. Muhammad is not the father of any of your men, but he is the Messenger of Allah and the Seal of the Prophets. And ever is Allah, of all things, Knowing.

O you who have believed, remember Allah with much remembrance. And exalt Him morning and evening. It is He who confers blessing upon you, and His angels [ask Him to do so] that He may bring you out from darknesses into the light. And ever is He, to the believers, Merciful. Their greeting on the Day they meet Him will be, “Peace.” And He has prepared for them a noble reward.

And glorify Him morning and evening. It is He who confers blessing upon you, and His angels [ask Him to do so], that He may bring you out from darknesses into the light. And ever is He, to the believers, Merciful. Their greeting on the Day they meet Him will be, “Peace.” And He has prepared for them a noble reward. O Prophet, indeed We have sent you as a witness and a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And one who invites to Allah, by His permission, and an illuminating lamp. And give good tidings to the believers that they will have from Allah great bounty. And do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites and ignore their abuse and rely upon Allah, and sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.

O you who believe, when you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them, then you have no waiting period to count for them. So provide for them and release them with gracious release. O Prophet, indeed We have made lawful to you your wives to whom you have given their dowries and those your right hand possesses from what Allah has given you and the daughters of your paternal uncles and the daughters of your paternal aunts and the daughters of your maternal uncles and the daughters of your maternal aunts who emigrated with you and a believing woman if she gives herself to the Prophet - if the Prophet wishes to marry her - exclusively for you, not for the believers. We know what We have enjoined upon them concerning their wives and those their right hands possess - so that there will be no difficulty for you. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful. You may put off whom you wish of them and take to yourself whom you wish. And as for whom you seek of those whom you have set aside - there is no blame upon you. That is more suitable that their eyes may be comforted and they will not grieve and they will be pleased with what you have given them all. And Allah knows what is in your hearts. And ever is Allah Knowing and Forbearing. It is not lawful for you to take other women after this, nor to exchange them for other wives, even if their beauty pleases you, except those your right hand possesses. And ever is God, over all things, a Watcher.

O you who have believed, do not enter the houses of the Prophet unless permission is given to you for a meal, without awaiting its preparation. But when you are invited, then enter; and when you have eaten, disperse and do not seek entertainment for conversation. Indeed, that used to annoy the Prophet, and he would shy away from you. And God is not shy of the truth. And when you ask them for anything, ask them from behind a partition. That is purer for your hearts and their hearts. And it is not for you to annoy the Messenger of God or to marry his wives after him, ever. Indeed, that is in the sight of God an enormity. Whether you disclose a thing or conceal it, indeed, God is ever, of all things, Knowing. There is no blame upon them concerning their fathers, nor their sons, nor their brothers, nor their brothers' sons, nor their sisters' sons, nor their women, nor those their right hands possess. And fear God. Indeed, God is, over all things, Witness.

Indeed, Allah and His angels send blessings on the Prophet. O you who believe, send blessings on him and salute him with a worthy salutation. Indeed, those who abuse Allah and His Messenger - Allah has cursed them in this world and the Hereafter and has prepared for them a humiliating punishment. And those who abuse believing men and believing women for [something] other than what they have earned have certainly born upon themselves a slander and a manifest sin.

O Prophet, tell your wives and your daughters and the women of the believers to bring down over themselves [part] of their outer garments. That is more suitable that they will be known and not be abused. And ever is God Forgiving and Merciful.

If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is disease and the agitators in the city do not cease, We will surely incite you against them; then they will not remain your neighbors therein except for a little while. Cursed are they; wherever they are found, they will be seized and killed in a grievous slaughter. Such is the way of Allah with those who passed on before. And you will not find in the way of Allah any change.

People ask you about the Hour. Say, "Its knowledge is only with Allah. And what makes you know? Perhaps the Hour is near." Indeed, Allah has cursed the disbelievers and prepared for them a Blaze. They will abide therein forever, never finding a protector or a helper. The Day their faces will be turned over in the Fire, they will say, "If only we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger." And they will say, "Our Lord, indeed we obeyed our masters and our dignitaries, and they led us astray from the way." Our Lord, give them double the punishment and curse them with a great curse.

O you who have believed, do not be like those who abused Moses; but Allah cleared him of what they said, and he was in the sight of Allah esteemed. O you who have believed, fear Allah and speak words of appropriate justice. He will amend for you your deeds and forgive you your sins. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger has certainly achieved a great attainment.

Indeed, We offered the Trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, and they declined to bear it and feared it; but man bore it. Indeed, he was unjust and ignorant. That Allah may punish the hypocrites, men and women, and the polytheists, men and women, and that Allah may accept the repentance of the believing men and women. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.

Praise be to God, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and to Him be praise in the Hereafter. And He is the Wise, the Acquainted. He knows what enters into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein. And He is the Merciful, the Forgiving.

Those who disbelieve say, "The Hour will not come to us." Say, "Yes, by my Lord, it will come to you." He is the Knower of the unseen. Not an atom's weight in the heavens or on the earth escapes Him, nor anything smaller than that or greater, but is in a clear register. That He may reward those who believe and do righteous deeds - those will have forgiveness and noble provision. But those who strive against Our verses to frustrate them - those will have a punishment of painful punishment.

And those who have been given knowledge see that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth and guides to the path of the Almighty, the Praiseworthy. And those who disbelieve say, "Shall we direct you to a man who will inform you that when you are completely torn apart, you will indeed be in a new creation?" Has he invented a lie about Allah, or is there madness in him? Rather, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are in torment and far astray. Have they not seen what is before them and behind them of the heaven and the earth? If We will, We could cause the earth to swallow them up or cause a fragment of the sky to fall upon them. Indeed in that is a sign for every servant who turns [to Allah] in repentance.

And We had certainly given David favor from Us, [saying], "O mountains, echo with him, and [so do] the birds." And We made iron soft for him, [saying], "Make coats of mail and measure the links and work righteousness. Indeed, I, of what you do, am Seeing." And to Solomon We subjected the wind, its morning journey being a month and its evening journey a month. And We caused a spring of molten copper to flow for him. And among the jinn were those who worked before him by permission of his Lord. And whoever of them deviated from Our command - We will make him taste of the punishment of the Blaze." They made for him whatever he pleased of shrines and statues and basins like reservoirs and fixed cauldrons. "Work, O family of David, in gratitude. But few of My servants are grateful."

So when We decreed death for him, nothing showed them his death except a creature of the earth eating away at his staff. So when he fell down, the jinn realized that if they had known the unseen, they would not have remained in the humiliating punishment.

There was for Sheba in their dwelling place a sign - two gardens on the right and on the left, [saying], "Eat from the provision of your Lord and be grateful to Him. A good land and a Forgiving Lord." But they turned away, so We sent upon them the flood of the dam and replaced their two gardens with two gardens bearing bitter fruit and tamarisk and some few lote trees. That is how We recompensed them for their disbelief. And do We recompense except the ungrateful? And We placed between them and the towns which We had blessed, towns easy to see, and We measured the distance between them: "Travel therein nights and days in security." But they said, "Our Lord, lengthen between our journeys." And they wronged themselves, so We made them stories and dispersed them completely. Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

And Satan proved true about them his assumption, so they followed him, except for a party of the believers. And he had no authority over them except that We might make evident who believes in the Hereafter from who is in doubt about it. And your Lord is, over all things, Guardian. Say, "Call upon those you claim besides God. They do not possess an atom's weight in the heavens or on the earth, and they have no share in either of them, nor does He have among them any supporter." And intercession with Him does not benefit except for one to whom He permits. Until, when fear is removed from their hearts, they say, "What has your Lord said?" They say, "The truth." And He is the Most High, the Grand.

Say, "Who provides for you from the heavens and the earth?" Say, "Allah. And indeed, either we or you are upon right guidance or in manifest error." Say, "You will not be asked about what we committed, nor will we be asked about what you do." Say, "Our Lord will gather us together, then He will judge between us in truth. And He is the Opener, the Knowing." Say, "Show me those whom you have associated with Him as partners." No! Rather, He is Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner to all mankind, but most of the people do not know. And they say, “When will this promise come to pass, if you should be truthful?” Say, “You have an appointment on a Day from which you will not delay an hour, nor will you advance it.”

And those who disbelieve say, "We will not believe in this Qur'an, nor in that which is before it." And if you could but see when the wrongdoers are made to stand before their Lord, returning their statement to one another. Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "If it were not for you, we would have been believers." Those who were arrogant will say to those who were oppressed, "Did we avert you from guidance after it had come to you? Rather, you were criminals." And those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "Rather, it was [your] plotting by night and by day when you ordered us to disbelieve in Allah and attribute to Him equals." And they concealed regret when they saw the punishment, and We placed shackles on the necks of those who disbelieved. Are they recompensed except for what they used to do?

And We did not send to any city a warner but its affluent ones said, "Indeed, we, in that with which you have been sent, are disbelievers." And they said, "We are more in wealth and children, and we will not be punished." Say, "Indeed, my Lord enlarges the provision for whom He wills and restricts it," but most of the people do not know. And it is not your wealth or your children that bring you nearer to Us, except for those who believe and do righteousness. For those will be a double reward for what they did, and they will be in the chambers secure. And those who strive against Our verses, trying to frustrate them - those will be brought to the punishment. Say, "Indeed, my Lord enlarges the provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts it for him. And whatever you spend of a thing - He will replace it. And He is the Best of providers."

And the Day He will gather them all together, then He will say to the angels, "Was it these that they used to worship?" They will say, "Glory be to You! You are our Protector instead of them. Rather, they used to worship the jinn; most of them were believers in them." So this Day you will not possess for one another any benefit or harm, and We will say to those who did wrong, "Taste the punishment of the Fire which you used to deny." And when Our clear verses are recited to them, they will say, "This is not but a man who wants to avert you from what your fathers used to worship." And they will say, "This is not but a fabricated lie." And those who disbelieved will say of the truth when it has come to them, "This is not but obvious magic." And We did not give them any books to study, nor did We send to them before you any warner. And those before them denied, and they did not attain even a tenth of what We gave them. So they denied My messengers; so how terrible was My denial!

Say, "I only admonish you of one thing: that you stand before God in pairs or individually and then reflect. There is no madness in your companion. He is only a warner to you before a severe punishment." Say, "Whatever reward I have asked of you is yours. My reward is only from God, and He is, over all things, Witness."

Say, "Indeed, my Lord casts the truth. He is the Knower of the unseen." Say, "The truth has come, and falsehood neither originates nor restores." Say, "If I go astray, I only go astray to my own detriment; and if I am guided, it is by what my Lord reveals to me. Indeed, He is All-Hearing, All-Near." And if you could but see when they are terrified, and there is no escape, and they are seized from a nearby place. And they say, "We believe in it." But how can they seize it from a distant place? And they disbelieved in it before, and they cast the unseen from a distant place. And a barrier will be placed between them and what they desire, as was done to their followers before. Indeed, they were in disquieting doubt.

Praise be to Allah, Creator of the heavens and the earth, Who has made the angels messengers with wings, two or three or four. He increases in creation what He wills. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent. Whatever mercy Allah opens to the people, none can withhold it, and whatever He withholds, none can release it after Him. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise. O mankind, remember the favor of Allah upon you. Is there a creator other than Allah who provides for you from the heaven and the earth? There is no deity except Him, so how are you deluded? And if they deny you, [O Muhammad] - so were messengers before you denied. And to Allah are matters returned.

O mankind, indeed the promise of Allah is truth, so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about Allah by the Deceiver. Indeed, Satan is an enemy to you, so take him as an enemy. He only invites his party to be among the companions of the Blaze. Those who disbelieve will have a severe punishment. But those who believe and do righteous deeds will have forgiveness and a great reward. Then is he to whom the evil of his deed has been made attractive so he regards it as good? But Allah leaves astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. So let not your soul perish over them in regret. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of what they do.

And it is He who sends the winds, and they stir up the clouds, and We drive them to a dead land and revive thereby the earth after its lifelessness. Thus is the resurrection. Whoever desires honor - to Allah belongs all honor. To Him ascends the good word, and the righteous deed raises it. But those who plot evil deeds will have a severe punishment, and the plotting of those - it is they who will perish. And Allah created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then He made you mates. And no female conceives or gives birth except with His knowledge. And no soul lives long, nor does any soul shorten its life span, except that it is in a register. Indeed, that, for Allah, is easy.

And the two seas are not alike: one is fresh and sweet, palatable to drink, and the other is salty and bitter. And from each you eat tender meat and extract ornaments which you wear. And you see the ships plowing through it - that you may seek of His bounty and that you may be grateful. He merges the night into the day and merges the day into the night. And He has subjected the sun and the moon, each running for a specified term. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs the dominion. And those you call upon besides Him do not possess so much as a date stone. If you call upon them, they do not hear your call, and if they heard, they would not respond to you. And on the Day of Resurrection they will deny your association with Him. And none informs you like the One Acquainted.

O mankind, you are those in need of Allah, while Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy. If He wills, He can do away with you and bring forth a new creation. And that is not difficult for Allah. And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And if one heavily laden calls another to bear it, nothing of it will be borne, even if he were a near relative. You can only warn those who fear their Lord unseen and establish prayer. And whoever purifies himself only purifies himself for the benefit of his soul, and to Allah is the final destination.

The blind and the seeing are not alike. Nor are darkness and light. Nor is shade and heat. Nor are the living and the dead. Indeed, Allah makes hear whom He wills, but you cannot make hear those in the graves. You are only a warner. Indeed, We have sent you, [O Muhammad], with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And there was no nation but that a warner had passed among them. And if they deny you, [O Muhammad], so also did those before them. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs and scriptures and an enlightening Scripture. Then I seized those who disbelieved - and how terrible was My reproach.

Have you not seen that God sends down water from the sky, and We produce thereby fruits of varying colors? And among the mountains are streaks white and red, varying in color and [some] very black. And among people and living creatures and grazing livestock are also varying in color. Only those fear God, from among His servants, who have knowledge. Indeed, God is Exalted in Might and Forgiving.

Indeed, those who recite the Book of Allah and establish prayer and spend from what We have provided for them, secretly and publicly, hope for a commerce that will never fail - That He may give them their rewards in full and increase them from His bounty. Indeed, He is Forgiving and Appreciative. And that which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], of the Book is the truth, confirming what was before it. Indeed, Allah, of His servants, is Acquainted and Seeing. Then We caused to inherit the Book those We have chosen of Our servants. And among them is he who wrongs himself, and among them is he who is moderate, and among them is he who is foremost in good deeds by permission of Allah. That is the great bounty. [They will be] Gardens of Eden which they will enter, adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be of silk. And they will say, “Praise be to Allah, who has taken away from us sorrow. Indeed, our Lord is Forgiving and Appreciative. Who has settled us in the home of permanence out of His bounty. No toil will touch us therein, nor will weariness touch us therein.”

And as for those who disbelieve, for them is the fire of Hell. They will not be finished off so that they may die, nor will their punishment be lightened. Thus do We recompense every disbeliever, while they cry therein, “Our Lord, take us out; we will do righteousness other than what we used to do. Did We not give you life long enough for whoever would remember to remember therein? And a warner has come to you, so taste [the punishment] - for there is no helper for the wrongdoers. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.”

It is He who has made you successors upon the earth. So whoever disbelieves, upon him is his disbelief. And their disbelief does not increase the disbelievers in the sight of their Lord except in hatred, and their disbelief does not increase the disbelievers except in loss. Say, Have you considered your associates whom you invoke besides God? Show me what they have created on the earth. Or do they have a share in the heavens, or have We given them a book so they are upon a clear proof thereof? Rather, the wrongdoers promise one another nothing but delusion. Indeed, God holds the heavens and the earth lest they cease to exist. And if they should cease, no one could hold them back after Him. Indeed, He is Forbearing and Forgiving.

And they swore by Allah with their most solemn oaths that if a warner came to them, they would surely be better guided than any of the nations. But when a warner came to them, it only increased them in aversion [in] arrogance upon the earth and evil plotting. But evil plotting does not encompass except its own people. Do they then await aught but the way of the former peoples? You will not find in the way of Allah any change, and you will not find in the way of Allah any alteration. Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them while they were greater than them in strength? And nothing in the heavens or on the earth could cause failure to Allah. Indeed, He is Knowing and Competent. And if Allah were to impose blame on men for what they have earned, He would not leave upon the surface of the earth a single creature, but He defers them for a specified term. And when their term has come - then indeed, Allah is ever, of His servants, Seeing.

Yasin. By the Qur’an, full of wisdom. Indeed, you are one of the messengers. On a straight path. A revelation from the Almighty, the Merciful. That you may warn a people whose fathers were not warned, so they are heedless. The word has already come into effect upon most of them, so they do not believe. Indeed, We have placed shackles on their necks, reaching to their chins, so their heads are raised. And We have placed before them a barrier and behind them a barrier and covered them so they do not see. And it is the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them - they will not believe. You can only warn him who follows the message and fears the Most Merciful unseen. So give him good tidings of forgiveness and a generous reward. Indeed, it is We who bring the dead to life, and We record what they have put forth and what they left behind. And all things We have enumerated in a clear register.

And present to them an example: the companions of the town, when there came to it the messengers. When We sent to them two, but they denied them, so We reinforced them with a third, and they said, "Indeed, we are messengers to you." They said, "You are not but human beings like us, and the Most Merciful has not sent down anything. You are only lying." They said, "Our Lord knows that we are messengers to you. And our duty is only to convey [the message] clearly." They said, "Indeed, we regard you as an evil omen. If you do not desist, we will surely stone you, and a painful punishment will touch you from us." They said, "Your evil omen is with you. Is it that you are reminded? Rather, you are a transgressing people."

And there came from the farthest part of the city a man running. He said, "O my people, follow the messengers. Follow those who do not ask of you any payment and who are [rightly] guided. And why should I not worship He who created me and to Him you will be returned? Should I take besides Him gods? If the Most Merciful should intend me harm, their intercession would not avail me at all, nor could they save me. Indeed, I would be in manifest error. Indeed, I have believed in your Lord, so listen." It was said, "Enter Paradise." He said, "I wish my people knew that my Lord has forgiven me and made me of the honored."

And We did not send down upon his people after him any soldiers from the heaven, nor would We have sent them down. There was only one blast, and at once they were extinguished. Oh, woe to the servants! There does not come to them a messenger but they ridicule him. Have they not seen how many generations We destroyed before them? That to them they will not be returned. And that all, when they are all together, will be brought before Us.

And a sign for them is the dead earth. We have given it life and produced from it grain, from which they eat. And We placed therein gardens of palm trees and grapevines, and caused springs to gush forth therein, that they may eat of its fruit and of that which their hands have made. Then will they not be grateful? Glory be to Him who created in pairs all things that the earth grows and from themselves and from that which they do not know. And a sign for them is the night. We strip from it the day, and suddenly they are in darkness. And the sun runs to a resting place for it. That is the determination of the Almighty, the Knowing. And the moon - We have determined for it phases until it returns [appearing] like an old dried date stalk. It is not for the sun to overtake the moon, nor does the night outstrip the day. Each, in an orbit, floats. And a sign for them is that We carried their offspring in the laden ship. And We created for them from the like thereof that on which they ride. And if We will, We can drown them, but there is no help for them, nor can they be saved. Except for mercy from Us and provision for a time. And when it is said to them, "Fear what is before you and what is behind you that you may receive mercy," and not a sign comes to them from the signs of their Lord except that they turn away from it. And when it is said to them, "Spend from what Allah has provided for you," those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Should we feed those whom Allah, if He willed, could feed?" You are not but in manifest error.

And they say, "When will this promise come to pass, if you should be truthful?" They await only a single blast that will seize them while they are disputing. Then they will not be able to make any recommendation, nor will they return to their families. And the Trumpet will be blown, and at once they will be hastening from the graves to their Lord. They will say, "Woe to us! Who has raised us up from our beds? This is what the Most Merciful promised, and the messengers spoke the truth." It will be only a single blast, and at once they will all be brought before Us. So this Day no soul will be wronged at all, and you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do.

Indeed, the companions of Paradise, that Day, will be in pleasure, occupied. They and their spouses will be in shade, reclining on adorned couches. For them therein will be fruit, and they will have whatever they request. Peace, a word from a Merciful Lord.

And distinguish yourselves today, O criminals. Did I not charge you, O children of Adam, that you not worship Satan - for indeed, he is to you a clear enemy - and that you worship Me - this is a straight path. And he has already led astray many of you. Then did you not use reason? This is Hell, which you were promised. Enter it today for what you used to disbelieve. Today We will set a seal upon their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify about what they used to earn. And if We willed, We could have obliterated their eyes, then they would race along the path, but how could they see? And if We willed, We could have transformed them in their places, so they would not be able to proceed nor return. And whom We grant life - We reverse in creation - so will they not use reason?

And We have not taught him poetry, nor is it befitting for him. It is not but a message and a clear Qur'an, that He may warn whoever is alive and that the word may come into effect against the disbelievers.

Have they not seen that We have created for them from what Our hands have made, livestock, so they own them? And We have subjected them to them, so some of them they ride and some of them they eat. And they have therein benefits and drinks. So will they not be grateful? And they have taken besides Allah deities that perhaps they will be aided. But they are not able to aid them, and they are for them an army prepared. So let not their statement grieve you. Indeed, We know what they conceal and what they declare.

Has man not seen that We created him from a sperm-drop, then at once he is a clear adversary? And he presents to Us an example and forgets his own creation. He says, "Who will give life to the bones when they have decayed?" Say, "He will give them life who produced them the first time. And He is Knowing of all creation." He who made for you fire from the green tree, and at once you kindle from it. Is not He who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like of them? Yes, and He is the Creator, the Knowing. His command, when He intends a thing, is only to say to it, "Be," and it is. So exalted is He in whose hand is the dominion over all things, and to Him you will be returned.

And those who rank up in ranks. And those who drive away with a drive. And those who recite the Reminder. Indeed, your God is One. Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them and Lord of the Easts. Indeed, We have adorned the lowest heaven with an adornment of stars. And as protection from every rebellious devil. They do not hear the assembly on high, and they are pelted from every side. Repelled, and for them is a lasting punishment. Except for him who snatches a snatch, then he is pursued by a piercing flame.

So ask them, "Are they stronger in creation, or those We created? Indeed, We created them from sticky clay." Rather, I am amazed, and they mock. And when they are reminded, they do not remember. And when they see a sign, they ridicule. And they say, "This is not but obvious magic. When we have died and become dust and bones, will we indeed be resurrected? Or our forefathers of old?" Say, "Yes," and you are in a state of contempt. But it will be only one shout, and at once they will look on. And they will say, "Woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment! This is the Day of Separation which you used to deny."

Gather together those who did wrong, their spouses, and what they used to worship other than Allah, and guide them to the path of Hellfire. Stop them; indeed, they will be questioned. What is the matter with you that you do not help one another? Rather, today they are in submission. And they will turn to one another, questioning one another. They will say, "Indeed, you used to come to us from the right." They will say, "Rather, you were not believers. And we had no authority over you. Rather, you were a transgressing people." So the word of our Lord will come into effect upon us, "Indeed, we will taste it." So we led you astray; indeed, we were deviating. So indeed, that Day, they will be sharers in the punishment. Indeed, We will deal thus with the criminals. Indeed, when it was said to them, "There is no god but Allah," they were arrogant. And they said, "Should we indeed abandon our gods for the sake of a mad poet?" Rather, he has brought the truth and confirmed the messengers. Indeed, you will taste the painful punishment. And you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do.

Except the chosen servants of Allah. For them is a known provision. Fruits, and they are honored. In gardens of pleasure. On thrones facing each other. A cup from a pure spring will be passed around to them. White, delicious to those who drink. Therein is no smell, nor will they intoxicate therefrom. And with them are maidens limiting their glances to [some], [but] one eye [with], as if they were eggs well-protected.

Then some of them turned to others, questioning each other. One of them said, "Indeed, I had a companion [who] says, 'Are you indeed among the believers? When we die and become dust and bones, shall we then be recompensed?'" He said, "Are you looking on?" So he looked and saw him in the depths of Hellfire. He said, "By God, you were almost sent back. And had it not been for the grace of my Lord, I would have been among those brought forth. So are we not to die? Except for our first death, and we are not to be punished.'" Indeed, this is the great attainment. For such let the workers work.

Is that better as lodging or the tree of Zaqqum? Indeed, We have made it a trial for the wrongdoers. It is a tree emerging from the bottom of Hellfire. Its fruit is like the heads of devils. So they will eat from it and fill their bellies with it. Then they will have a mixture of scalding water for it. Then they will surely return to Hellfire. Indeed, they found their fathers astray, so they are in their footsteps hastening. And indeed, most of the former peoples had gone astray before them. And We had certainly sent among them warners. So see how was the end of the warners - Except for the chosen servants of Allah.

And Noah called upon Us, and excellent is the respondent. And We saved him and his family from the great distress. And made his descendants the survivors. And We left for him among later generations. ["Peace be upon Noah among the worlds." Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good. He was of Our believing servants. Then We drowned the others.

And indeed, among his followers was Abraham, when he came to his Lord with a sound heart. When he said to his father and his people, “What do you worship? Do you seek gods other than Allah? Then what do you think of the Lord of the worlds?” So he looked at the stars and said, “Indeed, I am ill.” So they turned away from him, fleeing. He turned to their gods and said, “Why do you not eat? What is the matter with you that you do not speak?” He struck them with his right hand, and they came to him in droves. He said, “Do you worship that which you carve, while Allah created you and that which you do?” They said, “Construct for him a structure and cast him into the Fire.” So they intended against him a plan, but We made them the lowest.

He said, "Indeed, I am going to my Lord, and He will guide me. My Lord, grant me from among the righteous." So We gave him good tidings of a forbearing boy. And when he reached with him the age of striving, he said, "O my son, indeed I have seen in a dream that I am sacrificing you, so see what you think." He said, "O my father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if Allah wills, among the steadfast." So when they both submitted, he laid him upon his forehead. And We called to him, "O Abraham, you have fulfilled the vision." Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good. Indeed, this was the clear trial. And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice. And We left for him among later generations, "Peace be upon Abraham. Thus do We reward the doers of good. Indeed, he was of Our believing servants." And We gave him good tidings of Isaac, a prophet among the righteous. And We blessed him and Isaac. And among their descendants are doers of good and wrongdoers to themselves clearly.

And We had certainly bestowed favor upon Moses and Aaron. And We saved them and their people from the great distress. And We gave them victory, and they were the predominant. And We gave them the clear Scripture. And We guided them to the straight path. And We left for them among later generations [a good deed]. Peace be upon Moses and Aaron. Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good. Indeed, they were among Our believing servants.

And indeed, Elias was among the messengers. When he said to his people, “Will you not fear God?” “Do you call upon Baal and forsake the best of creators? Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers of old.” But they denied him, so they will be brought forth. Except for the chosen servants of Allah. And We left for him among later generations, “Peace be upon the family of Yasin. Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good. Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.”

And indeed, Lot was among the messengers. When We saved him and his family, all together, Except an old woman among those who remained behind. Then We destroyed the others. And indeed, you pass by them in the morning and at night. Then will you not reason?

And indeed, Jonah was among the messengers. When he fled to the laden ship, he drew lots and was among the losers. Then the fish swallowed him, while he was blameworthy. And had he not been of those who glorify God, he would have remained inside its belly until the Day of Resurrection. Then We cast him upon the open shore while he was sick. And We caused a gourd vine to grow over him. And We sent him to a hundred thousand or more. So they believed, and We provided for them for a time.

So ask them, “Is it your Lord who has daughters and they have sons? Or did We create the angels female while they were witnesses?” Unquestionably, they are of their falsehood saying, “God has begotten a son,” and indeed, they are liars. He has chosen daughters over sons. What is the matter with you? How do you judge? Will you not be reminded? Or do you have a clear authority? Then produce your book, if you should be truthful.

And they have attributed a relationship between Him and Paradise, but Paradise has certainly known that they will be brought to account. Glory be to Allah above what they describe. Except for the sincere servants of Allah. Indeed, you and what you worship - you will not be tempted. Except for him who is destined for Hellfire. And there is not one of us but has a known station. And indeed, it is We who are the ones who line up [in ranks] and indeed, it is We who are the ones who glorify.
And they used to say, “If only we had a reminder from among the former peoples, we would have been sincere servants of Allah.” But they disbelieved in it, so they are going to know.

And Our word has already gone forth to Our servants, the messengers. Indeed, they will be the victorious. And indeed, Our soldiers will be the predominant. So turn away from them for a time and observe them - and they will see. Is it then that they seek to hasten Our punishment? But when it descends upon their courtyard - then evil will be the morning of those who were warned. So turn away from them for a time and observe - and they will see. Glory be to your Lord, the Lord of Might, above what they describe. And peace be upon the messengers. And praise be to God, Lord of the worlds.

Sad. By the Qur'an full of remembrance. Rather, those who disbelieve are in arrogance and discord. How many generations before them have We destroyed? They cried out, but there was no time for escape. And they wondered that a warner had come to them from among themselves. And the disbelievers said, "This is a magician, a liar. Has he made the gods one god? Indeed, this is a strange thing." And the eminent ones among them departed, "Walk and be patient with your gods. Indeed, this is something intended." We have not heard of this in the later religion. This is not but an invention. Has the Reminder been sent down to him from among us? Rather, they are in doubt about My remembrance. Rather, they have not yet tasted the punishment. Or do they have the treasures of the mercy of your Lord, the Exalted in Might, the Bestower? Or do they have the dominion of the heavens and the earth and what is between them? So let them ascend through the means. The hosts there are defeated from the parties.

Before them, the people of Noah and Aad and Pharaoh, the lord of the stakes, and Thamud and the people of Lot and the companions of the thicket denied. Those were the factions. Indeed, all denied the messengers, so the punishment is justified. And these await nothing except a single blast that will not cease. And they will say, "Our Lord, hasten for us our portion before the Day of Reckoning."

Be patient over what they say and remember Our servant David, the man of strength. Indeed, he was one who frequently turned back [to Allah]. Indeed, We subjected the mountains to him, to glorify Us in the evening and the morning, and the birds [also] gathered together, all returning to Him [in repentance]. And We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and decisive judgment.

And has there reached you the story of the litigants when they climbed over the wall of the private chamber? When they entered upon David, and he was terrified by them. They said, "Fear not. We are two adversaries, one of us has wronged the other, so judge between us in truth and do not be unfair, and guide us to the right path. Indeed, this is my brother. He has ninety-nine ewes, and I have one ewe. So he said, "Entrust her to me," and he was harsh to me in the conversation. He said, "He has certainly wronged you by asking for your ewe in addition to his ewes. And indeed, many associates oppress one another, except for those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they." And David thought that we had only tested him, so he asked forgiveness of his Lord and fell down in bowing and repented. So We forgave him that; and indeed, for him with Us is nearness to Him and a good place of return. O David, indeed We have made you a successor upon the earth, so judge between the people in truth and do not follow desire, as it will lead you astray from the way of Allah. Indeed, those who stray from the way of Allah will have a severe punishment because they forgot the Day of Account.

We did not create the heaven and the earth and all that is between them in vain. That is the assumption of those who disbelieve. So woe to those who disbelieve from the Fire. Shall We treat those who believe and do righteous deeds like corrupters on earth? Or shall We treat the righteous like the wicked? [This is] a blessed Book which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], that they may ponder its verses and that those of understanding may remember.

And We gave to David Solomon, an excellent servant. Indeed, he frequently turned back [to God]. When in the evening the fine horses were presented to him. And he said, "Indeed, I have preferred the love of good to the remembrance of my Lord until they are hidden behind the veil. Return them to me." So he began to stroke their legs and necks. And We certainly tried Solomon and placed on his throne a body, but he repented. He said, "My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom such as will not belong to anyone after me. Indeed, You are the Bestower." So We subjected to him the wind, blowing gently by his command wherever he directed. And the devils, every builder and diver, and others bound together in fetters. This is Our gift, so bestow or withhold without account. And indeed, for him with Us is nearness and a good place of return.

And remember Our servant Job, when he called upon his Lord, "Indeed, Satan has touched me with hardship and torment." Stamp [the earth] with your foot; this is a spring of cool water to wash with and a drink. And We granted him his family and the like thereof with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for those of understanding. And take in your hand a bunch of grass and strike with it and do not break your oath. Indeed, We found him patient, an excellent servant. Indeed, he was one who frequently turned back [to God].

And remember Our servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob - possessors of strength and vision. Indeed, We purified them with a pure remembrance of the Home. And indeed, they are with Us among the chosen and best. And remember Ishmael, Elisha, Dhul-Kifl, and all of them were among the best.

This is a reminder, and indeed, for the righteous is an excellent place of return. Gardens of Eden, with doors open to them. Reclining therein, they will call therein for abundant fruit and drink. And with them will be maidens restraining their glances, of equal age. This is what you are promised for the Day of Reckoning. Indeed, this is Our provision, which will never be exhausted.

This is indeed, for the transgressors is an evil place of return. Hell, they will burn therein, and wretched is the resting place. This one - let him taste it, scalding water and pus. And others like it - are in pairs. This is a group rushing in with you - no welcome for them. Indeed, they are going to the Fire. They will say, "Rather, you are not welcome. You have brought this to us, so wretched is the resting place." They will say, "Our Lord, who brought this to us? Increase for him double the punishment in the Fire." And they will say, "What is the matter with us that we do not see men whom we used to count among the wicked? Have we taken them in ridicule, or has our eyes failed to see them?" Indeed, that is the truth. The dispute of the people of the Fire is over.

Say, "I am only a warner, and there is no god except Allah, the One, the Prevailing. Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Exalted in Might, the Forgiving." Say, "It is news of great importance. You turn away from it. I had no knowledge of the highest assembly when they disputed. It is not revealed to me except that I am a clear warner." When your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I am going to create a human being from clay. So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul, then fall down to him in prostration." So the angels prostrated, all of them together, except Iblis, who was arrogant and was among the disbelievers. He said, "O Iblis, what prevented you from prostrating to that which I created with My hands? Were you arrogant, or were you among the exalted?" He said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay." He said, "Then get out of it, for indeed, you are expelled. And indeed, upon you is My curse until the Day of Judgment." He said, "My Lord, then respite me until the Day they are resurrected." He said, "Indeed, you are among those respite." Until the Day of the appointed time. He said, "Then by Your might, I will surely mislead them all. Except among them Your chosen servants." He said, "Then the truth, and I speak the truth." I will surely fill Hell with you and those who follow you among them, all together. Say, "I do not ask of you any reward for this, nor am I of the pretenders." It is only a reminder to the worlds. And you will surely come to know its news after a while.

The Book is from Allah, the Almighty, the Wise. Indeed, We have sent down to you, [O Muhammad], the Book in truth, so worship Allah, devoting religion to Him sincerely. Unquestionably, pure religion belongs to Allah. And those who take protectors other than Him - we do not worship them except that they may bring us nearer to Allah. Indeed, Allah will judge between them concerning that over which they differ. Indeed, Allah does not guide one who is a liar and a disbeliever. Had Allah willed to take a son, He would have chosen from what He creates whatever He willed. Glory be to Him! He is Allah, the One, the Prevailing. He created the heavens and the earth in truth. He wraps the night over the day and wraps the day over the night. And He has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term. Indeed, He is the Almighty, the Forgiving.

He created you from one soul, then made from it its mate, and sent down for you from the cattle eight mates. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, within three darknesses. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs the kingdom. There is no god except Him, so how are you turned away? If you disbelieve - then indeed, Allah is free from need of you. And He does not approve of disbelief for His servants. And if you are grateful, He approves it for you. And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you of what you used to do. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts. And when harm touches man, he calls upon his Lord, turning to Him in repentance; but when He bestows upon him a favor from Himself, he forgets what he used to call upon before and sets up rivals to Allah to mislead [people] from His way. Say, "Enjoy your disbelief for a little; indeed, you are of the companions of the Fire."

Or is he who is devoutly obedient during periods of the night, prostrating and standing [in prayer], fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord? Say, “Are those who know equal to those who do not know?” Only those of understanding will remember. Say, “O My servants who have believed, fear your Lord. For those who do good in this world is good, and the earth of Allah is spacious. Only the patient will be given their reward in full, without account.”

Say, "Indeed, I have been commanded to worship Allah, devoting my religion to Him alone. And I have been commanded to be the first of the Muslims." Say, "Indeed, I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day." Say, "Allah I worship, devoting my religion to Him alone." So worship whatever you will besides Him. Say, "Indeed, the losers are those who will lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, that is what is the manifest loss." For them are canopies of Fire above them, and canopies below them. That is how Allah frightens His servants. "O My servants, then fear Allah." And those who avoid false gods, lest they worship them and turn to Allah in repentance - for them are good tidings. So give good tidings, My servants. Those who listen to the Word and follow the best of it - those are the ones whom Allah has guided, and those are the ones of understanding. Is it he against whom the word of punishment has come into effect? ​​Then can you save him who is in the Fire? But those who feared their Lord will have mansions, one above another, built [for him], beneath which rivers flow. The promise of Allah; Allah does not fail in His promise.

Have you not seen that Allah sends down water from the sky, and causes it to flow as springs in the earth? Then He produces thereby crops of varying colors. Then they wither and you see them turn yellow; then He makes them debris. Indeed in that is a reminder for those of understanding. Is he whose breast Allah has expanded to Islam so that he is upon a light from his Lord? Then woe to those whose hearts are hardened against the remembrance of Allah? Those are in clear error. Allah has sent down the best statement, a consistent Book, repeated at which the skins of those who fear their Lord shiver. Then their skins and their hearts soften at the remembrance of Allah. That is the guidance of Allah by which He guides whom He wills. And he whom Allah leaves astray - for him there is no guide. Is he who will be protected against the evil of the punishment on the Day of Resurrection? And it will be said to the wrongdoers, "Taste what you used to earn." Those before them denied, so the punishment came to them from where they did not perceive. So Allah made them taste disgrace in the life of this world. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.

And We have certainly presented for the people in this Qur'an from every [kind of] example that they may remember. An Arabic Qur'an without any crookedness that they may become righteous. Allah presents an example: a man with quarreling partners, and a man devoted to one man. Are they equal in comparison? Praise be to Allah! But most of them do not know. Indeed, you will die, and indeed, they will die. Then indeed, on the Day of Resurrection, you will dispute before your Lord.

Who then is more unjust than he who lies about Allah and denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell an abode for the disbelievers? And he who brings the truth and believes in it - those are the righteous. They will have whatever they wish with their Lord. That is the reward of the doers of good - that Allah may remove from them the worst of what they did and reward them according to the best of what they used to do. Is not Allah sufficient for His servant? And they threaten you with those other than Him. And he whom Allah sends astray - for him there is no guide. And he whom Allah guides - for him there is no misguider. Is not Allah Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution?

And if you ask them, “Who created the heavens and the earth?” they will surely say, “Allah.” Say, “Have you considered what you invoke besides Allah? If Allah intends me harm, can they remove His harm? Or if He intends me mercy, can they withhold His mercy?” Say, “Allah is sufficient for me; upon Him do the trusting rely.” Say, “O my people, work according to your position; indeed, I am working, and you will soon know.” Whoever is visited by a punishment that will disgrace him and upon whom will descend a lasting punishment.

Indeed, We have sent down to you, [O Muhammad], the Book for mankind in truth. So whoever is guided does so for [the benefit of] himself, and whoever goes astray only goes astray to his own detriment. And you are not a guardian over them.

Allah takes the souls at the time of their death, and those that do not die during their sleep. Then He keeps those for which He has decreed death and sends the others back for a specified term. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought. Or have they taken intercessors other than Allah? Say, "Even if they do not possess anything and do not reason?" Say, "To Allah belongs all intercession. To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. Then to Him you will be returned."

And when Allah alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter shrink from disgust; but when those other than Him are mentioned, at once they rejoice. Say, “O Allah, Creator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, You judge between Your servants concerning that over which they used to differ.” And if those who did wrong had all that is in the earth and as much more with it, they would offer it as ransom themselves from the evil of the punishment on the Day of Resurrection. And there will appear to them from Allah that which they had never reckoned upon. And there will appear to them the evil of what they earned, and that which they used to ridicule will encompass them.

So when harm touches man, he calls upon Us; then when We bestow upon him a favor from Us, he says, "I have only been given it because of knowledge." Rather, it is a trial, but most of them do not know. Those before them had already said so, but what they used to earn did not avail them. So the evil of what they earned afflicted them. And those who do wrong among these - the evil of what they earned will afflict them, and they will not cause failure. Do they not know that Allah extends provision to whom He wills and restricts it? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

Say, "O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful. And turn [to Him] in repentance and submit to Him before the punishment comes upon you; then you will not be aided. And follow the best of what was revealed to you from your Lord before the punishment comes upon you suddenly while you perceive not. Lest a soul should say, "Oh, how I wish I had been more mindful of my duty to Allah and had not been among the mockers." Or say, when you see the punishment, "If only I had another chance so I could be among the doers of good." But yes, there did come to you My signs, but you denied them and were arrogant and were among the disbelievers.

And on the Day of Resurrection you will see the faces of those who lied about Allah blackened. Is there not in Hell an abode for the arrogant? But Allah will save those who feared Him with their place of safety. No evil will touch them, nor will they grieve. Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is, over all things, Disposer of affairs. To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. But those who disbelieve in the verses of Allah - it is they who are the losers. Say, "Is it other than Allah that you order me to worship, O ignorant ones?" And it has already been revealed to you and to those before you that if you should associate [anything] with Allah, your work would surely become worthless, and you would surely be among the losers. Rather, worship Allah and be among the grateful. They have not appraised Allah with His true appraisal, while the earth entirely will be in His grip on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens will be rolled up in His right hand. Glory be to Him and exalted be He above what they associate with Him.

And the Trumpet will be blown, and all who are in the heavens and all who are on the earth will fall unconscious except whom Allah wills. Then it will be blown again, and at once they will be standing, looking on. And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the record will be placed, and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought, and it will be judged between them in truth, and they will not be wronged. And every soul will be fully compensated for what it did, and He is most knowing of what they do.

And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups until, when they reach it, its gates will be opened and its keepers will say to them, "Did there not come to you messengers from among you reciting to you the verses of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say, "Yes, but the word of punishment has come into effect upon the disbelievers." It will be said, "Enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein." And evil is the residence of the arrogant. And those who feared their Lord will be driven to Paradise in groups until, when they reach it, its gates will be opened and its keepers will say to them, "Peace be upon you. You have done well, so enter it to abide eternally." And they will say, "Praise be to Allah, who has fulfilled His promise to us and given us the earth as an inheritance. We may settle in Paradise wherever we will. How excellent is the reward of the workers." And you will see the angels surrounding the Throne, exalting [Allah] with praise of their Lord, and it will be judged between them in truth. And it will be said, "Praise be to Allah, Lord of the worlds."

Ha Mim. The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Knowing. The Forgiver of sin, the Accepter of repentance, the Severe in penalty, the Lord of bounty. There is no deity except Him. To Him is the final destination. None disputes concerning the verses of Allah except those who disbelieve, so let not their moving about in the lands deceive you.

The people of Noah denied before them, and so did the parties after them. Every nation plotted against their Messenger to seize him, and they argued with falsehood to refute thereby the truth, but I seized them. Then how was My punishment? And thus the word of your Lord has come into effect upon those who disbelieved, that they are companions of the Fire.

Those who bear the Throne and those around it exalt [Allah] with praise of their Lord and believe in Him and ask forgiveness for those who have believed, [saying], “Our Lord, You have encompassed all things in mercy and knowledge. So forgive those who have repented and followed Your way and protect them from the punishment of Hellfire. Our Lord, and admit them to the Gardens of Eden which You have promised them and to whoever was righteous among their fathers and their spouses and their descendants. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise. And protect them from evil [deeds] and whoever You protect from evil [deeds] that Day - You have had mercy on him. And that is what is the great attainment.”

Indeed, those who disbelieve will be called, "The hatred of Allah is greater than your hatred of yourselves - when you were invited to faith and you disbelieved." They will say, "Our Lord, You caused us to die twice and gave us life twice, and we have acknowledged our sins. Is there any way out?" That is because, when Allah alone is called upon, you disbelieve; but if partners are associated with Him, you believe. So the judgment belongs to Allah, the Most High, the Grand.

It is He who shows you His signs and sends down to you from the sky provision. And none remembers except he who turns [to Allah]. So call upon Allah, sincere to Him in religion, although the disbelievers hate it. [He is] Exalted in degrees, Owner of the Throne. He sends the spirit by His command upon whom He wills of His servants to warn of the Day of Meeting - the Day when they will be brought forth. Nothing of them will be hidden from Allah. To whom belongs the dominion today belongs to Allah, the One, the Prevailing. Today every soul will be recompensed for what it has earned. There will be no injustice today. Indeed, Allah is swift in account. And warn them of the approaching Day when the hearts will be at the throats, stifling. The wrongdoers will have neither a close friend nor an intercessor who will be obeyed. He knows the treachery of the eyes and what the breasts conceal. And Allah judges with truth, while those who invoke besides Him judge not at all. Indeed, Allah is the Hearing, the Seeing.

Have they not traveled through the land and observed what was the end of those before them? They were greater than them in strength and in traces upon the earth, so Allah seized them for their sins, and there was for them against Allah no protector. That was because there used to come to them messengers with clear proofs, but they disbelieved, so Allah seized them. Indeed, He is Powerful and Severe in penalty.

And We had certainly sent Moses with Our signs and clear authority to Pharaoh, Haman, and Korah, but they said, "A lying magician." But when he brought them the truth from Us, they said, "Kill the sons of those who believed with him and keep their women alive." But the plot of the disbelievers is not but in error. And Pharaoh said, "Leave me to kill Moses, and let him call upon his Lord. Indeed, I fear that he will change your religion or that he will cause corruption to appear upon the earth." And Moses said, "Indeed, I have sought refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Account."

A believing man from the family of Pharaoh, who concealed his faith, said, “Will you kill a man because he says, ‘My Lord is Allah,’ while he has come to you with clear proofs from your Lord? And if he is a liar, upon him is his lie. But if he is truthful, some of what he promises you will befall you. Indeed, Allah guides not one who is a transgressor and a liar.” “O my people, yours is the kingdom this day, dominant upon the earth. But who will protect us from the punishment of Allah if it comes to us?” Pharaoh said, “I do not show you except what I see, and I do not guide you except to the path of right conduct.” And he who believed said, “O my people, indeed I fear for you like the Day of the Confederates - like the conduct of the people of Noah, ‘Aad, and Thamud, and those after them. And Allah does not intend injustice for His servants. And O my people, indeed I fear for you the Day of Calling - the Day when you will turn back and depart. You will have from Allah no protector. And he whom Allah sends astray - for him there is no guide.”

And Joseph had already come to you before with clear proofs, but you did not cease to be in doubt about that which he brought you until, when he died, you said, "God will never send after him a messenger." Thus does God leave astray he who is a transgressor and full of doubts. Those who dispute concerning the verses of God without any authority having come to them - great is hatred in the sight of God and in the hearts of those who believe. Thus does God set a seal upon the heart of every arrogant, tyrannical person.

And Pharaoh said, "O Haman, build me a tower that I may reach the ways - the ways of the heavens - and look upon the God of Moses. And indeed, I think he is a liar." And thus the evil of his deed was made attractive to Pharaoh, and he was averted from the way. And the plot of Pharaoh was only in ruin.

And he who believed said, "O my people, follow me; I will guide you to the path of right conduct." O my people, indeed this worldly life is only an enjoyment, and indeed, the Hereafter - that is the home of permanence. Whoever does evil will not be recompensed except the like thereof. And whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer - those will enter Paradise and will be provided for therein without account. And, O my people, why do I invite you to salvation and you invite me to the Fire? You invite me to disbelieve in Allah and associate with Him that of which I have no knowledge, while I invite you to the Exalted in Might, the Forgiving. There is no doubt that what you invite me to has no call in this world or in the Hereafter. And our return is to Allah, and the transgressors are the companions of the Fire. So you will remember what I say to you. And I entrust my affair to Allah. Indeed, Allah is Seeing of His servants. So Allah protected him from the evil of their plotting, and the people of Pharaoh were encompassed by an evil punishment. The Fire they are exposed to morning and evening. And on the Day the Hour appears, [it will be said], "Admit the people of Pharaoh into the severest punishment."

And when they dispute in the Fire, the weak will say to those who were arrogant, "Indeed, we were your followers, so can you relieve us of a share of the Fire?" Those who were arrogant will say, "Indeed, we are all in it." Indeed, Allah has judged between His servants. And those in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell, "Call upon your Lord to lighten for us a day of the punishment." They will say, "Did not your messengers come to you with clear proofs?" They will say, "Yes." They will say, "Then call upon Him." But the call of the disbelievers is not but in error. Indeed, We will support Our messengers and those who believe during worldly life and on the Day when the witnesses will stand. The Day when no excuse will benefit the wrongdoers, and for them is the curse, and for them is the worst home.

And We had certainly given Moses the guidance and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Scripture - a guidance and a reminder for those of understanding. So be patient. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And ask forgiveness for your sin and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord in the evening and the morning. Indeed, those who dispute concerning the verses of Allah without any authority having come to them - there is in their hearts nothing but pride - they will never attain it. So seek refuge in Allah. Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Seeing. Indeed, the creation of the heavens and the earth is greater than the creation of mankind, but most people do not know. And not equal are the blind and the seeing. And those who believe and do righteous deeds and the evildoer. Little do you remember.

The Hour is coming - there is no doubt about it - but most of the people do not believe. And your Lord says, "Call upon Me; I will respond to you." Indeed, those who disdain My worship will enter Hell [rendered] contemptible.

It is Allah who has made for you the night that you may rest therein and the day to see. Indeed, Allah is full of bounty to mankind, but most people do not give thanks. That is Allah, your Lord, the Creator of all things. There is no god except Him, so how are you deluded? Thus are deluded those who used to deny the verses of Allah. It is Allah who made for you the earth a resting place and the sky a canopy and shaped you and perfected your forms and provided for you from the good things. That is Allah, your Lord, so blessed is Allah, Lord of the worlds. He is the Ever-Living; there is no god except Him, so call upon Him, devoting to Him religion sincerely. All praise is due to Allah, Lord of the worlds. Say, "Indeed, I have been forbidden to worship those you invoke besides Allah when the clear proofs have come to me from my Lord, and I have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds."

It is He who created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot, then brings you forth as a child, then [He causes you] to reach your full strength, then [then] to become old men. And among you is he who takes [a soul] before [his death], and [then] you [may] reach a specified term that you may understand. It is He who gives life and causes death. And when He decrees a matter, He only says to it, “Be,” and it is.

Have you not seen those who dispute concerning the verses of Allah - how they are turned away? Those who deny the Book and that with which We sent Our messengers - they are going to know. When the shackles are around their necks and the chains, they are dragged. In scalding water, then into the Fire they are going to be burned. Then it will be said to them, "Where are those you used to associate with Allah?" They will say, "They have gone astray from us. Rather, we did not call upon anything before." Thus does Allah leave astray the disbelievers. That is because you used to exult upon the earth without right and because you used to be insolent. Enter the gates of Hell to abide therein. Wretched is the residence of the arrogant. So be patient. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And either We show you some of what We promise them or We take you in death - to Us they will be returned.

And We had certainly sent messengers before you, among them were those about whom We have told you and among them were those about whom We have not told you. And it is not for a messenger to bring a sign except by permission of Allah. So when the command of Allah comes, the matter will be decided with truth, and there the falsifiers will lose.

It is Allah who has made for you the grazing livestock that you may ride on some of them and eat from them - and for you therein are benefits and that you may attain through them a need in your hearts, and on them and in ships you are carried. And He shows you His signs - then which of the signs of Allah do you deny? Have they not traveled through the land and observed what was the end of those before them? They were more numerous than them and stronger in strength and in traces upon the land. But what they used to earn did not avail them. But when their messengers came to them with clear proofs, they rejoiced in what they had of knowledge, and that which they used to ridicule encompassed them. But when they saw Our punishment, they said, "We believe in Allah alone and disbelieve in that which we used to associate with Him." But their belief did not benefit them when they saw Our punishment. [This is] the way of Allah which has already occurred with His servants, and there the disbelievers lost out.

Ha Mim. A revelation from the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. A Book whose verses are detailed - an Arabic Qur'an for a people who know - as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. But most of them turn away - so they do not hear. And they say, "Our hearts are within coverings from that to which you invite us, and in our ears is deafness, and between us and you is a barrier, so work; indeed, we are working." Say, "I am only a human being like you, to whom it has been revealed that your god is one God, so be upright toward Him and ask His forgiveness." And woe to those who associate others with God - who do not give zakah and who, in the Hereafter, are disbelievers. Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds will have a reward uninterrupted.

Say, "Do you indeed disbelieve in He who created the earth in two days and attribute to Him rivals? That is the Lord of the worlds." And He placed therein firm mountains above it and blessed it and measured therein its sustenance in four days, equal for those who ask. Then He directed Himself to the heaven while it was smoke and said to it and to the earth, "Come in, willingly or by compulsion." They said, "We come in obedience." So He completed them as seven heavens in two days and inspired in each heaven its command. And We adorned the lowest heaven with lamps and as a preservation. That is the determination of the Almighty, the Knowing.

But if they turn away, say, "I have warned you of a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt of 'Aad and Thamud. When there came to them messengers from before them and behind them, "Worship none but Allah," they said, "If our Lord had willed, He could have sent down angels. But indeed, we, in that with which you have been sent, are disbelievers." As for 'Aad, they were arrogant upon the earth without right and said, "Who is stronger than us in strength?" Did they not see that Allah, who created them, was stronger than them in strength? And they used to deny Our signs. So We sent upon them a furious wind during days of misfortune that We might make them taste the punishment of disgrace in the life of this world. And the punishment of the Hereafter is more disgraceful, and they will not be aided. As for Thamud, We guided them, but they preferred blindness to guidance, so the thunderbolt of disgraceful punishment seized them for what they were earning. And We saved those who believed and were fearing Allah.

And on the Day when the enemies of Allah will be gathered to the Fire, they will be driven in ranks. Until, when they come to it, their hearing and their sight and their skins will testify against them as to what they used to do. And they will say to their skins, "Why did you testify against us?" They will say, "He has made us speak - He who has made all things speak. And He created you the first time, and to Him you will be returned." And you were not hiding yourself lest your hearing or your sight or your skins testify against you, but you assumed that Allah did not know much of what you do. And that assumption which you assumed about your Lord has ruined you, and you have become among the losers. So if they are patient, then the Fire will be their abode; but if they seek repentance, then they will not be among the repentant.

And We assigned to them companions who made attractive to them what was before them and what was behind them. And the word came into effect upon them among nations that passed on before them of jinn and mankind. Indeed, they were losers. And those who disbelieved said, "Do not listen to this Qur'an and speak noisily during it that you may overcome."
