So We will surely make those who disbelieved taste a severe punishment, and We will surely recompense them for the worst of what they used to do. That is the recompense of the enemies of Allah - the Fire; for them therein is an eternal home as recompense for what they used to deny, Our verses. And those who disbelieved said, "Our Lord, show us those who misled us among the jinn and mankind so that we may place them under our feet so that they will be among the lowest."

Indeed, those who have said, “Our Lord is Allah,” and then remained on a right course - the angels will descend upon them, [saying], “Do not fear and do not grieve but receive good tidings of Paradise, which you were promised. We are your allies in worldly life and in the Hereafter. And you will have therein whatever your souls desire, and you will have therein whatever you request. An accommodation from a Forgiving, Merciful.

And who is better in speech than one who invites to Allah and does righteousness and says, "Indeed, I am of the Muslims." Not equal are the good deed and the bad. Repel [evil] by that which is better, and thereupon he between whom and you there was enmity will become as though he was a devoted friend. And none is granted it except those who are patient, and none is granted it except one having great portion. But if an evil suggestion comes to you from Satan, then seek refuge in Allah. Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Knowing.

And among His signs are the night and the day and the sun and the moon. Do not prostrate to the sun or to the moon, but prostrate to Allah, who created them, if it is Him that you worship. But if they are arrogant - then those who are with your Lord exalt Him night and day, and they do not become weary. And among His signs is that you see the earth still, but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and swells. Indeed, He who gives life to it - He is the Giver of Life to the dead. Indeed, He is over all things competent.

Indeed, those who dispute concerning Our verses are not hidden from Us. Is he who is thrown into the Fire better or he who comes secure on the Day of Resurrection? Do whatever you will. Indeed, He is Seeing of what you do. Indeed, those who disbelieve in the message when it comes to them - and indeed, it is a mighty Book. Falsehood cannot approach it from before it or from behind it - a revelation from One Full of Wisdom, Worthy of Praise. Nothing is said to you except what was said to the messengers before you. Indeed, your Lord is the Possessor of forgiveness and the Possessor of painful punishment. And if We had made it a foreign Qur'an, they would have said, "Why are its verses not explained in detail? [Is it] a foreign [religion] and an Arabic [religion]?" Say, "It is, for those who believe, a guide and a healing." But as for those who do not believe - in their ears is deafness, and it is, upon them, blindness. Those are being called from a distant place.

And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture, but they differed therein. And had it not been for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been judged between them. And indeed, they are in disquieting doubt about it. Whoever does righteousness does so for [the benefit of] his own soul, and whoever does evil against it. And your Lord is not ever unjust to [His] servants.

To Him is referred the knowledge of the Hour. No fruits emerge from their coverings, and no female conceives or gives birth except with His knowledge. And the Day He will call to them, "Where are My partners?" They will say, "We have heard you, not one of us is a witness." And that which they used to invoke before has vanished from them, and they think that there is for them no escape.

Man never tires of praying for good, but if evil touches him, he becomes hopeless and despairing. And if We let him taste mercy from Us after an adversity has touched him, he will surely say, "This is for me, and I do not think the Hour will occur." And if I am returned to my Lord, I will surely have with Him the best. Then We will surely inform those who disbelieve of what they did, and We will surely make them taste a severe punishment. And when We bestow favor upon man, he turns away and distances himself. But if evil touches him, he is one of persistent supplication. Say, "Have you considered: if it is from Allah and then you disbelieve in it, who is more astray than one who is in extreme dissent?"

We will show them Our signs in the horizons and within themselves until it becomes clear to them that it is the truth. Is it not sufficient for your Lord that He is, over all things, a Witness? Unquestionably, they are in doubt about the meeting with their Lord. Unquestionably, He is, over all things, encompassing.

Ha Mim. Ain Qaf. Thus does Allah inspire you and those before you - Allah is the Exalted in Might, the Wise. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and He is the Most High, the Most Great. The heavens almost burst from above them, while the angels exalt [Allah] with praise of their Lord and ask forgiveness for those on the earth. Unquestionably, it is Allah who is the Forgiving, the Merciful. And those who take protectors other than Him - Allah is a Guardian over them, and you are not a guardian over them.

And thus We have revealed to you an Arabic Qur'an that you may warn the Mother of Towns and those around it and warn of the Day of Assembly, about which there is no doubt. A party will be in Paradise and a party in the Blaze. And if Allah had willed, He would have made them one community, but He will admit whom He wills into His mercy. And the wrongdoers will have neither protector nor helper. Or have they taken allies besides Him? But Allah is the Protector, and He gives life to the dead, and He is over all things competent. And whatever you differ over, its judgment is with Allah. That is Allah, my Lord. In Him I have relied, and to Him I turn back. Creator of the heavens and the earth. He has made for you mates from among yourselves and mates from the livestock. He multiplies you thereby. There is nothing like Him, and He is the Hearing, the Seeing. To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. He extends provision to whom He wills and restricts it. Indeed, He is Knowing of all things.

He has ordained for you of religion what He enjoined upon Noah and that which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus - [saying], "Establish the religion and do not be divided therein." Difficult for the polytheists is that to which you invite them. Allah chooses for Himself whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him]. And they did not become divided except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And had it not been for a word that preceded from your Lord for a specified term, it would have been judged between them. And indeed, those who were inherited the Scripture after them are in disquieting doubt about it. Therefore, invite [to Allah] and be steadfast as you have been commanded and do not follow their inclinations and say, "I have believed in what Allah has revealed of the Book, and I have been commanded to do justice between you. Allah is our Lord and your Lord. To us are our deeds, and to you are your deeds. There is no argument between us and you. Allah will gather us together, and to Him is the final destination."

And those who dispute about Allah after He has been responded to - their argument is worthless with their Lord, and upon them is wrath, and for them is a severe punishment. Allah is He who has sent down the Book in truth and the balance. And what can make you know that perhaps the Hour is near? Those who do not believe in it seek to hasten it, while those who believe are fearful of it and know that it is the truth. Unquestionably, those who dispute about the Hour are in extreme error. Allah is Kind to His servants. He provides for whom He wills. And He is the Strong, the Exalted in Might.

Whoever desires the harvest of the Hereafter - We increase for him his harvest. And whoever desires the harvest of this world - We give him thereof, but he has not in the Hereafter any share. Or have they partners who have instituted for them in religion that which Allah has not permitted? And were it not for the decisive word, the matter would have been judged between them. And indeed, for the wrongdoers is a painful punishment. You will see the wrongdoers fearful of that which they have earned and it will befall them. But those who have believed and done righteous deeds will be in the gardens of Paradise. They will have whatever they wish with their Lord. That is the great bounty.

That is what Allah gives good tidings to His servants who have believed and done righteous deeds. Say, "I do not ask of you any reward for it except love for the relatives. And whoever does good - We will increase for him good therein. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Appreciative." Or do they say, "He has invented a lie about Allah?" Then if Allah wills, He will set a seal upon your heart. And Allah will blot out falsehood and establish the truth with His words. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts. And it is He who accepts repentance from His servants and pardons misdeeds and knows what you do. And He responds to those who believe and do righteous deeds and increases them from His bounty. But as for the disbelievers, they will have a severe punishment.

And if Allah were to expand the provision for His servants, they would surely rebel upon the earth, but He sends down in due measure what He wills. Indeed, He is, of His servants, Knowing and Seeing. And it is He who sends down the rain after they have despaired and spreads His mercy. And He is the Protector, the Praiseworthy. And among His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and what He has dispersed throughout them of creatures. And He is Able to gather them when He wills. And whatever strikes you of disaster - it is for what your hands have earned. And He pardons much. And you will not cause failure upon the earth, and you have not besides Allah any protector or helper.

And among His signs are ships upon the sea like mountains. If He wills, He can still the wind, and they remain motionless on its back. Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful. Or He may destroy them for what they have earned and pardon much. And He knows that those who dispute concerning Our verses have no escape. Whatever you have been given is but the enjoyment of worldly life. But what is with Allah is better and more lasting for those who have believed and upon their Lord rely.

And those who avoid major sins and immoralities, and when they become angry, they forgive. And those who have responded to their Lord and established prayer and whose affair is [determined by] consultation among themselves, and from what We have provided them, they spend. And those who, when injustice befalls them, defend themselves. And the recompense for an evil is an evil like it. But whoever pardons and makes reconciliation, his reward is [due] from Allah. Indeed, He does not like wrongdoers. And whoever defends himself after having been wronged - against those there is no blame. The blame is only against those who wrong the people and rebel in the land without right. Those will have a painful punishment. And as for whoever is patient and forgives - indeed, that is of the matters [requiring] determination.

And he whom Allah sends astray - for him there is no protector after Him. And you will see the wrongdoers, when they see the punishment, saying, "Is there any way back?" And you will see them exposed to it, humbled by humiliation, looking from a hidden corner. And those who believed will say, "Indeed, the losers are those who will lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection." Unquestionably, the wrongdoers will be in an enduring punishment. And they will have no protectors to aid them other than Allah. And he whom Allah sends astray - for him there is no way.

Respond to your Lord before there comes from Allah a Day for which there is no repelling. That Day there will be for you no refuge, nor will there be for you any denunciation. But if they turn away, then We have not sent you over them as a guardian. Your duty is only to convey the message. And indeed, when We let man taste mercy from Us, he rejoices in it. But if evil befalls them for what their hands have put forth - then indeed, man is ungrateful. To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He creates what He wills. He gives to whom He wills female [children], and He gives to whom He wills males. Or He pairs them [with males and females] and He renders whom He wills barren. Indeed, He is Knowing and Competent.

It is not for a human being that Allah should speak to him except by revelation or from behind a veil or by sending a messenger to reveal by His permission what He wills. Indeed, He is Most High and Wise. And thus We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], a spirit of Our command. You did not know what the Book was, nor what faith was, but We have made it a light by which We guide whom We will of Our servants. And indeed, you [are] guiding to a straight path - the path of Allah to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Unquestionably, to Allah do all matters return.

Ha Mim. By the clear Book. Indeed, We have made it an Arabic Qur'an that you might understand. And indeed, it is in the Mother of the Book with Us, sublime and wise. Then shall We turn away from you the message because you are a transgressing people? And how many a prophet We sent among the former peoples! And there came not to them a prophet but they used to ridicule him. So We destroyed those stronger than them in force, and the example of the former peoples has passed.

And if you ask them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" they will surely say, "He created them, the Exalted in Might, the Knowing." He who made the earth a cradle for you and made for you therein paths that you may be guided. And He who sends down water from the sky in measured amounts, and We revive thereby a dead land. Thus will you be brought forth. And He who created all pairs and made for you ships and grazing livestock on which you ride, that you may mount on their backs and then remember the favor of your Lord when you are mounted thereon and say, "Glory be to Him who has subjected this to us, and we could never have subdued it." And indeed, to our Lord we will return.

And they have attributed to Him a portion of His servants. Indeed, man is clearly ungrateful. Or has He taken from what He creates daughters and preferred you with sons? And when one of them is given the news of that which is set forth for the Most Merciful as an example, his face darkens, and he is filled with inward grief. Or is one who is brought up in adornment while, in dispute, he is not clear? And they have made the angels, who are the servants of the Most Merciful, females. Did they witness their creation? Their testimony will be recorded, and they will be questioned. And they say, “If the Most Merciful had willed, we would not have worshipped them?” They have no knowledge of that. They are only guessing. Or have We given them a scripture before this so they cling to it? Rather, they say, “Indeed, we found our fathers following a religion, and indeed, we are, following in their footsteps.” And thus We did not send before you any warner to any city except that its affluent ones said, “Indeed, we found our fathers following a religion, and indeed, we are, following in their footsteps.” He said, “Even if I bring you better guidance than what you found your fathers following,” they said, “Indeed, we, in that with which you have been sent, are disbelievers.” So We took retribution from them; so see how was the end of the deniers.

And when Abraham said to his father and his people, "Indeed, I am disassociated from that which you worship. Except for He who created me, and indeed, He will guide me." And He made it a word remaining among his descendants that perhaps they would return.

Rather, We gave enjoyment to these and their fathers until there came to them the truth and a clear messenger. But when the truth came to them, they said, "This is magic, and indeed, we disbelieve in it." And they said, "Why was this Qur'an not sent down to some great man from the two cities?" Do they divide the mercy of your Lord? We have apportioned among them their livelihood in the life of this world and have raised some of them above others in degrees [of rank] so that they may take others for service. But the mercy of your Lord is better than what they accumulate. And had it not been that mankind would have become one community, We would have made for those who disbelieve in the Most Merciful roofs of silver for their houses and stairways upon which they ascend, and for their houses doors and couches upon which they recline, and adornments. And indeed, all that is but the enjoyment of worldly life, and the Hereafter, with your Lord, is for the righteous.

And whoever turns away from the remembrance of the Most Merciful - We appoint for him a devil, and he is to him a companion. And indeed, they avert them from the way, while they think that they are guided. Until, when he comes to Us, he will say, "Oh, would that between me and you were the distance of the two easts." What an evil companion! And it will not benefit you this Day, since you have wronged, that you are in the punishment sharing.

Can you then make the deaf hear or guide the blind and he who is in manifest error? Then whether We take you away - indeed, We will take retribution from them - or We show you what We have promised them - indeed, We are over them competent. So hold fast to that which has been revealed to you. Indeed, you are on a straight path. And indeed, it is a reminder for you and your people, and you will be questioned. And ask those We sent before you of Our messengers: Did We ever appoint other than the Most Merciful deities to be worshipped?

And We had certainly sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his chiefs. He said, "Indeed, I am the Messenger of the Lord of the worlds." But when he came to them with Our signs, at once they laughed at them. And We did not show them a sign except that it was greater than its predecessor. And We seized them with the punishment that perhaps they would return. And they said, "O magician, call upon your Lord for us according to what He has promised you. Indeed, we are [rightly] guided." But when We removed the punishment from them, at once they broke their promise. And Pharaoh called out among his people, saying, "O my people, is not mine the kingdom of Egypt, and these rivers flowing beneath me? Then do you not see? Or am I better than this one who is despised and can hardly make himself clear?" Why were bracelets of gold not cast upon him, or angels not brought with him in pairs? But he belittled his people, and they obeyed him. Indeed, they were a people wickedly. But when they angered Us, We took retribution from them and drowned them all. And We made them a precedent and an example for later generations.

And when the son of Mary was cited as an example, behold, your people turned away from him. And they said, “Are our gods better, or is he?” They only cite him to you out of argument. Rather, they are a quarrelsome people. He is only a servant upon whom We bestowed favor and made him an example for the Children of Israel. And if We willed, We could have made from you angels on the earth, succeeding [others]. And indeed, it is knowledge of the Hour, so have no doubt about it, and follow [them]. This is a straight path. And let not Satan avert you. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy. And when Jesus came with clear proofs, he said, “I have come to you with wisdom and to make clear to you some of that over which you differ. So fear Allah and obey me. Indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is a straight path.” Then the factions differed among themselves. So woe to those who do wrong from the punishment of a painful Day. Do they await anything but the Hour, that it should come upon them suddenly while they do not perceive?

Friends that Day will be enemies to one another, except for the righteous. [It will be said], “O My servants, no fear will there be concerning you this Day, nor will you grieve - those who believed in Our verses and were Muslims [in submission to Allah]. Enter Paradise, you and your spouses, in rejoicing.” There will be served to them with trays of gold and goblets, and therein will be whatever the souls desire and the eyes delight in, and you will abide therein eternally. And that is the Paradise which you have been made to inherit for what you used to do. For you therein is much fruit from which you eat.

Indeed, the criminals will abide eternally in the punishment of Hell. It will not cease for them, and they will therein remain in despair. And We did not wrong them, but it was they who were the wrongdoers. And they will cry, "O Malik, let your Lord put an end to us." He will say, "Indeed, you will remain." We have certainly brought you the truth, but most of you, to the truth, are averse. Or have they decided upon a matter? Then We will decide. Or do they think that We do not hear their secrets and their private conversations? Yes, and Our messengers are with them, writing down.

Say, "If the Most Gracious had a son, then I would be the first of his worshippers." Glory be to the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne, above what they describe. So leave them to plunge and play until they meet their Day which they are promised. And He is God in the heaven and God on the earth, and He is the Wise, the Knowing. Blessed is He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, and with Him is knowledge of the Hour, and to Him you will be returned. And those they invoke besides Him do not possess intercession, except for one who bears witness to the truth while they know. And if you ask them, "Who created them?" they will surely say, "God." So how are they deluded? And say, "O my Lord! These are a people who do not believe." So pardon them and say, "Peace." And they will soon know.

Ha Mim. By the clear Book. Indeed, We sent it down during a blessed night. Indeed, We were to warn. Therein is made distinct every matter of wisdom. [A] command from Us. Indeed, We were to send messengers. [A] mercy from your Lord. Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Knowing. Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, if you should be [certain] [in certainty]. There is no deity except Him. He gives life and causes death - your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers of old.

Rather, they are in doubt, playing. So await a Day when the sky will bring forth a visible smoke, covering the people. This is a painful punishment. Our Lord, remove from us the punishment. Indeed, we are believers. How can they receive the reminder when there has come to them a clear Messenger? Then they turned away from him and said, "A madman taught." Indeed, We will remove the punishment for a little. Indeed, you will return. The Day We will strike with the greatest strike. Indeed, We will be the Avenger.

And We had certainly tried before them the people of Pharaoh, and there had come to them a noble messenger, [saying], "Come to me the servants of Allah. Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger. And do not exalt yourselves against Allah. Indeed, I have come to you with clear authority. And I have sought refuge in my Lord and your Lord, lest you stone them. And if you do not believe me, then leave me." Then he called upon his Lord, "Indeed, these are a criminal people. So travel by night with My servants. Indeed, you will be pursued. And leave the sea in tranquility. Indeed, they are a drowned host." How many gardens and springs have they left behind. And crops and noble positions. And comfort in which they used to enjoy themselves. Thus did We cause another people to inherit it. And the heaven and the earth did not weep for them, nor were they reprieved. And We had certainly saved the Children of Israel from the humiliating punishment from Pharaoh. Indeed, he was haughty, of the transgressors. And We had certainly chosen them with knowledge over the worlds. And We gave them of the signs that in which was clear trial.

Indeed, these people say, "It is only our first death, and we will not be resurrected." So bring our fathers, if you should be truthful. Are they better or the people of Tubba' and those before them? We destroyed them. Indeed, they were criminals. And We did not create the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in play. We did not create them except in truth, but most of them do not know.

The Day of Judgment is their appointed time, all together. The Day when no protector will avail another protector at all, nor will they be aided - Except for him upon whom Allah has mercy. Indeed, it is He who is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful. Indeed, the tree of Zaqqum - food of the sinners - Like murky oil, boiling within bellies - Like the boiling of scalding water. Seize him and drag him into the midst of Hellfire. Then pour over his head some of the punishment of scalding water. Taste! Indeed, you are the Exalted in Might, the Generous. Indeed, this is what you were in doubt about.

Indeed, the righteous will be in a secure position. Among gardens and springs. They will wear fine silk and brocade, facing each other. Thus We will pair them with beautiful maidens with large, wide eyes. They will call therein for every fruit, secure. They will not taste death therein except the first death, and He will protect them from the punishment of Hellfire. [It is] a bounty from your Lord. That is what is the great attainment. We have only made it easy in your language that perhaps they will be reminded. So wait; indeed, they are waiting.

Ha Mim. The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise. Indeed, in the heavens and the earth are signs for the believers. And in your creation and what He disperses of moving creatures are signs for a people who are certain [in faith]. And the alternation of the night and the day and what Allah sends down from the sky of provision, giving life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness and the directing of the winds are signs for a people who reason. These are the signs of Allah which We recite to you in truth. So in what statement after Allah and His signs will they believe?

Woe to every slanderer and sinner. He hears the verses of Allah recited to him, then persists in arrogance as if he had not heard them. So give him tidings of a painful punishment. And when he learns something of Our verses, he takes them in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating punishment. Behind them is Hell, and what they have earned will not avail them at all, nor will what they have taken besides Allah as protectors. They will have a great punishment. This is guidance. But those who disbelieve in the verses of their Lord will have a punishment of painful punishment.

It is Allah who has subjected to you the sea that ships may sail therein by His command and that you may seek of His bounty and that you may be grateful. And He has subjected to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth - all from Him. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

Tell those who believe to forgive those who do not expect the days of Allah, that He may recompense a people for what they used to earn. Whoever does righteousness does so for his own soul, and whoever does evil does so against it. Then to your Lord you will be returned.

And We had certainly given the Children of Israel the Scripture and wisdom and prophethood, and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over the worlds. And We gave them clear proofs of the matter, but they did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ. Then We put you on a way of religion, so follow it and do not follow the inclinations of those who do not know. They will never avail you against Allah at all. And indeed, the wrongdoers are allies of one another. And Allah is the ally of the righteous. These are insights for the people and guidance and mercy for a people who are certain [in faith].

Or do those who commit evil deeds think that We will make them like those who believe and do righteous deeds - equal in their life and their death? Evil is that which they judge. And God created the heavens and the earth in truth so that every soul may be recompensed for what it has earned, and they will not be wronged.

Have you seen he who has taken as his god his own desire and Allah has sent him astray due to knowledge and has set a seal upon his hearing and his heart and put over his vision a veil? Then who will guide him after Allah? Then will you not be reminded? And they say, "There is not but our worldly life. We die and we live, and nothing destroys us except time." And they have no knowledge of that. They are only guessing. And when Our clear verses are recited to them, their only argument is that they say, "Bring our fathers, if you should be truthful." Say, "Allah gives you life, then causes you to die, then He will assemble you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt." But most of the people do not know.

To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. And on the Day the Hour will appear, that Day the falsifiers will lose. And you will see every nation kneeling. Every nation will be called to its book. Today you will be recompensed for what you used to do. This is Our book that speaks against you with truth. Indeed, We were recording what you used to do. But as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, their Lord will admit them to His mercy. That is what is the clear attainment. But as for those who disbelieved, "Were not My verses recited to you, and you were arrogant and were a criminal people?" And when it is said, "Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth and the Hour is about which there is no doubt," you say, "We do not know what the Hour is. We only assume an assumption, and we are not certain." And the evils of what they did will appear to them, and that which they used to ridicule will encompass them. And it will be said, "Today We will forget you as you forgot the meeting of this Day of yours. And your refuge will be the Fire, and you will have no helpers." That is because you took the verses of Allah in ridicule and the worldly life deceived you. So today they will not emerge from it, nor will they be asked to repent.
Praise be to God, Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, Lord of the worlds. To Him belongs majesty in the heavens and the earth. He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

Ha Mim. The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise. We did not create the heavens and the earth and all that is between them except in truth and for a specified term. And those who disbelieve, from that which they are warned, turn away. Say, Have you considered that which you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they have created of the earth, or do they have a share in the heavens? Bring me a book before this or a trace of knowledge, if you should be truthful. And who is more astray than he who invokes besides Allah those who will not respond to him until the Day of Resurrection, and they, of their invocation, are unaware.

And when mankind is gathered together, they will be their enemies and will be disbelievers in their worship. And when Our verses are recited to them as clear proofs, those who disbelieve say of the truth when it has come to them, "This is obvious magic." Or do they say, "He has invented it?" Say, "If I have invented it, then you will not possess for me anything against Allah. He is most knowing of what you conceal. Sufficient is He as a witness between me and you. And He is the Forgiving, the Merciful."

Say, "I am not an innovation among the messengers, and I do not know what will be done with me or with you. I only follow what is revealed to me. And I am not but a clear warner." Say, "Have you considered: if it is from Allah and you disbelieve in it and a witness from among the Children of Israel testifies to the like of it and believes, but you are arrogant? Indeed, Allah guides not the wrongdoing people." And those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "If it had been good, they would not have preceded us to it." And since they are not guided by it, they will say, "This is an ancient falsehood." And before it was the Scripture of Moses as a guide and a mercy. And this is a confirming Scripture in the Arabic tongue to warn those who do wrong and as good tidings to the doers of good. Indeed, those who say, "Our Lord is Allah" and then remain on a right course - no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve. Those are the companions of Paradise, abiding therein as recompense for what they used to do.

And We have enjoined upon man, to his parents, good treatment. His mother carried him with hardship and gave birth to him with hardship. And his gestation and weaning [period] is thirty months until, when he reaches maturity and reaches forty years, he says, "My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to do righteousness of which You approve. And make righteous for me my offspring. Indeed, I have repented to You, and indeed, I am of the Muslims." Those are the ones from whom We will accept the best of what they did and overlook their misdeeds. They will be among the companions of Paradise - the promise of truth which they were promised. And he who said to his parents, "Fie upon you! Do you promise me that I will be brought forth while generations before me have passed away?" And they both cry for help to God. Woe to you! Believe! Indeed, the promise of God is truth. He says, "This is not but legends of the former peoples." Those are the ones upon whom the Word has come into effect among nations that have passed on before them of jinn and mankind. Indeed, they were losers.

And for all are degrees according to what they have done, and that He may fully recompense them for their deeds, and they will not be wronged. And the Day those who disbelieved will be exposed to the Fire, [it will be said], “You consumed your good things in your worldly life and enjoyed them, so today you will be recompensed with the punishment of humiliation for being arrogant upon the earth without right and for being defiantly disobedient.”

And mention the brother of Aad, when he warned his people in Al-Ahqaf, although warners had passed before him and behind him, "Worship none but Allah. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous Day." They said, "Have you come to us to turn us away from our gods? Then bring to us what you threaten us, if you should be of the truthful." He said, "Knowledge is only with Allah, and I have conveyed to you that with which I have been sent, but I see that you are a people behaving ignorantly." But when they saw it as a cloud approaching their valleys, they said, "This is a cloud bringing us rain. Rather, it is that which you were impatient for - a wind within which is a painful punishment." It destroys everything by the command of its Lord. So in the morning nothing could be seen except their dwellings. Thus do We recompense the criminal people.

And We had certainly established them in that in which We had not established you, and We gave them hearing and sight and hearts. But their hearing, sight, and hearts availed them not at all, when they denied the signs of Allah, and that which they used to ridicule encompassed them. And We had certainly destroyed the towns around you and diversified the signs that perhaps they would return. So why did not those whom they took as deities besides Allah aid them? Rather, they have gone astray from them. That is their falsehood and that which they used to invent.

And [mention] when We directed to you a company of the jinn, listening to the Qur'an. And when they attended it, they said, "Listen quietly." And when it was concluded, they turned back to their people as warners. They said, "O our people, indeed we have heard a Book revealed after Moses, confirming what was before it, guiding to the truth and to a straight path. O our people, respond to the Caller of Allah and believe in him. He will forgive you some of your sins and protect you from a painful punishment. And whoever does not respond to the Caller of Allah - he will not escape [Allah's] on earth, and he will have no protectors besides Him. Those are in manifest error.

Have they not seen that God - He who created the heavens and the earth and was not weary in their creation - is able to give life to the dead? Yes, He is over all things competent. And the Day those who disbelieved will be exposed to the Fire - is this not the truth? They will say, "Yes, by our Lord." He will say, "Then taste the punishment for what you used to disbelieve." So be patient, as were patient the messengers of strong will, and do not be impatient over them - as if, on the Day they see that which they are promised, they had not remained [in the world] except for an hour of a day. [Proclaim], So are there any who are destroyed except the defiantly disobedient people?

Those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah - He will render worthless their deeds. But those who believe and do righteous deeds and believe in what was revealed to Muhammad - and it is the truth from their Lord - He will remove from them their misdeeds and amend their condition. That is because those who disbelieve follow falsehood, and those who believe follow the truth from their Lord. Thus Allah presents for the people their examples. So when you meet those who disbelieve, smite [their] necks until, when you have inflicted slaughter upon them, then secure [their] bonds. Then either [take] a favor afterwards or ransom [them] until the war lays down its burdens. That is so. And had Allah willed, He could have taken vengeance upon them, but [He intends] to test some of you by means of others. And [He says], "As for those who are killed in the way of Allah - never will He render worthless their deeds." He will guide them and amend their condition. And He will admit them to Paradise, which He has made known to them.

O you who have believed, if you support Allah, He will support you and plant firmly your feet. But as for those who disbelieve - for them is ruin, and He renders worthless their deeds. That is because they hated what Allah revealed, so He rendered worthless their deeds. Have they not traveled through the land and observed what was the end of those before them? Allah destroyed them and there is the like of it for the disbelievers. That is because Allah is the Protector of those who believe, and because the disbelievers have no protector.

Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. But those who disbelieve will enjoy themselves and eat as cattle eat, and the Fire will be their abode. And how many a city was stronger than your city which expelled you? We destroyed them, so there was none to help them. Is one who has a clear proof from his Lord like one to whom the evil of his deeds has been made pleasing and who follows his own desires? The description of Paradise, which the righteous have been promised: in it are rivers of water unaltered, rivers of milk the taste of which never changes, rivers of wine delicious to those who drink, and rivers of purified honey. And for them therein are all kinds of fruits and forgiveness from their Lord. It is like one who abides eternally in the Fire and is given to drink scalding water, which cuts through their intestines.

And among them are those who listen to you until, when they go out from you, they say to those who were given knowledge, "What did he say just now?" Those are the ones whose hearts Allah has sealed, and they follow their desires. And those who are guided - He increases them in guidance and gives them their righteousness. Do they await anything but the Hour that it should come upon them suddenly? But its signs have already come. So how will they be, when their reminder has come to them? So know that there is no god except Allah. And ask forgiveness for your sin and for the believing men and believing women. And Allah knows your [every] movement and your resting place.

And those who believe say, "Why was a surah not sent down?" But when a surah is sent down with decisive detail and fighting is mentioned therein, you see those in whose hearts is disease looking at you with a look of one fainting from death. So it is more appropriate for them to obey and speak equitably. But when the matter is decided, if they were true to Allah, it would be better for them. Then would you then, if you were given authority, cause corruption in the land and sever your ties of kinship? Those are the ones Allah has cursed, making them deaf and blinding their vision. Do they not then reflect upon the Qur'an, or are there locks upon their hearts?

Indeed, those who turned back after guidance had become clear to them - Satan enticed them and prolonged hope for them. That is because they said to those who hated what Allah revealed, "We will obey you in some of the matter." And Allah knows their secrets. So how will it be when the angels take their souls while they strike their faces and their backs? That is because they followed that which angered Allah and hated His approval, so He rendered worthless their deeds. Or do those in whose hearts is disease think that Allah will not bring to light their hatred?

And if We willed, We could have shown them to you, and you would have known them by their mark, and you will surely know them by the tone of their speech. And Allah knows your deeds. And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of Allah] and the steadfast, and We will make evident [your] news. Indeed, those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah and oppose the Messenger after guidance has become clear to them - never will they harm Allah at all, and He will render worthless their deeds.

O you who have believed, obey Allah and obey the Messenger and do not invalidate your deeds. Indeed, those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah and then die while they are disbelievers - never will Allah forgive them. So do not weaken and call for peace while you are superior. And Allah is with you and will never deprive you of your deeds. The life of this world is only play and amusement. And if you believe and fear Allah, He will give you your rewards and will not ask you for your wealth. If they ask you for it, He will withhold from you, and He will bring forth your grudges. Here you are, you are called upon to spend in the cause of Allah. But among you is he who is niggardly. And whoever is niggardly is niggardly only from himself. And Allah is the Free of need, while you are the poor. And if you turn away, He will replace you with another people; then they will not be the likes of you.

Indeed, We have granted you a clear conquest. That Allah may forgive you your past and future sins and complete His favor upon you and guide you to a straight path. And that Allah may support you with a mighty victory. It is He who has sent down tranquility into the hearts of the believers that they may increase in faith along with their [present] faith. And to Allah belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth. And ever is Allah Knowing and Wise.

That He may admit the believing men and believing women to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally, and He will remove from them their misdeeds. And that is, in the sight of Allah, a great attainment. And He will punish the hypocrites, men and hypocrites, and the polytheists, men and women, who think ill of Allah. Upon them is a cycle of evil, and the wrath and the curse of Allah are upon them and He has prepared for them Hell, and evil it is as a destination. And to Allah belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth, and ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.
Indeed, We have sent you as a witness and a bringer of good tidings and a warner that you may believe in Allah and His Messenger and support him and honor him and glorify Him morning and evening.

Indeed, those who pledge allegiance to you, [O Muhammad], are only pledging allegiance to Allah. The Hand of Allah is over their hands. So whoever breaks his pledge, he only breaks it to the detriment of his own soul. And whoever fulfills what he has pledged to Allah - He will give him a great reward. Those of the desert Arabs who stayed behind will say to you, "Our wealth and our families have occupied us, so ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say, "Who can control for you anything against Allah if He intends for you harm or intends for you benefit?" Rather, ever is Allah, with what you do, Acquainted. But you thought that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and that was made attractive to your hearts, and you assumed an evil assumption, and you were a people perishing. And whoever does not believe in Allah and His Messenger - then indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers a Blaze.

To God belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And ever is God Forgiving and Merciful. Those who stayed behind will say, “When you set out to take spoils, let us follow you.” They want to alter the words of God. Say, “You will not follow us.” Thus said God before. They will say, “Rather, you envy us.” Rather, they did not understand except a little.

Say to the desert Arabs who stayed behind, "You will be called to fight a people of great strength. You will fight them or they will submit. If you obey, Allah will give you a good reward. But if you turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment. There is no blame upon the blind or upon the lame or upon the ill. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger - He will admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow. But whoever turns away - He will punish him with a painful punishment."

Allah was pleased with the believers when they swore allegiance to you under the tree. He knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down tranquillity upon them and rewarded them with an imminent conquest and abundant spoils which they would take. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise. Allah promised you abundant spoils which you would take, so He hastened these for you and restrained the hands of the people from you and that it might be a sign for the believers and guide you to a straight path. And other things which you were not able to attain - Allah has encompassed them. And ever is Allah over all things competent. And if those who disbelieve fight you, they will surely turn their backs; then they will not find any protector or helper. This is the way of Allah which has already occurred before, and you will not find any change in the way of Allah.

And it is He who restrained their hands from you and your hands from them in the valley of Mecca after He had given you victory over them. And ever is Allah, of what you do, Seeing. They are the ones who disbelieved and hindered you from the Sacred Mosque and the offering was held back from reaching its destination. And had it not been for believing men and believing women whom you did not know, lest you trample them and there should befall you on their part a disgrace without knowledge - that Allah might admit into His mercy whom He willed. Had they separated themselves, We would have punished those who disbelieved among them with a painful punishment. When those who disbelieved put into their hearts arrogance - the arrogance of ignorance - then Allah sent down His tranquility upon His Messenger and upon the believers and made the word of piety binding upon them, and they were more deserving of it and worthy of it. And ever is Allah Knowing of all things.

Allah has fulfilled the vision of His Messenger with the truth: “You will surely enter the Sacred Mosque, if Allah wills, in safety, with your heads shaved or your hair cut short, having no fear.” He knew that which you did not know, and He has ordained, other than that, a near conquest. It is He who has sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion. And sufficient is Allah as Witness. Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah. And those with him are forceful against the disbelievers, merciful among themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating, seeking bounty from Allah and approval. Their mark is on their faces from the trace of prostration. That is their description in the Torah, and their description in the Gospel is like a seed that sends forth its shoot, then strengthens it, so it becomes thick and stands firmly on its stalk, delighting the sowers - that He may enrage the disbelievers through them. Allah has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds among them forgiveness and a great reward.

O you who have believed, do not put yourselves before Allah and His Messenger, and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing. O you who have believed, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet or be loud to him in speech like the loudness of some of you to others, lest your deeds become worthless while you perceive not. Indeed, those who lower their voices in the presence of the Messenger of Allah - those are the ones whose hearts Allah has tested for righteousness. For them is forgiveness and a great reward. Indeed, those who call to you from behind the chambers, most of them do not reason. And if they had been patient until you came out to them, it would have been better for them. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

O you who have believed, if there comes to you a disobedient one with information, investigate, lest you harm a people out of ignorance and become, over what you have done, regretful. And know that among you is the Messenger of Allah. If he were to obey you in much of the matter, you would be cursed. But Allah has endeared faith to you and has made it pleasing in your hearts and has made hateful to you disbelief, disobedience, and rebellion. Those are the [rightly] guided. [It is] bounty from Allah and favor. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.

And if two parties among the believers should fight, then make peace between them. But if one of them oppresses the other, then fight against the one that oppresses until it returns to the command of Allah. And if it returns, then make peace between them with justice and act equitably. Indeed, Allah loves those who act equitably. The believers are but brothers, so make peace between your two brothers. And fear Allah that you may receive mercy.

O you who have believed, let not a people ridicule [another] people; perhaps they may be better than them; nor let women ridicule [other] women; perhaps they may be better than them. And do not insult one another and do not call one another by [offensive] nicknames. Evil is the name of disobedience after faith. And whoever does not repent - then those are the wrongdoers. O you who have believed, avoid much [negative] assumption. Indeed, some assumptions are sin. And do not spy or backbite one another. Would one of you like to eat the flesh of his brother dead? You would detest it. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful. O mankind, indeed We have created you from male and female and made you peoples and tribes that you may know one another. Indeed, the most noble of you in the sight of Allah is the most righteous of you. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Acquainted.

The Bedouins say, "We have believed." Say, "You have not believed; but say, 'We have submitted,' for faith has not yet entered your hearts. And if you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not deprive you of anything of your deeds. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful." The believers are only those who have believed in Allah and His Messenger and then doubted not and striven with their wealth and their lives in the cause of Allah - those are the truthful. Say, "Do you teach Allah about your religion?" And Allah knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Allah is Knowing of all things. They do you a favor by [referring to] you [in Islam]. Say, "Do not do me a favor by your submission. Rather, Allah does you a favor by guiding you to the faith, if you should be truthful. Indeed, Allah knows the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is Seeing of what you do."

Qaf. By the Glorious Qur’an. Rather, they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves. So the disbelievers say, “This is an amazing thing. Is it when we die and become dust that is an impossible return?” Indeed, We know what the earth takes of them, and with Us is a record that preserves. Rather, they denied the truth when it came to them, so they are in a confused state. Have they not looked at the sky above them - how We constructed it and adorned it, and there are no rifts in it? And the earth - We have spread it out and cast therein firm mountains and caused to grow therein [something] of every beautiful kind - as insight and a reminder for every servant who turns [to Allah]. And We sent down from the sky blessed water, and We caused to grow thereby gardens and grain for harvest and tall palm trees with clustered dates - as provision for the servants. And We revive thereby a dead land. Thus is the emergence.

Before them, the people of Noah, the companions of Ar-Rass, and Thamud denied, as did Aad, Pharaoh, the brothers of Lot, the companions of the thicket, and the people of Tubba. All denied the messengers, so My threat came true. Have We become weary with the first creation? Rather, they are in doubt about a new creation.

And We have certainly created man, and We know what his soul whispers to him, and We are closer to him than his jugular vein. When the two receivers receive, seated on the right and on the left, not a word does he utter but there is by him an observer ready to record it. And the stupor of death will come in truth. That is what you were avoiding.

And the Trumpet will be blown, that is the Day of Threat. And every soul will come with it a driver and a witness, [saying], “Indeed, you were in heedlessness of this, so We have removed from you your covering, and your sight today is sharp.” And his companion will say, “This is what I have prepared.” Throw into Hell every obstinate disbeliever, a hinderer of good, an aggressor, a doubter, who has set up with Allah another god - so throw him into the severe punishment. His companion will say, “Our Lord, I did not make him transgress, but he was in error far astray.” He will say, “Do not dispute in My presence, while I have already presented to you the threat. The word in My presence will not be changed, and I am not unjust to the servants.” The Day We will say to Hell, “Are you filled?” and it will say, “Are there any more?” And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous, not far away. This is what you were promised - for everyone who frequently turns back [to Allah] and is mindful - who fears the Most Merciful unseen and comes with a heart turning [to Allah]. Enter it in peace. That is the Day of Eternity. They will have whatever they wish therein, and with Us is more.”

And how many a generation before them have We destroyed who were mightier than they in strength. So they searched through the lands. Is there any escape? Indeed in that is a reminder for whoever has a heart or listens while he is a witness. And We had certainly created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six days, and no fatigue touched Us. So be patient over what they say and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting. And during parts of the night exalt Him and at the ends of prostration. And listen on the Day when the crier will call from a place nearby. The Day they will hear the Shout in truth. That is the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and to Us is the final destination. The Day the earth will split open from them in haste. That is an easy gathering for Us. We are most knowing of what they say, and you are not a competitor over them. So remind with the Qur’an whoever fears My threat.

And the winds that scatter. And the winds that carry heavy loads. And the winds that run smoothly. And the winds that divide a matter. What you are promised is true. And indeed, the Recompense is coming to pass.

By the heaven of interwoven fabrics. Indeed, you are in a different statement. He who slanders it turns away. The liars are destroyed. They are those who are in the midst of heedlessness. They ask, "When is the Day of Judgment?" The Day they will be tested over the Fire. "Taste your trial. This is what you were hastening for."

Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and springs, accepting what their Lord has given them. Indeed, they were before that doers of good. They used to sleep but little of the night, and in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness. And in their wealth is a right for the needy and the deprived. And on the earth are signs for the certain [in faith]. And in yourselves - then will you not see? And in the heaven is your provision and that which you are promised. So by the Lord of the heaven and the earth, it is the truth, just as you speak.

Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham? When they entered upon him and said, "Peace." He said, "Peace be upon you, people unknown." He went to his family and brought a fattened calf and brought it near to them. He said, "Will you not eat?" But he felt fear of them. They said, "Do not fear, and give him good tidings of a learned boy." Then his wife came in a shriek and struck her face and said, "A barren old woman." They said, "Thus says your Lord. Indeed, it is He who is the Wise, the Knowing." He said, "Then what is your business, O messengers?" They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals to send upon them stones of clay, marked from your Lord for the transgressors." So We brought out whoever was therein of the believers. But We found therein not but one house of Muslims. And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.

And in Moses, when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority. But he turned away with his support and said, “A magician or a madman.” So We seized him and his soldiers and threw them into the sea, and he was blameworthy. And in Aad, when We sent upon them the barren wind. It did not leave anything it came upon except that it made it like chaff. And in Thamud, when it was said to them, “Enjoy yourselves for a time.” But they rebelled against the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them while they were looking on. So they were not able to stand, nor were they able to defend themselves. And [referring to] the people of Noah before. Indeed, they were a people of wickedness.

And the heaven We constructed with power, and indeed, We are expanding it. And the earth We spread out, and excellent are the spreaders. And of everything We created pairs that you may remember. So flee to Allah. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner. And do not make with Allah another deity. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.

Likewise, there came not to those before them a messenger but they said, "A magician or a madman." They enjoin one another to do so. Rather, they are a transgressing people. So turn away from them, for you are not to be blamed. And remind, for the reminder benefits the believers. And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me. I do not want from them any provision, nor do I want them to feed Me. Indeed, it is Allah who is the Provider, the Lord of strength, the Sturdy. So indeed, those who do wrong will have sins like the sins of their companions, so let them not be impatient. So woe to those who disbelieve from their Day which they are promised.

By the Mount. And by an inscribed Book. On parchment spread out. And by the frequented house. And by the raised ceiling. And by the filled sea. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord will come to pass. None can avert it. The Day the sky will sway with a sway. And the mountains will move. Then woe, that Day, to the deniers. Who are in vain play. The Day they are called to the fire of Hell. It will be called, [saying], “This is the Fire which you used to deny. Is this magic, or do you not see?” Enter it, and be patient or do not be patient. It is all the same for you. You will only be recompensed for what you used to do.

Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and bliss. Rejoicing in what their Lord has given them, and their Lord has protected them from the punishment of Hellfire. [They will say], "Eat and drink at ease for what you used to do." Reclining on lined couches, and We will marry them to fair women with large, beautiful eyes. And those who believed and whose offspring followed them in faith - We will join with them their offspring, and We will not deprive them of anything of their deeds. Every soul is pledged for what it has earned. And We will provide them with fruit and meat, whatever they desire. They will compete therein for a cup, in which there is no vain talk or sin. And there will circulate around them young boys as if they were hidden pearls. And they will turn to one another, asking one another. They will say, "Indeed, we were before among our families fearful. But God has been gracious to us and has protected us from the punishment of the scorching wind." Indeed, we used to call upon Him before. Indeed, it is He who is the Most Kind, the Most Merciful.

So remind, for you are not, by the grace of your Lord, a soothsayer or a madman. Or do they say, "He is a poet; we are awaiting for him a misfortune of time." Say, "Wait, for I am with you among those who wait."

Or do their dreams command them to do this, or are they a transgressing people? Or do they just say, "You say it"? Rather, they do not believe. So let them produce a statement like it, if they should be truthful. Or were they created by nothing, or are they the creators? Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Rather, they are not certain. Or do they have the treasures of your Lord, or are they the controllers? Or do they have a ladder by which they listen? So let their listener produce clear authority. Or do they have daughters, and you have sons? Or do you ask them for a reward, so they are burdened with debt? Or do they have the unseen, so they write down? Or do they intend a plan? Then those who disbelieve are the ones who are plotted against. Or do they have a deity other than Allah? Glory be to Allah, above what they associate with Him. And if they see a fragment of the sky falling, they say, "It is only clouds piled up." So leave them until they meet their Day on which they will be struck dumb - a Day when their plot will not avail them at all, nor will they be aided. And indeed, for those who do wrong is a punishment less than that, but most of them do not know.
And be patient for the decision of your Lord, for indeed, you are in Our eyes. And exalt [Allah] with praise when you rise. And during part of the night exalt Him and at the decline of the stars.

And the star when it goes down. Your companion has not strayed, nor has he erred. Nor does he speak from [his own] inclination. It is not but a revelation revealed. He was taught by one mighty in strength. Of great strength, he rose up. And he was at the highest horizon. Then he drew near and came down. And was two bow lengths away or even nearer. Then He revealed to His Servant what He revealed. The heart does not lie about what it has seen. Do you then dispute with him about what he sees? But he had already seen him at another descent. By the Lote Tree of the Limit. Near it is the Garden of Refuge. When that which covers the Lote Tree covers it. His sight did not swerve, nor did it transgress. He certainly saw of the greatest signs of his Lord.

Have you considered Al-Lat and Al-Uzza, and Manat, the third, the other? Is it for you the male and for Him the female? That, indeed, is an unfair division. They are not but names which you have named, you and your fathers, for which Allah has sent down no authority. They follow not except assumption and what their souls desire, and there has already come to them from their Lord guidance. Or does man have whatever he desires? To Allah belongs the Hereafter and the first [form of life]. And how many are there angels in the heavens whose intercession will not avail at all except after Allah has given permission to whom He wills and is pleased with. Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter name the angels with female names, but they have no knowledge thereof. They follow not except assumption, and indeed assumption avails not against the truth at all. So turn away from he who turns away from Our message and desires not except the life of this world. That is the extent of their knowledge. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has strayed from His way, and He is most knowing of who is guided.

To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, that He may reward those who do evil for what they have done and reward those who do good with goodness - [that is,] those who avoid major sins and immoralities, except minor ones. Indeed, your Lord is Vast in forgiveness. He is most knowing of you when He created you from the earth and when you were fetuses in the wombs of your mothers. So do not claim yourselves to be pure. He is most knowing of who fears Allah. Have you seen he who turns away and gives little and restricts? Does he have knowledge of the unseen so that he sees? Or has he not been informed of what is in the scriptures of Moses and Abraham, who fulfilled [his duty]? No soul shall bear the burden of another. And that man can have nothing but what he strives for. And that his striving will soon be seen. Then He will recompense him with the fullest recompense.

And that to your Lord is the final destination. And that it is He who makes laugh and weep. And that it is He who causes death and gives life. And that He created the two mates, the male and the female, from a sperm-drop when it is emitted. And that upon Him is the other creation. And that it is He who enriches and satisfies. And that it is He who is the Lord of Sirius. And that He destroyed the former 'Aad and Thamud, but He left nothing behind. And the people of Noah before. Indeed, they were more unjust and insolent. And the overturned city - He inclined. So that which covered it covered it. Then which of the favors of your Lord do you dispute? This is one of the first warnings.
The approaching end has drawn near. None can avert it but Allah. Is it at this statement that you marvel? And you laugh and do not weep, while you are heedless. So prostrate to Allah and worship Him.

The Hour has drawn near, and the moon has split. And if they see a sign, they turn away and say, "Persistent magic." But they deny and follow their own desires, and every matter is settled. And there has already come to them of the news that in which there is a deterrent - [that is] wisdom conclusive. But of no avail are the warnings. So turn away from them on the Day when the caller will call to a thing terrible. Their eyes humbled, they will emerge from the graves as if they were locusts scattered about. Hastening toward the caller, the disbelievers will say, "This is a difficult day."

The people of Noah denied before them. They denied Our servant and said, “He is mad,” and he was warned. But he called upon his Lord, “Indeed, I am overcome, so help.” Then We opened the gates of heaven with pouring water and caused springs to gush forth from the earth, and the waters met by a command already decreed. And We carried him on planks and nails, flowing under Our eyes as recompense for him who had disbelieved. And We have certainly left it as a sign, so is there any who will remember? But how was My punishment and my warnings? And We have certainly made the Qur’an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?

The tribe of Aad denied, so how was My punishment and My warnings? Indeed, We sent upon them a furious wind on a day of continuous misfortune, Which took away people as if they were trunks of uprooted palm trees. So how was My punishment and My warnings? And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?

Thamud denied the warnings. They said, "Is it only a human being from among us whom we should follow? Indeed, if we did, we would be in error and madness." Shall the Reminder be sent down to him from among us? Rather, he is a wicked liar. They will know tomorrow who is the wicked liar. Indeed, We are sending the she-camel as a trial for them, so watch them and be patient. And inform them that the water is to be divided between them, each drinking in turn. But they called to their companion, and he seized it and hamstrung it. "How [above was] My punishment and My warnings? Indeed, We sent upon them a single blast, and at once they were like dry stubble. And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?"

The people of Lot denied the warning. Indeed, We sent upon them a storm of stones, except for the family of Lot. We saved them at dawn [a favor from Us]. Thus do We reward the grateful. And he had already warned them of Our punishment, but they disputed concerning the warning. And they had certainly tried to seduce him from his guest, but We blinded their eyes, so taste My punishment and My warning. And indeed, a lasting punishment overtook them early in the morning. So taste My punishment and My warning. And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember? And the warnings had already come to the people of Pharaoh. They denied all Our signs, so We seized them with the grip of the Almighty, the Powerful.

Are your disbelievers better than those? Or have you an innocence in the scriptures? Or do they say, "We are all victorious"? The multitude will be defeated and they will turn their backs. Rather, the Hour is their appointed time, and the Hour is more grievous and bitter.

Indeed, the criminals are in error and madness. The Day they are dragged into the Fire on their faces, [it will be said], “Taste the touch of Hellfire.” Indeed, all things We created with predestination. And Our command is but one, like the blinking of an eye.

And We have certainly destroyed your followers, so is there any who will remember? And everything they did is in the books. And every small and great thing is recorded. Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and rivers, in a seat of truth near a Sovereign, All-Powerful.

The Most Gracious. He taught the Qur’an. He created man. He taught him clear speech. The sun and the moon [by precise calculation]. And the stars and the trees prostrate. And the heaven He raised and set the balance. Do not transgress within the balance. And establish weight in justice and do not make deficient the balance. And the earth He laid out for all creatures. Therein is fruit and palm trees having sheaths and grain having husks and fragrant herbs. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
He created man from clay like that of pottery. And He created the jinn from a smokeless flame of fire. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

Lord of the two Easts and Lord of the two Wests. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? He has released the two seas meeting together. Between them is a barrier which they do not transgress. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? He has issued from both of them pearls and coral. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? And to Him belong the ships, lofty heights in the sea like mountains. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

Everything on it will perish. But the Face of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor, will abide. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? He is questioned by whoever is in the heavens and the earth. Every day He is concerned with a matter. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? We will attend to you, O two heavy burdens. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

O company of jinn and mankind, if you are able to pass beyond the regions of the heavens and the earth, then pass. You will not pass except by authority. Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny? He will send upon you a flame of fire and copper, and you will not aid yourselves. Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

Then, when the heaven is split open and becomes rose-colored like oil, then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? On that Day no human being or jinn will be asked about his sin. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? The criminals will be known by their mark, and they will be seized by the forelocks and the feet. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? This is Hell, which the criminals deny. They will circulate between it and scalding water. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

And for him who fears standing before his Lord are two gardens. So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? Having spreading branches. So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? In them are two flowing springs. So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? In them are every kind of fruit in pairs. So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? Reclining on couches, their linings of fine brocade, and the fruit of the two gardens is near at hand. So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? In them are maidens limiting their glances, untouched before them by man or jinn. So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? As if they were rubies and coral. So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? Is the reward for good [anything] but good? So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? And below them are two gardens. So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? Deep in the sky. So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? In them are two flowing springs. So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? In them are fruits and palm trees and pomegranates. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? In them are good and beautiful things. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? Houris confined in pavilions. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? No man or jinn has touched them before them. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? Reclining on green cushions and beautiful velvet. Then which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? Blessed is the name of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor.

When the event occurs. There is no liar in its occurrence. Lowering, raising. When the earth shakes with a violent shaking. And the mountains are crushed. And become scattered dust. And you are three types. So the companions of the right - who are the companions of the right? And the companions of the left - who are the companions of the left? And the foremost - who are the foremost.

Those who are brought near. In the Gardens of Pleasure. A company of the former peoples. And a few of the latter. On couches lined up. Reclining on them, facing each other. Immortal youths will circulate around them. With goblets and pitchers and a cup from a pure flowing spring. They will not suffer headaches from it, nor will they suffer from intoxication. And fruit of whatever they choose. And the flesh of fowl of whatever they desire. And wide-eyed houris like hidden pearls. A reward for what they used to do. They will hear therein no idle talk or sin, except the saying, "Peace, peace."

And the companions of the right - what are the companions of the right? Among thornless lote trees And banana trees in layers And extended shade And flowing water And abundant fruit, Neither forbidden nor forbidden, And raised couches. Indeed, We created them of a special creation. And made them virgins, Loving of equal age. For the companions of the right - a group of the former peoples And a group of the latter peoples.

And the companions of the left - what are the companions of the left? In scorching winds and scalding water. And in the shade of scalding water. Neither cool nor generous. Indeed, they were before that in luxury. And they persisted in the grave perjury. And they used to say, “When we die and become dust and bones, shall we indeed be resurrected? Or our forefathers of old?” Say, “Indeed, the first and the last will be gathered together for an appointed time on a known Day.” Then indeed, you, O lost ones, the deniers, will eat from the tree of Zaqqum. And fill your bellies therewith. And drink thereon of scalding water. And drink as you drink running water. This is their lodging on the Day of Judgment.

We created you, so why do you not believe? Have you seen that which you wish for? Is it you who create it, or are We the Creator? We have decreed death among you, and We are not to be outdone. That We may substitute for you others like you and produce you in that which you do not know. And you have certainly known the first creation, so why do you not remember?

Have you seen what you till? Is it you who sow it, or are We the sower? If We willed, We could have made it debris, and you would continue to laugh. Indeed, we are the losers. Rather, we are the deprived. Have you seen the water that you drink? Is it you who sent it down from the clouds, or are We the sender? If We willed, We could have made it bitter, so why are you not grateful? Have you seen the fire which you kindle? Is it you who produced its tree, or are We the producer? We have made it a reminder and a provision for the needy. So exalt the name of your Lord, the Great.

So I swear by the positions of the stars. And indeed, it is a great oath, if you but knew. Indeed, it is a noble Qur’an. In a protected book. None touches it except the purified. A revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

Is it this statement that you are infatuated with? And that you make your provision that you lie? Then why, when it reaches the throat, and you are at that time looking on - And We are nearer to it than you, but you do not see - why, if you should not be held accountable, why do you not return it, if you should be truthful?

But if he was of those brought near [to Allah], then there will be comfort and basil and a garden of delight. But if he was of the companions of the right, then “Peace be upon you from the companions of the right.” But if he was of the deniers and those astray, then there will be an entertainment of scalding water and burning in Hellfire. Indeed, this is the truth with certainty. So exalt the name of your Lord, the Great.
