Have We not expanded your breast for you? And removed from you your burden which weighed upon your back? And raised high for you your repute?
Indeed, with hardship [will be] ease. Indeed, with hardship [will be] ease. So when you have finished, then strive [to do good], and to your Lord direct your longing.

By the fig and the olive, and Mount Sinai, and this secure city. Indeed, We created man in the best stature; then We return him to the lowest of the low, except for those who believe and do righteous deeds - for they will have a reward uninterrupted.
So what makes you deny the religion after that? Is not Allah the best of judges?
Read in the name of your Lord who created. Created man from a clot. Read, and your Lord is the Most Generous. Who taught by the pen. Taught man that which he knew not.
No indeed, man transgresses because he sees himself self-sufficient. Indeed, to your Lord is the return.

Have you seen him who forbids. A servant when he prays? Have you seen if he is on guidance? Or enjoins righteousness? Have you seen if he lies and turns away? Does he not know that Allah sees? No! If he does not desist, We will surely drag him by the forelock. A lying, sinful forelock. So let him call his group. We will call the guards of Hell. No! Do not obey him, but prostrate and draw near.

Indeed, We sent it down during the Night of Decree. And what can make you know what is the Night of Decree? The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months. The angels and the Spirit descend therein by permission of their Lord for every matter. Peace it is until the emergence of dawn.

Those who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists would not cease [from [disbelief] until there came to them clear evidence - a Messenger from Allah reciting purified pages in which were valuable scriptures. And those who were given the Scripture did not become divided until there came to them clear evidence. And they were commanded not except to worship Allah, devoting to Him religion, being true [in faith], and to establish prayer and to give zakah. And that is the right religion.

Indeed, those who disbelieve among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists will be in the Fire of Hell, abiding eternally therein. Those are the worst of creation. Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds - those are the best of creation. Their reward with their Lord is Gardens of Eden beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide eternally. Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him. That is for whoever fears his Lord.

When the earth is shaken with its [final] earthquake And the earth discharges its burdens And man says, "What is [wrong] with it?" That Day it will declare its news Because your Lord has inspired it. That Day mankind will come forth in separate groups to be seen for what they did. So whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it. And whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it.
By the charging horses, panting, By those striking sparks of fire, By those making a dawn raid, And raising up thereby dust, And driving into the midst of an army.

Indeed, man is ungrateful to his Lord. And indeed, he is, to that, a witness. And indeed, he is intense in his love of good. Does he not know when that which is in the graves is scattered and that which is in the breasts is exposed? Indeed, their Lord, that Day, is Acquainted with them.
The Calamity. What is the Calamity? And what can make you know what the Calamity is? The Day when people will be like scattered moths, and the mountains will be like carded wool.
But as for he whose scales are heavy, he will be in a pleasant life. But as for he whose scales are light, his mother will be the pit. And what can make you know what it is? A blazing Fire.
You are distracted by multiplying [things], until you visit the graves. No, you will surely know. Then no, you will surely know.
No, if you only knew with certainty, you would see Hell. Then you will see it with certainty. Then you will be asked that Day about pleasure.
By time. Indeed, mankind is in loss, Except for those who have believed and done righteous deeds and advised each other to truth and advised each other to patience.

Woe to every slanderer and backbiter. Who hoards wealth and counts it. Thinks that his wealth will make him immortal. No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher. And what can make you know what is the Crusher? It is the Fire of Allah, kindled, Which ascends to the hearts. It is locked upon them, On extended pillars.

Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the companions of the elephant? Did He not make their plot go astray? And He sent against them birds in flocks, striking them with stones of baked clay. And He made them like eaten straw.

For the mutual security of the Quraysh. Their mutual security for the winter and summer journeys. So let them worship the Lord of this House, Who has fed them against hunger and made them safe from fear.
Have you seen him who denies the Recompense? He is the one who drives away the orphan and does not encourage the feeding of the poor.
Woe to those who pray, but are heedless of their prayer, who are hypocrites, and who withhold provision.
Indeed, We have granted you, [O Muhammad], al-Kawthar. So pray to your Lord and sacrifice. Indeed, your enemy is the one cut off.

Say, "O disbelievers! I do not worship what you worship. Nor will you worship what I worship. Nor will I worship what you worship. Nor will you worship what I worship. To you be your religion, and to me mine."

When the help of Allah and the conquest come, and you see the people entering the religion of Allah in multitudes, then exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord and seek His forgiveness. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of repentance.

Perish the hands of Abu Lahab, and perish he! His wealth will not avail him, nor will he earn it. He will burn in a blazing Fire. And his wife, the carrier of firewood, will have a rope of palm fiber around her neck.
Say, “He is God, the One. God, the Eternal Refuge. He neither begets nor is born. And there is none comparable to Him.”

Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of the daybreak. From the evil of that which He created. And from the evil of darkness when it settles. And from the evil of those who blow on knots. And from the evil of an envier when he envies."
Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind, the King of mankind, the God of mankind, from the evil of the retreating whisperer, Who whispers in the hearts of mankind - from among jinn and mankind."
